fields.title: Almond soup
fields.ingredients:
225g/8oz blanched almonds,
minced
3 egg yolks, hard-boiled
1.2 litres/2pt chicken stock
25g/1oz butter, softened
25g/1oz plain flour
125ml/4fl oz single cream
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
Using a mortar and pestle, reduce
the almonds to a paste with the
egg yolks and 1 tablespoon of the
stock. Set aside.
\u2022 Make a beurre mani\u00e9 by working
the butter and flour together into a
smooth paste using a fork. Bring
the remaining stock to a simmer in
a heavy saucepan. Add the beurre
mani\u00e9 in small knobs, whisking
vigorously after each addition until
completely dissolved. Whisk in the
almond paste until smooth, then
cook gently for 30 minutes.
\u2022 Strain the soup through a sieve into
a clean pan. Add the cream, and
season with salt and pepper.
Reheat gently and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: almonds, egg, chicken stock, butter, flour, single cream, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Jerusalem artichoke soup
fields.ingredients:
1 onion, sliced
50g/2oz butter
700g/1.5 lb Jerusalem artichokes,
peeled and sliced
600ml/1pt milk
salt and ground white pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 In a heavy saucepan over a low
heat, gently sweat the onion in the
butter until soft and translucent.
\u2022 Add the artichokes to the onion.
Cook, covered, for 10 minutes,
stirring a few times.
\u2022 Add 600ml/1pint water and the
milk. Season with salt and pepper
to taste, and simmer slowly \u2013 do
not boil or the milk may curdle.
\u2022 Pur\u00e9e the soup using a blender or
food processor. Taste and add
more seasoning if needed. Reheat
gently and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: onion, butter, artichokes, milk, salt, white pepper

fields.title: Chilled avocado soup
fields.ingredients:
2 ripe avocados
600ml/1pt chicken stock
2 tablespoons lemon juice
2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives
1/2 teaspoon chilli powder
salt
2 tablespoons sour cream, to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Peel and stone the avocado. Blend
or process the flesh into a pur\u00e9e.
Add the remaining ingredients,
except the sour cream, and blend
until smooth. Allow to chill for a
few hours before serving.
\u2022 To serve, add the sour cream, stir
through and serve the soup chilled.
fields.ingredient_tags: avocados, chicken stock, lemon juice, chives, chilli powder, salt, sour cream

fields.title: Bacon & split pea soup
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz dried split peas
25g/1oz butter
1 garlic clove, finely chopped
1 onion, thinly sliced
175g/6oz long-grain rice
2 tablespoons tomato pur\u00e9e
1.2 litres/2pt vegetable stock
175g/6oz carrots, diced
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
4 tablespoons single cream
100g/4oz streaky bacon rashers
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
Cover the split peas with plenty of cold water, cover loosely and leave to
soak for at least 12 hours.
\u2022 Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan over a medium heat, add the garlic
and onion, and cook for 2\u20133 minutes until soft but not coloured. Add the
rice, drained soaked split peas and tomato pur\u00e9e, and cook for a further
2\u20133 minutes, stirring constantly to prevent sticking. Add the stock, bring
to the boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20\u201325 minutes until the
rice and peas are tender. Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
\u2022 Blend three-quarters of the soup in a blender or food processor to form a
smooth pur\u00e9e. Pour into the remaining soup in the saucepan. Add the
carrots and cook for a further 10\u201312 minutes until the carrots are tender.
\u2022 Stir in the parsley and single cream. Keep warm.
\u2022 Finely chop the bacon and put in a frying pan over a gentle heat. Saut\u00e9
until the bacon is crisp. Remove and drain on kitchen paper. Sprinkle
over the soup, and season well with salt and pepper. Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: peas, butter, garlic, onion, rice, tomato puree, vegetable stock, carrots, parsley, single cream, streaky bacon rashers, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Borscht
fields.ingredients:
900g/2lb large raw beetroot
225g/8oz onion, diced
225g/8oz leeks, sliced
2 celery sticks, chopped
50g/2oz butter
600ml/1pt chicken stock
1 bay leaf
150ml/5fl oz soured cream
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Boil the beetroot whole in salted
water for 15 minutes. Drain and
refresh in cold water. Peel and cut
into 2.5cm/1in chunks.
\u2022 In a frying pan, gently sweat the
onion, leek and celery in the butter
until softened. Add the beetroot,
stock and bay leaf. Bring to the
boil, skim the surface, reduce the
heat and simmer for 45 minutes.
\u2022 Discard the bay leaf, and pur\u00e9e
the soup in a blender or food
processor. Return to a clean pan,
season and bring back to the
simmer. Remove from the heat, stir
in the sour cream and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: beetroot, onion, leeks, celery sticks, butter, chicken stock, bay leaf, soured cream, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Boston bean soup
fields.ingredients:
850g/1.75lb canned cooked pinto
beans, drained
2 tomatoes, chopped
1 celery stick, sliced
1 medium onion, chopped
1 bay leaf
450ml/3
\u20444pt beef stock
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the beans, tomatoes, celery,
onion, bay leaf and stock in a
medium saucepan. Cover the pan,
and bring the mixture to the boil
over a medium-high heat.
\u2022 Reduce the heat and simmer for
about 20 minutes until the
vegetables are quite soft. Leave the
soup to sit, uncovered, for a further
20 minutes. Remove the bay leaf.
\u2022 Pure\u00e9 half the soup in a blender
or food processor. Mix into the
remaining soup. Season to taste
with salt and pepper, and serve
fields.ingredient_tags: beans, tomato, celery stick, onion, bay leaf, beef stock, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Carrot & coriander soup
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz onion, diced
50g/2oz butter
500g/1lb 2oz carrots, sliced
1 garlic clove, finely chopped
1.2 litres/2pt vegetable stock
2 teaspoons caster sugar
150ml/5fl oz whipping cream
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
coriander leaves
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 In a heavy saucepan, gently sweat
the onion in the butter until soft and
translucent. Add the carrots to the
pan, and cook, stirring from time to
time, for a further 5 minutes.
\u2022 Add the garlic and stock. Season
with salt and pepper and the
sugar. Bring to the boil, reduce the
heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
\u2022 Pour the contents of the pan into
a blender or food processor, and
blitz to a pur\u00e9e. Pour back into a
clean pan, and add the cream and
coriander. Taste and adjust the
seasoning, then heat the soup
through gently, stirring. Serve hot
fields.ingredient_tags: onion, butter, carrot, garlic, vegetable stock, sugar, whipping cream, coriander, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Catalan soup
fields.ingredients:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
900g/2lb beef mince
2 carrots, chopped
2 onions, chopped
2 tomatoes, chopped
25g/1oz plain flour
1.2 litres/2pt hot vegetable stock
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Heat the oil in a flameproof
casserole dish over a medium heat.
Saut\u00e9 the beef until it is just
cooked, then remove and keep to
one side. Saut\u00e9 the carrots, onions
and tomatoes in the same pan for
a few minutes, stirring continuously
to prevent sticking.
\u2022 Blend in the flour using a wooden
spoon, and cook for a few more
minutes. Return the cooked mince
to the casserole.
\u2022 Cover the mixture with the hot
stock, and simmer the soup gently
for about 45 minutes. Serve hot
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, beef mince, carrot, onion, tomato, flour, vegetable stock

fields.title: Cauliflower & walnut soup
fields.ingredients:
1 medium cauliflower, broken
into florets
1 onion, roughly chopped
450ml/3/4pt vegetable stock
450ml/3/4pt milk
25g/1oz walnut pieces
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
Put the cauliflower, onion and stock
in a large heavy saucepan. Bring
to the boil, cover and simmer for
about 15 minutes until soft.
\u2022 Add the milk and walnuts, and stir
through. Pur\u00e9e in a blender or food
processor until smooth.
\u2022 Return the soup to the pan. Season
to taste with salt and pepper, then
bring to the boil \u2013 be careful not to
scorch. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: cauliflower, onion, vegetable stock, milk, walnut, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Celery & Stilton soup
fields.ingredients:
4 celery sticks, finely chopped
1 onion, finely chopped
50g/2oz butter
45g/1.5oz plain flour 1/2 glass white wine
900ml/1.5pt chicken stock
300ml/10fl oz milk
225g/8oz crumbled Stilton
cheese
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 In a heavy saucepan over a low
heat, gently sweat the celery and
onion in butter until soft. Add the
flour and remove from the heat.
\u2022 Pour in the wine and stock, stirring
continuously. Return to the heat and
slowly bring to the boil, stirring
until the mixture thickens. Simmer
for 25 minutes.
\u2022 Add the milk, simmer for a further
2 minutes and remove from the
heat. Whisk in the Stilton.
\u2022 Pur\u00e9e the soup in a blender or
food processor, then push through
a sieve into a clean pan. Season
with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Reheat gently and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: celery sticks, onion, butter, flour, white wine, chicken stock, milk, stilton cheese, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Chicken soup
fields.ingredients:
1 roast chicken carcass with
meat left on
225g/8oz chicken wings
1 onion, diced
1 leek, diced
1 parsnip, diced
6 whole black peppercorns
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 150\u00b0C/300\u00b0F/
Gas mark 2. Put in a large heavy
saucepan with the chicken wings.
\u2022 Add the onion, leek and parsnip,
and bring to the boil. While the
water is heating, add the whole
peppercorns.
\u2022 Once the stock has boiled, transfer
to an ovenproof dish and cook in
the oven for 2 hours. Skim off any
scum from the surface using a
slotted spoon, and strain the stock
you have created. Discard
everything except for the chicken.
\u2022 When cool enough to handle, take
out the carcass and shred the
chicken before returning it to the
stock. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: chicken carcass, chicken wings, onion, leek, parsnip, peppercorns

fields.title: Chicken noodle soup
fields.ingredients:
900ml/1.5pt chicken stock
1 bay leaf
4 spring onions, sliced
225g/8oz button mushrooms,
sliced
100g/4oz cooked skinless
chicken breast, thinly sliced
50g/2oz soup pasta such as
orzo or ditalini
150ml/5fl oz dry white wine
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the stock and bay leaf into a
heavy pan, and bring to the boil.
Add the spring onions and
mushrooms to the simmering stock.
\u2022 Add the chicken to the soup, and
season with salt and pepper. Heat
through for 2\u20133 minutes.
\u2022 Add the pasta, cover and simmer
for 7\u20138 minutes.
\u2022 Just before serving, add the wine
and parsley, heat the soup through
for 2\u20133 minutes, then check the
seasoning and adjust if necessary.
Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: chicken stock, bay leaf, onion, mushrooms, chicken breast, pasta, white wine, parsley, salt, pepper

fields.title: Clam chowder
fields.ingredients:
8 celery sticks, chopped
700g/1.5lb onions, chopped
1.8kg/4lb red potatoes, diced
900g/2lb canned clams
with juice
3 teaspoons dried thyme
1 teaspoon dried oregano
2 teaspoons dried basil
225ml/8fl oz fish bouillon
2 teaspoons ground white pepper
225g/8oz butter
250g/9oz plain flour
3 garlic cloves, finely chopped
1.2 litres/2pt milk
fields.instructions:
Put the celery, onions, potatoes,
clams, thyme, oregano, basil,
bouillon and pepper in a large
heavy saucepan. Gently cook for
30\u201345 minutes until the vegetables
and potatoes are soft.
\u2022 To make a roux, melt the butter in
a small heavy pan, add the flour
and garlic, and stir constantly with
a wooden spoon for a few minutes
until slightly brown.
\u2022 Combine the roux with the
vegetable mixture and add the
milk. Stir well and cook for
10 minutes. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: celery, onion, potato, clams, thyme, oregano, basil, fish bouillon, white pepper, butter, flour, garlic, milk

fields.title: Cock-a-leekie
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb prunes, stoned
1.3kg/3lb boiling chicken
2.4 litres/4pt chicken stock
900g/2lb leeks, well rinsed
1 bouquet garni
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
Put the prunes in a bowl, cover with cold water and soak overnight.
\u2022 Set the chicken, breast-side down, in a large casserole dish. Pour in the
stock and bring to the boil, skimming off any scum from the surface.
\u2022 Using string, tie half the leeks in a bundle; thinly slice the remainder.
Add the bundle of leeks to the casserole dish with the bouquet garni and
a pinch of salt. Reduce the heat, part-cover and simmer for 2 hours.
\u2022 Lift out the chicken and keep to one side to cool slightly. Remove and
discard the bundle of leeks and bouquet garni. Drain the prunes, add
them to the casserole dish and simmer for 20 minutes.
\u2022 Shred the meat from the cooled chicken, discarding any skin and bones,
and add the meat to the soup. Season to taste with salt and pepper, then
add the sliced leeks. Simmer for a further 10 minutes, then serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: prunes, chicken, chicken stock, leeks, bouquet garni, salt, pepper

fields.title: Courgette & spinach soup
fields.ingredients:
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 onion, chopped
2 courgettes, chopped
1 potato, chopped
100g/4oz spinach, chopped
3 sprigs of fresh flat-leaf parsley
1.2 litres/2pt vegetable stock
150ml/5fl oz double cream
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
Heat the oil in a saucepan, and
sweat the onion and courgette until
the onion is transparent.
\u2022 Add the potato, spinach, parsley
and stock. Bring to the boil, reduce
the heat and simmer the soup for
20 minutes. Allow to cool before
blending or processing to a pur\u00e9e.
\u2022 Return the soup to a clean pan, stir
in the cream and season with salt
and pepper. Reheat gently without
boiling and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, onion, courgettes, potato, spinach, parsley, vegetable stock, double cream, salt, pepper

fields.title: Hot & sour soup
fields.ingredients:
8 dried shiitake mushrooms
25g/1oz cornflour
3 tablespoons dry sherry
100g/4oz pork loin
1.2 litres/2pt chicken stock
50g/2oz bamboo shoots, sliced
1 tablespoon light soy sauce
2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
1 egg, lightly beaten
225g/8oz tofu, diced
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
In a medium bowl, soak the mushrooms in warm water for 20 minutes,
then drain, squeeze out any excess moisture and cut into 1cm/1/2in slices.
\u2022 In a small dish, stir the cornflour into the sherry and set aside.
\u2022 Put the pork loin in a large heavy pan and completely cover with water.
Simmer until tender, then cool and shred.
\u2022 Bring the stock to the boil. Stir in the pork, mushrooms and bamboo shoots.
Simmer for 10 minutes, then stir in the soy sauce and red wine vinegar.
Season with salt and pepper, then stir in the reserved cornflour mixture.
Keep stirring until the soup has thickened.
\u2022 Remove from the heat and whisk in the egg. Mix in the tofu and heat
through. Serve the soup hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: mushrooms, cornflour, sherry, pork, chicken stock, bamboo shoots, soy sauce, red wine vinegar, egg, tofu, salt, pepper

fields.title: Fish chowder
fields.ingredients:
3 tablespoons olive oil
200g/7oz onion, finely chopped
200g/7oz celery, finely chopped
150g/5oz carrot, finely chopped
400g/14oz canned chopped
tomatoes
1 teaspoon finely chopped garlic
100g/4oz plain flour
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon dried marjoram
1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
2.4 litres/4pt fish stock
200g/7oz cooked boneless cod
fillets, flaked
25ml/1fl oz dark rum
25ml/1fl oz Worcestershire sauce
1 tablespoon Tabasco sauce
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
Heat the olive oil in a heavy saucepan over a medium heat. Sweat the
vegetables, tomatoes and garlic for 5 minutes, stirring continuously.
\u2022 Add the flour, cinnamon and herbs, and continue to cook for a further
2 minutes. Add the stock and bring to the boil, then crumble the fish into
the pan with the rum, Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco. Simmer for
1 hour, stirring occasionally.
\u2022 Season with salt and pepper, and serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, onion, celery, carrot, tomato, garlic, flour, cinnamon, marjoram, oregano, fish stock, cod, rum, worcestershire sauce, tabasco sauce, salt, pepper

fields.title: French bean soup
fields.ingredients:
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 onion, chopped
2 celery sticks, thinly sliced
3 garlic cloves, minced
550g/1lb 4oz canned cooked
cannellini beans, drained
400ml/14fl oz vegetable stock
125ml/4fl oz white wine
3 sprigs of fresh rosemary
1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper
100g/4oz mozzarella cheese,
grated
fields.instructions:
Heat the oil in a large saucepan
over a medium-high heat. Add the
onion, celery and garlic, and
sweat for 5 minutes until soft,
stirring frequently.
\u2022 Add the remaining ingredients
except the cheese, and bring the
mixture to the boil. Reduce the heat
and cover the pan, then simmer for
10\u201315 minutes.
\u2022 To serve, remove and discard the
rosemary sprigs. Ladle the soup
into warm bowls, and top each
serving with a little of the cheese.
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, onion, celery, garlic, beans, vegetable stock, white wine, rosemary, white pepper, mozzarella

fields.title: French onion soup
fields.ingredients:
900g/2lb onions, thinly sliced
50g/2oz butter
900ml/1.5pt vegetable stock
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Fry the onions very gently in the
butter in a covered saucepan for
15 minutes until soft and starting
to caramelize. Remove the lid,
increase the heat and fry, stirring,
for about 20 minutes until the
onions are a rich golden brown.
\u2022 Add the stock and bring to the
boil. Reduce the heat, part-cover
and simmer for 15 minutes. Season
with salt and pepper, and serve
fields.ingredient_tags: onion, butter, vegetable stock, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Gazpacho
fields.ingredients:
ingredients
2 large garlic cloves
1 egg yolk
1 thick slice bread, crust
removed
90ml/3fl oz olive oil
450g/1lb canned whole peeled
plum tomatoes
900g/2lb ripe tomatoes,
deseeded and chopped
1 large onion, choped
1 cucumber, peeled and
chopped
2 red peppers, seeded and
chopped
1 tablespoon tomato pur\u00e9e
sea salt and freshly ground
black pepper
2 lemons, cut into wedges,
to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the garlic, egg yolk and bread
in a blender or food processor.
With the motor running, slowly add
the oil in a thin steady stream until
the mixture turns to mayonnaise.
\u2022 Add the chopped tomatoes, onion,
cucumber, peppers and tomato
pur\u00e9e in batches, and continue
blending until smooth.
\u2022 Season with salt and pepper to
taste, and chill in the refrigerator
until ready to serve.
\u2022 Just before serving, check the
seasoning and adjust if necessary.
Serve cold with lemon wedges for
squeezing over
fields.ingredient_tags: garlic, egg, bread, olive oil, tomato, onion, cucumber, red peppers, tomato puree, salt, pepper, lemon

fields.title: Chilled cucumber soup
fields.ingredients:
1 onion, diced
50g/2oz butter
550g/1lb 4oz cucumber, diced
1.8 litres/3pt vegetable stock
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
parsley
juice of 1/2 lemon
600ml/1pt single cream
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
In a heavy saucepan, gently sweat
the onion in the butter until soft and
translucent, but not coloured. Add
the cucumber and continue to cook
gently for a further 5 minutes.
\u2022 Pour in the stock and bring to the
boil. Reduce the heat, season with
salt and pepper, and simmer for
5 minutes. Add the parsley and
lemon juice, and continue to cook
for a further 5 minutes.
\u2022 Blend or process the soup to a
pur\u00e9e. Allow to cool, then transfer
to the refrigerator to chill.
\u2022 When ready to serve, whisk in the
single cream. Serve chilled.
fields.ingredient_tags: onion, butter, cucumber, vegetable stock, parsley, lemon, single cream, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Leek & potato soup
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz butter
450g/1lb leeks, trimmed and
finely sliced
700g/1.5lb potatoes, roughly
chopped
900ml/1.5pt vegetable stock
4 sprigs of fresh rosemary
450ml/3/4pt milk
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
2 tablespoons cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Melt the butter in a large saucepan, add the leeks and sweat gently for
5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the potatoes, stock, rosemary and
milk. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat, cover and simmer gently for
20\u201325 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Remove from the heat.
\u2022 Cool for 10 minutes. Discard the rosemary, then pour into a blender or
food processor, and pur\u00e9e until smooth. Return to a clean pan, and stir in
the parsley and cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche. Season to taste. Reheat gently and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, leek, potato, vegetable stock, rosemary, milk, parsley, creme fraiche, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Beef & lentil soup
fields.ingredients:
300g/11oz dried red lentils,
picked and rinsed
225g/8oz stewing beef, cubed
1 leek, finely chopped
3 large carrots, finely chopped
2 celery sticks, finely chopped
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
2 onions, finely chopped
2 tablespoons plain flour
50ml/2fl oz dry white wine
fields.instructions:
Bring 1.8 litres/3pt water to the boil in a large heavy saucepan. Add the
lentils, beef, leek, carrots and celery. Return to the boil, then reduce the
heat, cover the pan and simmer for 40 minutes.
\u2022 Remove the beef, drain on kitchen paper and brown in the oil in a frying
pan over a high heat. When the pan is very hot, add the onions and saut\u00e9
for 15 minutes, stirring frequently. Sprinkle the flour over the onions and stir
with a wooden spoon until the flour browns.
\u2022 Pour 225ml/8fl oz of the lentil mixture over the onions and stir vigorously.
Add the white wine; cook for a further 1 minute. Tip the contents of the
frying pan into the lentil mixture. Simmer for 30 minutes before serving
fields.ingredient_tags: red lentil, beef, leek, carrot, celery, vegetable oil, onion, flour, white wine

fields.title: Lettuce soup
fields.ingredients:
700g/1.5lb lobster
100g/4oz butter
50g/2oz carrots, diced
1 small onion, chopped
1/2 bay leaf
pinch of thyme
2 sprigs of fresh flat-leaf parsley
3 tablespoons Cognac
75ml/3fl oz dry white wine
125ml/4fl oz fish stock
50g/2oz plain flour
350ml/12fl oz boiling milk
3 tablespoons double cream
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
Crack the lobster claws and cut the body and tail into four or five
pieces. Set aside.
\u2022 Saut\u00e9 the carrots and onion in 25g/1oz of the butter for 5 minutes. Add
the bay leaf, thyme, parsley and lobster, and cook for about 5 minutes
until the lobster turns red. Add 2 tablespoons of the Cognac and ignite.
\u2022 When the flames die down, add the wine and stock, and simmer for
20 minutes.
\u2022 Remove the meat from the lobster, reserving the shells and broth.
\u2022 Melt the remaining butter in a saucepan. Add the flour and cook, stirring
constantly, for 2 minutes to make a roux. Gradually add the boiling milk,
whisking or stirring with a wooden spoon until smooth.
\u2022 Crush the lobster shells and add to the sauce. Add the reserved broth
with the vegetables and simmer, covered, for 1 hour. Strain through a
sieve into a clean pan. Bring to the boil and stir in the cream.
\u2022 To serve, add the lobster meat and the remaining Cognac. Season with
salt and pepper, and serve hot
fields.ingredient_tags: lobster, butter, carrot, onion, bay leaf, thyme, parsley, cognac, white wine, fish stock, flour, milk, double cream, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Minestrone
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz carrot, chopped
100g/4oz celery, chopped
100g/4oz onion, chopped
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 tablespoon chopped
fresh basil
1 tablespoon chopped
fresh oregano 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper
425g/15oz canned cooked red
kidney beans, drained
400g/14oz canned chopped
tomatoes
150g/5oz cabbage, coarsely
chopped
1 courgette, chopped
75g/3oz soup pasta such as
orzo or ditalini
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Pour 900ml/1.5pt water into a
large heavy saucepan. Add the
carrot, celery, onion, garlic, basil,
oregano and pepper.
\u2022 Bring to the boil, then reduce the
heat. Cover the pan, and simmer
the mixture for 15 minutes.
\u2022 Add the kidney beans to the pan
with the tomatoes, cabbage,
courgette and pasta. Return to the
boil and reduce the heat. Cover the
pan and simmer for 5\u201310 minutes
until the pasta is cooked until al
dente. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: carrot, celery, onion, garlic, basil, oregano, pepper, beans, tomato, cabbage, courgette, soup pasta

fields.title: Mushroom soup
fields.ingredients:
350g/12oz mushrooms, finely
chopped
50g/2oz butter
3 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
2 tablespoons fresh breadcrumbs
(without any crust) 1/2 garlic clove
900ml /1.5 pt chicken stock
pinch of freshly grated nutmeg
2 tablespoons double cream
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Saut\u00e9 the mushroom with the butter
in a heavy saucepan for a few
minutes. Add the parsley and
cook, stirring, until soft.
\u2022 Add the breadcrumbs and garlic,
stir and pour in the chicken stock
with a pinch of nutmeg. Season
with salt and pepper. Bring to the
boil and simmer for 15 minutes.
\u2022 Pur\u00e9e the soup in a food processor
or blender until smooth. Return to a
clean pan, stir in the cream and
reheat gently. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: mushroom, butter, parsley, breadcrumb, garlic, chicken stock, nutmeg, double cream, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Mulligatawny
fields.ingredients:
1 garlic clove, minced
1/4 teaspoon ground cumin
6 cloves, finely crushed
1 tablespoon curry powder
1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
50g/2oz butter
1 roasting chicken, cut into serving pieces
3 celery sticks, thinly sliced
2 large onions, chopped
2 carrots, diced
1 leek, white part only, thinly sliced
2.4 litres/4pt chicken stock
salt and freshly ground black pepper
200g/7oz long-grain rice
2 dessert apples, peeled, cored and diced
225ml/8fl oz plain yogurt
2 tablespoons lemon juice
150ml/5fl oz whipping cream, gently warmed
fields.instructions:
Combine the garlic and spices. Melt the butter in a large heavy frying
pan over a medium-high heat. Add the chicken and saut\u00e9 until lightly
browned on all sides. Transfer the chicken to a casserole dish.
\u2022 Drain all but 1 tablespoon of the fat from the frying pan. Add the celery,
onion, carrot, leek and spice mixture, and blend well until the spices are
aromatic. Add a small ladle of stock and cook over a low heat, stirring
constantly, until the vegetables are tender. Add to the chicken.
\u2022 Stir the remaining stock into the casserole dish, and season with salt and
pepper. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
\u2022 Remove the chicken with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add the rice to
the soup and continue cooking for a further 15 minutes.
\u2022 When the chicken is cool enough to handle, cut into bite-sized pieces,
discarding the skin and bones. Return the chicken to the soup. Peel, core
and dice the apples, and blend into the soup with the yogurt. Simmer for
10 minutes.
\u2022 Stir in the lemon juice, then blend in the cream. Taste and adjust the
seasoning if necessary. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: garlic, cumin, curry powder, ginger, butter, chicken, celery, onion, carrot, leek, chicken stock, salt, black pepper, rice, apple, yogurt, lemon juice, whipping cream

fields.title: Oxtail soup
fields.ingredients:
25g/1oz beef dripping
2 oxtails
1 large onion, diced
1 carrot, diced
2 celery sticks
2 sprigs of fresh flat-leaf parsley
1 bay leaf
2 tablespoons pearl barley
1 tablespoon plain flour mixed
with 2 tablespoons water
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
Melt the dripping in a heavy
saucepan. Fry the oxtails, onion
and carrot until brown, then add
1.2 litres/2pt water.
\u2022 Tie the celery, parsley and bay leaf
together, and add to the soup.
\u2022 Bring to the boil, add the pearl
barley and simmer for 4 hours,
skimming off any scum that rises to
the surface.
\u2022 Remove the large bones and
celery, parsley and bay leaf, then
thicken the soup with the flour
paste, stirring all the while.
\u2022 Season with salt and pepper, and
serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: beef dripping, oxtail, onion, carrot, celery, parsley, bay leaf, pearl barley, flour, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Oyster soup
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz butter
50g/2oz plain flour
900ml/1.5pt fish stock
12 large oysters, shucked and
quartered
2 tablespoons finely chopped
fresh flat-leaf parsley
1 lemon, cut into wedges,
to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Heat the butter and, using a
wooden spoon, stir in the flour and
cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the stock
slowly, until smooth and thick.
\u2022 Put the oysters in the stock and
simmer for no more than 3 minutes.
\u2022 Sprinkle the soup with the parsley
and serve with lemon wedges.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, flour, fish stock, oyster, parsley, lemon

fields.title: Chilled pea soup
fields.ingredients:
1 large fennel bulb, coarsely
chopped
275g/10oz frozen peas, thawed
75ml/3fl oz double cream
1 teaspoon lemon liqueur such as
lemon schnapps or limoncello
1 teaspoon chopped spring onion
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint,
to garnish
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the fennel and 1.2 litres/2pt
water in a large pan over a
medium-high heat, and simmer for
10 minutes. Strain the fennel broth
and discard the solids.
\u2022 Pur\u00e9e the peas, cream, liqueur and
spring onions in a blender or food
processor. Season with salt and
pepper, then add the broth and
blend until smooth.
\u2022 Strain the soup through a sieve into
a metal bowl. Set in a larger bowl,
and fill the outer bowl with iced
water to reach halfway up side of
the inner bowl. Stir until the soup is
cold. Serve garnished with mint.
fields.ingredient_tags: fennel, pea, double cream, lemon liqueur, onion, salt, black pepper, mint

fields.title: Pea & mint soup
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb frozen peas
900ml/1.5pt vegetable stock
pinch of granulated sugar
1 large sprig of fresh mint
1 egg yolk
50ml/2fl oz single cream
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the peas in a large pan with
the stock, sugar, mint and a little
salt and pepper. Bring to the boil,
reduce the heat, cover and simmer
for 15 minutes.
\u2022 Discard the mint, then pur\u00e9e the
mixture in a blender or food
processor. Return to the heat.
\u2022 Blend the egg yolk with half the
cream and stir into the soup. Return
the soup to a clean pan and
reheat, but do not allow to boil.
\u2022 Taste and adjust the seasoning if
necessary. Serve garnished with
the remaining cream.
fields.ingredient_tags: peas, vegetable stock, sugar, mint, egg, single cream, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Potato soup
fields.ingredients:
8 rashers back bacon
200g/7oz onion, chopped
450g/1lb potatoes, cubed
275g/10oz canned condensed
chicken soup
600ml/1pt milk
1 teaspoon dried dill
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
In a large saucepan, saut\u00e9 the
bacon until crisp. Remove and
drain on kitchen paper. Saut\u00e9 the
onions in the bacon fat over a
medium heat until soft and golden.
\u2022 Add the potatoes and enough
water to cover. Cover the pan, and
cook for 15\u201320 minutes until the
potatoes are tender.
\u2022 Stir together the condensed soup
and milk until smooth, and add to
potato mixture. Heat but do not
allow to boil. Season with salt and
pepper to taste, and stir in the dill.
\u2022 Crumble the bacon and sprinkle on
top to garnish. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: bacon, onion, potato, chicken soup, milk, dill, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Spinach, feta & pear salad
fields.ingredients:
2 dessert pears such as Comice,
peeled, cored and sliced
4 tablespoons walnut oil
100g/4oz baby spinach leaves
175g/6oz feta cheese, diced
75g/3oz walnut pieces
1 teaspoon freshly squeezed
lemon juice
freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Toss the pears in a little of the oil.
\u2022 In a large salad bowl, combine the
spinach, feta cheese and walnut
pieces. Gently stir in the pears.
\u2022 Whisk together the lemon juice
and remaining oil, and season with
pepper. Drizzle over the salad.
\u2022 Refrigerate, covered, until required.
fields.ingredient_tags: pears, walnut oil, spinach leaves, feta cheese, walnuts, lemon juice, black pepper

fields.title: Grilled artichoke salad
fields.ingredients:
400g/14oz canned artichoke
hearts, drained and halved
olive oil for brushing
3 Little Gem lettuces
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
For the dressing
200ml/7fl oz extra virgin
olive oil
200ml/7fl oz grapeseed oil
125ml/4fl oz white wine vinegar
pinch of granulated sugar
pinch of mustard powder
2 garlic cloves, crushed
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the grill until hot. Season
the artichoke hearts with salt and
pepper, and brush with olive oil.
Grill until charred round the edges.
\u2022 To make the dressing, put the oils,
vinegar, sugar, mustard powder
and garlic into a large screwtop
glass jar. Seal the jar and shake
well. Season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Toss the lettuces in the dressing
with the artichokes, and serve
fields.ingredient_tags: artichokes, olive oil, lettuce, black pepper, white wine vinegar, sugar, mustard powder, garlic

fields.title: Tuscan bean & tuna salad
fields.ingredients:
1 small onion, finely chopped
2 x 400g/14oz cans butter
beans, drained
2 tomatoes, cut into wedges
175g/6oz canned tuna in oil,
drained
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
For the dressing
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed
lemon juice
2 teaspoons clear honey
1 garlic clove, crushed
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the onion and butter beans in a
bowl, and mix well. Add the
tomatoes. Flake the tuna with a
fork, and add it to the mixture
together with the parsley.
\u2022 To make the dressing, mix together
the oil, lemon juice, honey and
garlic in a screwtop glass jar. Seal
the jar tightly, and shake until the
dressing thickens.
\u2022 Pour the dressing over the salad.
Toss the ingredients together, and
serve straight away
fields.ingredient_tags: onions, butter beans, tomatoes, canned tuna, parsley, olive oil, lemon juice, honey, garlic

fields.title: Prawn salad
fields.ingredients:
900g/2lb raw prawns
100g/4oz celery, finely
chopped
450g/1lb canned pineapple
chunks, drained
75g/3oz raisins
125ml/4fl oz mayonnaise
2 teaspoons curry powder
4 pitta breads
4 leaves of lettuce
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Bring a saucepan of water to the
boil, add the prawns and cook for
3\u20135 minutes until the prawns turn
pink. Drain and rinse with cold
water. Peel and devein the prawns.
\u2022 In a bowl, combine the prawns
and the remaining ingredients,
except the pitta bread and lettuce.
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour
before serving.
\u2022 Serve the prawn salad in the pitta
bread with the lettuce leaves.
fields.ingredient_tags: prawns, celery, pineapples, raisins, mayonnaise, curry powder, pitta breads, lettuce

fields.title: Classic Caesar salad
fields.ingredients:
1 small baguette
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 garlic cloves, halved
4 back bacon rashers, trimmed
of fat
2 Cos lettuces
10 anchovy fillets in oil, drained
and halved lengthways
100g/4oz Parmesan cheese,
freghly grated
For the dressing
1 egg yolk
2 garlic cloves, crushed
2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
2 anchovy fillets in oil, drained
2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
175ml/6fl oz olive oil
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 To make the cro\u00fbtons, cut the baguette into 15 thin slices, and brush
both sides of each slice with the oil. Spread the slices out on a baking
tray, and bake for 10\u20135 minutes until golden brown. Leave to cool
slightly, then rub each side of each slice of bread with the cut edge of a
garlic clove. Cut each slice into small cubes.
\u2022 Cook the bacon under a hot grill until crisp. Drain on kitchen paper until
cooled, then break into chunky pieces.
\u2022 Tear the lettuce leaves into pieces, and put in a large serving bowl with
the bacon, anchovies, cro\u00fbtons and Parmesan.
\u2022 For the dressing, put the egg yolks, garlic, mustard, anchovies, vinegar
and Worcestershire sauce in a blender or food processor. Season with
salt and pepper, and process for 20 seconds or until smooth. With the
motor running, gradually add the oil in a thin stream until the dressing is
thick and creamy.
\u2022 Drizzle the dressing over the salad, and toss very gently until well
distributed. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: baguettes, olive oil, garlic, bacon, lettuce, anchovy fillets, parmesan cheese, eggs, garlic, mustard, white winne vinegar, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Mussel salad
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb new potatoes
900g/2lb black mussels
175ml/6fl oz dry white wine
1 small onion, sliced
2 sprigs of fresh thyme
2 bay leaves
pinch of saffron threads
4 tablespoons sour cream
2 teaspoons chopped fresh parsley
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the potatoes in a pan of cold, lightly salted water. Bring to the boil,
then reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain
and leave to cool.
\u2022 Scrub the mussels with a stiff brush and pull out the hairy beards.
Discard any broken mussels, or open ones that don\u2019t close when tapped
on the work surface. Rinse well. Put the wine, onion, thyme, bay leaves
and half the mussels in a saucepan with a tight-fitting lid. Cover and
cook over a high heat, stirring once, for 4\u20135 minutes until the mussels
start to open. Remove the mussels as they open (discard any that remain
closed). Cook the remaining mussels the same way and leave to cool.
\u2022 Reserve 125ml/4fl oz of the mussel cooking liquid and strain. While it is
still warm, stir in the saffron. Whisk in the sour cream and season well.
\u2022 Cut the potatoes into quarters. Remove the mussels and discard the
shells. Combine the potatoes and mussels in a bowl, and add the saffron
dressing. Sprinkle with the parsley, and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: potatoes, mussels, white wine, onions, thyme, bay leaves, saffron threads, sour cream, parsley, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Spicy noodle salad
fields.ingredients:
250g/9oz cooked rice noodles
175g/6oz broccoli, blanched
175g/6oz mangetout, blanched
2 teaspoons sesame oil
2 tablespoons plum sauce
4 tablespoons soy sauce
sliced spring onions, to serve
chopped fresh red chillies,
to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 In a large bowl, mix the noodles
with the broccoli and mangetout,
and toss with the sesame oil, plum
sauce and soy sauce.
\u2022 Sprinkle with the spring onions and
chillies, and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: rice noodles, broccoli, mangetout, sesame oil, plum sauce, soy sauce, onions, red chillies

fields.title: Waldorf chicken salad
fields.ingredients:
500g/1lb 2oz red apples
3 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lemon juice
150ml/5fl oz mayonnaise
1 bunch of celery, thinly sliced
4 shallots, sliced
1 garlic clove, crushed
75g/3oz walnuts, chopped
500g/1lb 2oz skinless lean
cooked chicken, cubed
1 Cos lettuce
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Quarter, core and dice the apples.
Put the diced apple in a bowl with
the lemon juice and 1 tablespoon
of the mayonnaise. Cover with
cling film; leave for 40 minutes.
\u2022 Add the celery, shallots, garlic and
walnuts to the apple, mix then add
the remaining mayonnaise and
blend thoroughly. Add the chicken
and mix well.
\u2022 Line a salad bowl with the lettuce
leaves. Pile the chicken salad into
the centre, season and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: red apples, lemon juice, mayonnaise, celery, shallots, garlic, walnuts, chicken, lettuce, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Asparagus & potato salad
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb small waxy potatoes
125ml/4fl oz extra virgin olive oil
2 shallots, finely chopped)
4 tablespoons white wine vinegar
900g/2lb fresh asparagus tips or
young asparagus, trimmed
225g/8oz young spinach leaves,
rinsed and drained
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0C/425\u00b0F/Gas mark 7.
\u2022 Put the potatoes in a roasting tin, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the oil
and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 20\u201330 minutes until just soft
to the centre, then cool.
\u2022 Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk together some salt, pepper, the
shallots, vinegar and the remaining oil. Slice the potatoes thickly, put into
a large bowl, pour the dressing over and marinate for 10 minutes.
\u2022 Cook the asparagus in lightly salted boiling water for 3\u20134 minutes. Drain
carefully, and put into a bowl of ice-cold water to retain the colour and
stop the spears cooking further. Drain again, then add to the potatoes
with the spinach. Toss together carefully, and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: potatoes, olive oil, white wine vinegar, asparagus, spinach, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Crab & crispy noodles
fields.ingredients:
vegetable oil for deep-frying
50g/2oz Chinese rice noodles
2 cooked crabs
100g/4oz alfalfa sprouts
1 small iceberg lettuce
4 sprigs of fresh coriander,
chopped
1 tomato, peeled and diced
4 sprigs of fresh mint, roughly
chopped
For the dressing
50ml/2fl oz vegetable oil
1 tablespoon sesame oil
1\u20442 fresh red chilli, seeded and
finely chopped
1 piece preserved stem ginger in
syrup, cut into strips, drained,
and 2 teaspoons syrup reserved
2 teaspoons light soy sauce
juice of 1
\u20442 lime
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the dressing, combine the vegetable and sesame oils in a bowl.
Add the chilli, ginger and syrup, soy sauce and lime juice.
\u2022 Heat the oil in a wok over a high heat. Fry the noodles, one handful at
a time, until crisp. Lift out and drain on kitchen paper.
\u2022 Flake the white crabmeat into a bowl, and mix well with the alfalfa
sprouts. Put the lettuce, coriander, tomato and mint in a serving bowl,
pour the dressing over and toss lightly. Place a nest of noodles on top,
then add the crabmeat and alfalfa sprouts. Serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, rice noodles, crabs, lettuuce,

fields.title: Simple bean salad
fields.ingredients:
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 garlic cloves, sliced
2 x 400g/14oz cans flageolet
beans, drained and rinsed
extra virgin olive oil for drizzling
2 tablespoons basil pesto
freshly squeezed lemon juice
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
small handful of fresh basil
leaves
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Heat the oil in a small heavy pan.
Saut\u00e9 the garlic until golden but
not scorched. Stir in the beans,
then leave to marinate in the oil for
10\u201315 minutes.
\u2022 When ready to serve, drizzle a
little oil over until the beans are
generously coated, then add the
pesto sauce and lemon juice to
taste. Season with salt and pepper,
then stir in the basil leaves. Serve
straight away.
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, garlic, beans, basil pesto, lemon juice, salt, black pepper, basil leaves

fields.title: Tomato & bean salad
fields.ingredients:
225g/8oz broad beans
225g/8oz French beans, topped
and tailed
150ml/5fl oz olive oil
1 garlic clove, crushed
2 tablespoons lemon juice
3 tablespoons chopped
fresh basil leaves
100g/4oz mozzarella cheese,
diced
700g cherry tomatoes,
halved
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Cook the broad beans in lightly
salted boiling water for about
3 minutes, then drain.
\u2022 Cook the French beans in lightly
salted boiling salted water for
7\u201310 minutes, then drain.
\u2022 Put the oil, garlic and lemon juice
in a blender or food processor,
and whiz to combine. Stir in the
chopped basil and seasoning.
\u2022 Mix together the beans, mozzarella
and tomatoes. Pour the dressing
over and stir to coat completely.
Cover and marinate for at least
1 hour before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: beans, olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, basil leaves, mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Crab, melon & cucumber
fields.ingredients:
2 tablespoons white wine
vinegar
150ml/5 fl oz olive oil
salt and ground black pepper
2 tablespoons pickled ginger,
chopped
2.5cm/1in piece of fresh root
ginger, peeled and grated
225g/8oz fresh cooked white
crabmeat, flaked
1 large head chicory, trimmed
and leaves separated 1/2 cucumber, seeded and pared
into ribbons
1 charentais melon, peeled,
seeded and cut into quarters
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Whisk together the vinegar and oil,
and season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, toss the crabmeat in half
the dressing. Add the pickled
ginger and root ginger.
\u2022 Arrange a few chicory leaves,
cucumber ribbons and a melon
quarter on each of four serving
plates. Spoon the crabmeat and
remaining dressing over the top,
and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: white wine vinegar, olive oil, salt, black pepper, pickled ginger, ginger, crabmeat, cucumbers, melons

fields.title: Black bean & salsa salad
fields.ingredients:
425g/15oz canned sweetcorn
kernels, drained
425g/15oz canned black
beans, drained
200g/7oz celery, chopped
100g/4oz onion, chopped
50g/2oz fresh coriander,
chopped
175g/6oz ready-prepared salsa
25ml/1fl oz red wine vinegar
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the sweetcorn, beans, celery,
onion and coriander in a large
bowl, and mix well. Blend the
salsa and vinegar together. Pour
over the salad, and toss well.
\u2022 Cover and refrigerate for at least
1 hour before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: canned sweetcorn, kernels, black beans, celery, onions, coriander, salsa, red wine vinegar

fields.title: Tofu salad
fields.ingredients:
225g/8oz firm tofu, cut into
2cm/3/4in cubes
100g/4oz mangetout, cut into
3cm/1.25in lengths
2 small carrots, cut into matchsticks
100g/4oz red cabbage, finely
shredded
2 tablespoons chopped peanuts
For the marinade
2 teaspoons sweet chilli sauce
1\u20442 teaspoon grated fresh root
ginger
1 garlic clove, crushed
2 teaspoons light soy sauce
2 tablespoons olive oil
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the marinade, put the chilli sauce, ginger, garlic, soy sauce and
oil in a screwtop glass jar, and shake well.
\u2022 Put the tofu in a medium bowl, pour the marinade over and stir. Cover
with cling film and refrigerate for 1 hour.
\u2022 Put the mangetout in a small pan, pour boiling water over and leave to
stand for 1 minute, then drain and plunge into ice-cold water. Drain well.
\u2022 Add the mangetout, carrots and cabbage to the tofu, and toss together
lightly. Transfer the salad to a serving bowl, sprinkle with the peanuts
and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: tofu, mangetout, carrots, red cabbages, peanuts, sweet chilli sauce, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, olive oil

fields.title: Saffron rice salad
fields.ingredients:
1 teaspoon saffron threads
6 green cardamom pods
6 cloves
1 cinnamon stick
450g/1lb basmati rice
2 tablespoons olive oil
squeeze of lemon juice
50g/2oz flaked almonds, toasted
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the saffron in a small bowl with 3 tablespoons boiling water, and
leave to infuse while the rice is cooking.
\u2022 Pour 1 litre cold water into a pan, season with salt and bring to the
boil. Add the spices and rice. Return to the boil, stir with a fork, reduce the
heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir the rice again, then pour in the
saffron liquid without stirring. Cook for a further 5\u201310 minutes until all of
the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender.
\u2022 Put the rice in a bowl and fluff up the grains with a fork. Stir in the oil
and lemon juice, and leave to cool. Transfer to a large serving plate,
season with salt and pepper, and sprinkle with the almonds.
fields.ingredient_tags: saffron threads, cloves, cinnamon sticks, rice, olive oil, lemon juice, almonds, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Borlotti bean salad
fields.ingredients:
700g canned cooked
borlotti beans, drained
2 garlic cloves
2 tablespoons fresh sage leaves
1 tablespoon red wine vinegar
2 tablespoons French mustard
5 tablespoons extra virgin
olive oil
250g/9oz rocket leaves
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the beans in a saucepan; cover
with cold water. Add the garlic
and sage leaves. Bring to the boil,
and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain,
then season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Combine the vinegar and mustard,
and season. Slowly whisk in the
olive oil.
\u2022 Toss the beans with two-thirds of
the dressing. Toss the rocket leaves
in the remainder of the dressing.
\u2022 Divide the dressed leaves between
four serving plates. Spoon the
beans over the leaves, and serve
with the bean juices over the top.
fields.ingredient_tags: beans, garlic, sage leaves, red wine vinegar, mustard, olive oil, rocket leaves, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Greek salad
fields.ingredients:
4 large beefsteak tomatoes,
about 700g/1.5lb in total
1 large cucumber
2 red onions
1 Cos lettuce
100g/4oz pitted black olives
225g/8oz feta cheese
For the dressing
125ml/4fl oz olive oil
50ml/2fl oz lemon juice
3 tablespoons chopped fresh
coriander leaves
pinch of granulated sugar
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Cut the tomatoes into bite-size
chunks, discarding the cores. Cut
the cucumber in half crossways,
then cut a cross in the end of each
piece and cut into quarters. Cut the
quarters crossways into bite-size
pieces. Peel the onions and cut into
thin wedges. Shred the lettuce.
\u2022 Whisk the dressing ingredients
together in a jug. Put all the salad
vegetables in a large bowl, add
the olives and toss the ingredients
together using your hands.
\u2022 Pour the dressing over, and toss
gently to mix, then crumble over
the feta cheese. Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, lettuce, black olives, feta cheese, olive oil, lemon juice, coriander leaves, sugar, black pepper

fields.title: Warm pasta & crab
fields.ingredients:
200g/7oz spaghetti
2 tablespoons olive oil
25g/1oz butter
3 x 200g/7oz canned cooked
crabmeat, drained
1 red pepper, cut into thin strips
2 teaspoons finely grated
lemon zest
3 tablespoons freshly grated
Parmesan cheese
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
chives
3 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Break the spaghetti in half, and
cook in a large pan of lightly
salted rapidly boiling water until
al dente. Drain.
\u2022 Put the spaghetti in a large serving
bowl, and toss with the oil and
butter. Add the remaining
ingredients, and toss to combine.
\u2022 Season with salt and pepper, and
serve warm.
fields.ingredient_tags: spaghetti, olive oil, butter, crabs, red peppers, lemon zest, parmesan, chives, parsley, black pepper

fields.title: Tuna & bean salad
fields.ingredients:
200g/7oz canned tuna in oil
4 spring onions, sliced
2 celery sticks, chopped
400g/14oz canned cannellini
beans, drained and rinsed
1 tablespoon drained capers
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
For the vinaigrette
2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
3 tablespoons orange juice
juice of 2 limes
several dashes of Tabasco sauce
2 garlic cloves, crushed
1 tablespoon caster sugar
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the vinaigrette, put all the ingredients in a screwtop glass jar,
seal tightly and shake well.
\u2022 To make the salad, put the tuna in a bowl and flake with a fork. Toss in
the spring onions and celery, then stir in the beans and capers.
\u2022 Pour the vinaigrette over, add the parsley and toss to distribute the
dressing evenly. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: canned tuna, onions, celery sticks, beans, capers, parsley, vinegar, orange juice, lime juice, tabasco sauce, garlic, caster sugar

fields.title: Greek cucumber salad
fields.ingredients:
1 cucumber
1 teaspoon salt
3 tablespoons finely chopped
fresh mint
1 garlic clove, crushed
1 teaspoon caster sugar
200ml/7fl oz Greek-style yogurt
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Peel the cucumber and cut in half
lengthways. Remove the seeds with
a teaspoon and discard. Slice the
cucumber thinly. Put in a bowl, and
sprinkle with the salt. Toss through,
and leave for at least 15 minutes.
\u2022 Combine the mint, garlic, sugar
and yogurt in another bowl.
\u2022 Rinse the cucumber in a sieve
under cold running water to flush
away the salt.
\u2022 Drain well and combine with the
yogurt mixture. Chill for 15 minutes
and serve
fields.ingredient_tags: cucumbers, salt, mint, garlic, sugar, greek yogurt

fields.title: Salad ni\u00e7oise
fields.ingredients:
3 eggs
2 vine-ripened tomatoes
175g/6oz baby green beans,
trimmed
125ml/4fl oz olive oil
2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
1 garlic clove, halved
350g/12oz iceberg lettuce heart,
cut into 8 wedges
1 red pepper, seeded and
thinly sliced
1 cucumber, cut into 5cm/2in
lengths
1 celery stick, cut into 5cm/2in
lengths 1\u20444 large red onion, thinly sliced
350g/12oz canned tuna, drained
12 pitted black olives
2 x 175g/6oz cans anchovy fillets
in oil, drained
2 teaspoons baby capers, drained
12 small fresh basil leaves
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the eggs in a saucepan of cold water. Bring to the boil, then reduce
the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir during the first few minutes to
centre the yolks. Cool under cold water, then peel and cut into quarters.
Meanwhile, score a cross in the base of each tomato, and put in a bowl
of boiling water for 10 seconds. Plunge into cold water and peel away
from the cross. Cut each tomato into eight sections.
\u2022 Cook the beans in a saucepan of boiling water for 2 minutes, rinse
under cold water, then drain.
\u2022 For the dressing, put the oil and vinegar in a screwtop glass jar, seal
tightly and shake to combine.
\u2022 Rub the garlic over the bottom and sides of a platter. Arrange the lettuce
over the bottom. Layer the egg, tomato, beans, red pepper, cucumber
and celery over the lettuce. Scatter the onion and tuna over them, then
the olives, anchovies, capers and basil. Drizzle the salad with the
dressing, and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: eggs, tomatoes, beans, olive oil, white wine vinegar, garlic,

fields.title: Thai noodle salad
fields.ingredients:
250g/9oz thin instant noodles
450g/1lb cooked large prawns,
peeled, deveined and halved
lengthways
5 spring onions, sliced
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
coriander leaves
1 red pepper, chopped
100g/4oz mangetout, sliced
For the dressing
2 tablespoons grated fresh
root ginger
2 tablespoons light soy sauce
2 tablespoons sesame oil
75ml/3fl oz red wine vinegar
1 tablespoon sweet chilli sauce
2 garlic cloves (crushed)
75ml/3fl oz kecap manis
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the dressing, put the ingredients in a large bowl, and whisk
together with a fork.
\u2022 Cook the noodles in a large pan of boiling water for 2 minutes, then
drain well. Add to the dressing and mix well. Leave to cool.
\u2022 Add the prawns and remaining ingredients to the noodles, and toss
through gently. Serve at room temperature.
fields.ingredient_tags: instant noodles, prawns, onions, coriander, red peppers, mangetout, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, red wine vinegar, sweet chilli sauce, garlic

fields.title: Couscous & haddock salad
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz couscous
100g/4oz cooked, flaked
smoked haddock
50g/2oz cooked green peas
pinch of curry powder
2 spring onions, sliced
1 small egg, hard-boiled and
chopped
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lemon juice
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Cook the couscous according to
the packet instructions.
\u2022 Mix the couscous with the
haddock, peas, curry powder,
spring onions and chopped egg.
\u2022 Toss with the olive oil and lemon
juice, and season with plenty of
salt and pepper. Serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: couscous, smoked haddock, peas, curry powder, onions, eggs, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Thai beef salad
fields.ingredients:
vegetable oil for frying
450g/1lb lean rump steak
3 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lime juice
3 tablespoons Thai fish sauce
1 tablespoon granulated sugar
4 shallots, thinly sliced
2 garlic cloves, crushed
2 fresh red chillies, seeded and
finely sliced
6\u20138 lettuce leaves
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
coriander leaves
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
chives 1/2 cucumber, peeled and cut into
slices 5mm/1/4in thick
2 tomatoes, cut into eighths
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 240\u00b0C/
450\u00b0F/Gas mark 8.
\u2022 Heat a little oil in a flameproof dish
until it is very hot. Add the meat
and brown it quickly over a fierce
heat. Transfer to the oven, and
roast for 10\u201315 minutes.
\u2022 Leave to rest for at least 5 minutes,
then slice thinly.
\u2022 Mix together the lime juice, fish
sauce and sugar, stirring until the
sugar has dissolved. Add the
shallots, garlic and chillies.
\u2022 Make a bed of lettuce on a serving
dish, and pile the beef in the
centre. Spoon the dressing over
and scatter with coriander and
chives. Arrange the cucumber and
tomato wedges around the edge of
the salad, and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, steak, lime juice, sugar, shallots, garlic, red chillies, lettuce, coriander, chives, cucumbers, tomatoes

fields.title: Curly endive salad
fields.ingredients:
1/2 curly endive
1/2 small onion, very thinly sliced
grated zest and juice of 1/2 lemon
1 teaspoon clear honey
2 teaspoons walnut oil
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Tear the curly endive into neat
pieces, and put in a large salad
bowl. Scatter the onion over.
\u2022 Whisk together the lemon zest,
juice, honey, oil and 2 teaspoons
water. Season with salt and
pepper, and whisk again.
\u2022 Drizzle the dressing over the
endive, and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: curly endive, onions, lemon juice, honey, walnut oil, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Smoked mackerel salad
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb new potatoes, halved
lengthways
4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
3 smoked mackerel fillets, skinned
and broken into strips
250g/9oz cherry tomatoes, halved
1/2 cucumber, seeded and diced
75g/3oz watercress
2 teaspoons horseradish sauce
2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the potatoes in a pan of cold water, cover and bring to the boil. Cook
for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain well, tip back into the pan and add
1 tablespoon of the oil. Season well with salt and pepper. Cover the pan
and shake well to mix. Spoon the potatoes into a large bowl.
\u2022 Add the mackerel, tomatoes and cucumber, and top with the watercress
and a pinch of salt and pepper.
\u2022 Mix together the horseradish, remaining oil and the vinegar in a bowl, and
season well with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Pour the dressing over the salad. Toss gently, and serve
fields.ingredient_tags: potatoes, olive oil, mackerel, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, watercress, horseradish sauce, white wine vinegar, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Chinese prawn salad
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz beansprouts
1 small red pepper, chopped
100g/4oz peeled and deveined
cooked prawns
2 teaspoons light soy sauce
2 teaspoons white wine vinegar
1/2 teaspoon granulated sugar
2 tablespoons sesame oil
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
6 large lettuce leaves
1 spring onion, chopped
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the beansprouts in a bowl with
the pepper and prawns.
\u2022 Mix together the remaining
ingredients except the lettuce and
spring onion, and pour over the
prawn mixture. Toss well.
\u2022 Put a lettuce leaf in the bottom of
each of six individual bowls.
Spoon some prawn mixture on to
each lettuce leaf, and scatter the
spring onion over the top. Serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: beansprouts, red peppers, prawns, soy sauce, white wine vinegar, sugar, sesame oil, salt, black pepper, lettuce leaves, onions

fields.title: Tomato & spring onion salad
fields.ingredients:
8 ripe tomatoes
3 spring onions, finely sliced
1 tablespoon olive oil
1 tablespoon white wine vinegar
1/2 teaspoon granulated sugar
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the tomatoes in a bowl of justboiled water for 30 seconds.
Remove with a slotted spoon, then
peel off and discard the skin. Cut
the flesh into wedges.
\u2022 Put the tomatoes in a dish, and
sprinkle with the spring onions.
\u2022 Whisk together the remaining
ingredients and drizzle over the
top. Leave to stand for 30 minutes
before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: tomatoes, onions, olive oil, white wine vinegar, sugar, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Pear & grape salad
fields.ingredients:
2 teaspoons skimmed milk
225g/8oz low-fat cottage
cheese, whipped
1 teaspoon granulated sugar
2 large pears, halved, peeled
and cored
8 iceberg lettuce leaves
20 seedless white grapes, halved
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Mix the milk with the cottage
cheese and sugar, and blend until
of a spreading consistency.
\u2022 Put the pear halves on the lettuce
leaves, cut side down, and frost
generously with the cottage cheese.
\u2022 Press the grapes, cut side down,
into the cottage cheese.
\u2022 Chill the salad for at least
20 minutes before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: milk, cheese, sugar, pears, lettuce, white grapes,

fields.title: Baked seafood salad
fields.ingredients:
1 small green pepper, seeded
and chopped
1 small onion, chopped
225g/8oz celery, chopped
450g/1lb cooked crabmeat
450g/1lb small cooked scallops
225g/8oz low-fat sour cream
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
225g/8oz coarse breadcrumbs
25g/1oz margarine
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/
350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 Mix all the ingredients except the
breadcrumbs and margarine in a
casserole dish. Sprinkle the
breadcrumbs over the top, and dot
with the margarine. Bake for
30 minutes, and serve warm.
fields.ingredient_tags: green peppers, onions, celery, crabs, scallops, sour cream, salt, margarine

fields.title: Brown rice & chicken salad
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb brown rice
450g/1lb lean skinless cooked
chicken, diced
12 spring onions, sliced
2 celery sticks, chopped
2 green peppers, seeded and
chopped
100g/4oz black olives, pitted
and halved
50g/2oz pimiento, minced
100g/4oz cherry tomatoes,
halved
100g/4oz fresh flat-leaf parsley,
chopped
100g/4oz radishes, sliced
50ml/2fl oz olive oil
50ml/2fl oz white wine vinegar
fields.instructions:
\u2022 In a covered saucepan, cook the
rice in 450ml water over a
medium heat for about 25 minutes
or until the liquid is absorbed and
the rice is fluffy. Remove from the
heat and leave to cool.
\u2022 Add all the remaining ingredients
and toss well. Serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: brown rice, chicken, onions, celery sticks, green peppers, black olives, pimiento, cherry tomatoes, parsley, radishes, olive oil, white wine vinegar

fields.title: Nutty rice salad
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz long-grain rice
50g/2oz frozen peas
50g/2oz raisins
50g/2oz toasted flaked almonds
2 tablespoons sunflower oil
1 tablespoon white wine vinegar
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 In a covered saucepan, cook the
rice in 175ml/6fl oz water over a
medium-high heat for about
20 minutes. Add the peas and
cook for a further 5 minutes. Drain,
rinse with cold water, and drain
again. Empty into a salad bowl.
\u2022 Add the raisins, almonds, oil and
vinegar. Season with salt and
pepper. Toss well and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: rice, peas, raisins, almonds, sunflower oil, white wine vinegar, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Rocket salad
fields.ingredients:
1 slice white bread, cubed
1 garlic clove, quartered
1 tablespoon low-fat spread
100g/4oz rocket leaves
1 sprig of fresh coriander, leaves
picked
1 sprig of fresh flat leaf parsley,
leaves picked
1 red onion, sliced
1 tablespoon tarragon vinegar
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the bread, garlic and low-fat
spread in a small heavy frying pan
over a gentle heat, and toss until
golden. Remove from the heat,
discard the garlic and drain the
cro\u00fbtons on kitchen paper.
\u2022 Put the rocket, coriander and
parsley in a small salad bowl.
Scatter the onion and cro\u00fbtons over
the top of the greens. Sprinkle with
the vinegar, and season well with
salt and pepper. Serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: bread, garlic, spread, rocket leaves, coriander, parsley, onions, vinegar, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Beetroot & orange salad
fields.ingredients:
1 Little Gem lettuce, leaves
separated
2 oranges
2 large cooked beetroot, diced
1 tablespoon orange juice
1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Divide the lettuce leaves evenly
among four small serving plates.
\u2022 Holding the oranges over a bowl,
remove all the pith and zest. Cut
the flesh into segments. Squeeze
any juice from the membranes into
the bowl, then discard them.
\u2022 Pile the beetroot in the centre of the
lettuce leaves with the orange
segments surrounding them.
\u2022 Add the orange juice to the bowl
with the vinegar. Season with salt
and pepper. Spoon the dressing
over the beetroot, and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: lettuce, oranges, beetroot, orange juice, balsamic vinegar, salt, black pepper, creme fraiche

fields.title: Hot potato & bean salad
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb potatoes, scrubbed
and diced
100g/4oz French beans,
topped and tailed, cut into
short lengths
75ml/3fl oz low-fat cr\u00e8me
fra\u00eeche
2 teaspoons chopped fresh mint
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Cook the potatoes in lightly salted
boiling water for 5 minutes.
\u2022 Add the beans to the potatoes, and
cook for a further 5\u201310 minutes
until the potatoes are tender. Drain
and return to the pan.
\u2022 Add the cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche and mint,
and season with salt and pepper.
Toss gently, and serve warm.
fields.ingredient_tags: potatoes, beans, mint, salt, black pepper

fields.title:
Fresh salad with
raspberry vinaigrette
fields.ingredients:
1 bunch watercress, torn
2 heads Bibb lettuce, torn into
bite-size pieces
450g/1lb mushrooms, sliced
425g/15oz canned artichoke
hearts, drained
1 bunch white radishes, sliced
225g/8oz fresh raspberries
For the vinaigrette
125ml/4fl oz raspberry vinegar
1/2 teaspoon salt
225g/8oz olive oil
1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the watercress, lettuce,
mushrooms, artichoke hearts and
radishes in a large bowl.
\u2022 Shake the vinaigrette ingredients
together in a screwtop glass jar,
and drizzle over the salad. Toss
well. Serve with the raspberries
scattered over the top.
fields.ingredient_tags: watercress, lettuce, mushrooms, artichokes, white radishes, raspberries, raspberry vinegar, salt, olive oil, mustard, black pepper

fields.title: Beetroot & chive salad
fields.ingredients:
4 cooked beetroot, chopped
2 tablespoons low-fat creme
fraiche
1 tablespoon snipped fresh
chives
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the beetroot in a bowl. Add the
cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche, and season with salt
and pepper.
\u2022 Sprinkle over the chives, toss and
serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: beetroot, creme fraiche, chives, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Mustard carrot salad
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb carrots, coarsely
grated
25g/1oz low-fat spread
1 tablespoon mustard seeds
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed
lemon juice
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the carrots in a salad bowl,
and season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Melt the low-fat spread in a frying
pan over a medium heat, and add
the mustard seeds.
\u2022 When they start to pop, add the
lemon juice, stir and pour over the
salad. Toss well and serve straight
away, while still warm.
fields.ingredient_tags: carrots, spread, mustard seeds, lemon juice, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Banana & pecan salad
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz finely chopped lean
back bacon
50g/2oz pecan nuts, chopped
200g/7oz banana, sliced
300g/11oz celery, sliced
1/2 lime, thinly sliced
250g/9oz low-fat Greek-style
yogurt
6 lettuce leaves
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Grill the bacon until crisp, then cut
into small pieces.
\u2022 Mix together the bacon, pecan
nuts, banana, celery, lime and
yogurt in a bowl.
\u2022 Put a lettuce leaf on the bottom of
each of six individual bowls, and
divide the mixture between each
bowl. Serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: bacon, pecan nuts, bananas, celery, limes, greek yogurt, lettuce

fields.title: Turnip salad
fields.ingredients:
350g/12oz turnips
2 spring onions, white part only,
chopped
1 tablespoon caster sugar
pinch of salt
2 tablespoons horseradish cream
2 teaspoons caraway seeds
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Peel, slice and shred the turnips.
Add the spring onions, sugar and
salt, then rub together with your
hands to soften the turnip.
\u2022 Fold in the horseradish cream and
caraway seeds, and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: turnips, onions, sugar, salt, horseradish cream, caraway seeds

fields.title: Grilled stuffed sole
fields.ingredients:
1 tablespoon olive oil
25g/1oz butter
1 small onion, finely chopped
1 garlic clove, chopped
3 sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
2 tablespoons fresh lemon
thyme leaves
50g/2oz fresh breadcrumbs
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed
lemon juice
4 small whole sole, gutted and
cleaned
lemon wedges, to garnish
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the grill. Heat the oil and butter in a frying pan until it just
begins to foam. Add the onion and garlic to the frying pan, and cook,
stirring, for 5 minutes, or until just softened.
\u2022 To make the stuffing, mix together the tomatoes, thyme, breadcrumbs and
lemon juice in a bowl, then season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Add the stuffing mixture to the pan, and stir to mix.
\u2022 Using a sharp knife, pare the skin from the bone inside the gut hole of
the fish to make a pocket. Spoon the stuffing into the pocket.
\u2022 Cook the fish, under the grill, for 6 minutes on either side, or until
golden brown. Transfer to serving plates, garnish with lemon wedges
and serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, butter, onion, garlic, sun-dried tomatoes, lemon, thyme leaves, breadcrumbs, lemon juice, sole, lemon wedges, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Spicy coconut prawns
fields.ingredients:
3 fresh red chillies, seeded
and chopped
2 shallots, chopped
1 lemon grass stalk, chopped
3 garlic cloves, chopped
1 teaspoon ground turmeric
1 teaspoon ground coriander
1 tablespoon groundnut oil
2 kaffir lime leaves
1 teaspoon soft brown sugar
2 tomatoes, peeled and chopped
250ml/9fl oz coconut milk
700g/1.5lb large raw prawns,
peeled and deveined
squeeze of lemon juice
salt
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Using a mortar and pestle, pound together the chillies, shallots, lemon
grass, garlic, turmeric and coriander until the mixture forms a paste.
\u2022 Heat a wok until hot, add the oil and swirl it around. Add the spice
paste and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Pour in 250ml/9fl oz water and add the
lime leaves, sugar and tomatoes. Simmer for 8\u201310 minutes until most of
the liquid has evaporated.
\u2022 Add the coconut milk and prawns, and cook gently, stirring, for
4 minutes until the prawns are pink. Season with lemon juice and salt to
taste. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: red chillies, shallots, lemon grass, garlic, ground turmeric, ground coriander, groundnut oil, kaffir lime leaves, soft brown sugar, tomatoes, coconut milk, prawns, lemon juice, salt

fields.title: Seafood lasagne
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz butter
50g/2oz plain flour
1 teaspoon mustard powder
600ml/1pt milk
2 tablespoons olive oil, plus extra
for oiling
1 onion, chopped
2 garlic cloves, finely chopped
1 tablespoon fresh thyme leaves
450g/1lb mixed mushrooms, sliced
150ml/5fl oz white wine
400g/14oz canned chopped
plum tomatoes
450g/1lb mixed skinless white fish
fillets, cubed
225g/8oz scallops, trimmed
4\u20136 sheets fresh lasagne
225g/8oz mozzarella cheese,
chopped
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6.
\u2022 Melt the butter in a saucepan over a low heat. Add the flour and
mustard powder, and stir until smooth. Cook gently for 2 minutes
without colouring.
\u2022 Gradually add the milk, whisking until smooth. Bring to the boil and
simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and reserve. Cover the
surface of the sauce with cling film to prevent a skin forming.
\u2022 Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a low heat. Add the onion, garlic
and thyme, and sweat for 5 minutes until softened. Add the mushrooms
and cook for a further 5 minutes until softened. Stir in the wine, and boil
rapidly until nearly evaporated. Stir in the tomatoes. Bring to the boil,
reduce the heat slightly and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes. Season
with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Lightly oil a lasagne dish. Spoon half of the tomato sauce over the
bottom of the dish, and top with half of the fish and scallops. Layer half
of the lasagne over this, and cover with half of the white sauce. Dot with
half of the mozzarella. Repeat the layers, finishing with the mozzarella.
\u2022 Bake in the oven for 30\u201340 minutes until bubbling, golden and cooked
through. Remove from the oven and leave to stand for 10 minutes before
serving hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, plain flour, mustard powder, milk, olive oil, onion, garlic, thyme leaves, mushrooms, white wine, plum tomatoes, white fish fillets, scallops, lasagne, mozzarella cheese, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Basque tuna stew
fields.ingredients:
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 onion, chopped
2 garlic cloves, chopped
200g/7oz canned chopped
plum tomatoes
700g/11/2lb potatoes, cut into
5cm/2in chunks
3 green peppers, seeded and
roughly chopped
900g/2lb fresh tuna, cut into chunks
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over a low heat. Add the onion and
cook for 8\u201310 minutes until soft and golden. Add the garlic and cook for
a further 1 minute. Add the tomatoes, cover and simmer for about
30 minutes until thickened.
\u2022 Meanwhile, mix together the potatoes and peppers in a large clean
saucepan. Add 300ml/10fl oz water, which should just cover the
vegetables. Bring to the boil over a medium heat, and simmer for
15 minutes until the vegetables are almost tender.
\u2022 Add the tuna chunks and the tomato mixture to the potatoes and
peppers, and season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer for
6\u20138 minutes until the tuna is tender. Transfer to four warmed large
individual bowls, and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, onion, garlic, plum tomatoes, potatoes, green peppers, tuna, salt, black pepper

fields.title:
Californian prawn
& scallop stir-fry
fields.ingredients:
3 tablespoons vegetable oil
4 tablespoons pine nuts
450g/1lb raw prawns
450g/1lb scallops, quartered
if large
2 teaspoon grated fresh root ginger
1 fresh green chilli, deseeded and
finely chopped
2 garlic cloves, finely chopped
1 red pepper, seeded and chopped
225g/8oz spinach, stalks removed
4 onions, sliced
4 tablespoons fish stock
4 tablespoons light soy sauce
4 tablespoons rice wine
1 tablespoon cornflour
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Heat the oil in a wok and add the pine nuts. Cook over a low heat,
stirring continuously, until lightly browned. Remove with a slotted spoon
and drain on kitchen paper. Set aside.
\u2022 Add the prawns and scallops to the oil remaining in the wok and stir
over a moderate heat until the scallops are beginning to look opaque
and firm, and the prawns are pink.
\u2022 Add the ginger, chilli, garlic and pepper, and cook for a few minutes
over a medium-high heat. Add the spinach and onion, and stir-fry briefly.
Mix the remaining ingredients together in a bowl, and pour over the
ingredients in the wok.
\u2022 Increase the heat to bring the liquid quickly to a boil, stirring the
ingredients continuously. Once the liquid thickens, stir in the reserved
pine nuts, and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, pine nuts, prawns, scallops, ginger, green chilli, garlic, red pepper, spinach, onions, fish stock, light soy sauce, rice wine, cornflour

fields.title: Mild prawn curry
fields.ingredients:
75g/3oz desiccated coconut
300ml/10fl oz boiling milk
1 onion, finely chopped
3 tablespoons sunflower oil
2.5cm/1in piece of of fresh root
ginger, chopped
2 tablespoons Thai fish sauce
350g/12oz basmati rice
1kg/21/4lb raw tiger prawns,
peeled and deveined
For the masala
1/2 tablespoon cumin seeds
1/2 tablespoon coriander seeds
seeds from 6 green
cardamom pods 1\u20442 teaspoon black peppercorns
1 teaspoon dried red chilli flakes
1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Make the masala by toasting the cumin, coriander and cardamom
seeds, peppercorns, chilli flakes and turmeric in a dry frying pan over a
low heat for 2\u20133 minutes until aromatic. Grind to a powder using a
mortar and pestle.
\u2022 Put the coconut in a bowl, and pour the milk over it. Leave to steep for
20 minutes.
\u2022 Sweat the onion in the oil until translucent. Add the masala, stir through
and fry gently for 2\u20133 minutes. Add the ginger, and strain the coconut
milk into the mixture through a sieve. Simmer for 10\u201315 minutes, then
add the fish sauce.
\u2022 Cook the rice in rapidly boiling water for 8\u201310 minutes, but do
not overcook. Drain.
\u2022 Add the prawns to the sauce, and cook for 5\u20136 minutes until the prawns
turn pink. Serve hot with the basmati rice.
fields.ingredient_tags: coconut, milk, onion, sunflower oil, ginger, thai fish sauce, basmati rice, tiger prawns, cumin seeds, coriander seeds, cardamom pods, black peppercorns, red chilli flakes, ground turmeric

fields.title: Squid sambal
fields.ingredients:
3 tablespoons groundnut oil
1 tablespoon tamarind pulp, soaked
in 150ml/5fl oz water for
10 minutes
1.5 teaspoons paprika
1 teaspoon granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
450g/1lb small squid with tentacles,
cleaned
For the spice paste
2 large onions, chopped
2 garlic cloves, chopped
1 teaspoon dried shrimp paste
1.5 tablespoons sambal oelek
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
lemon grass
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the ingredients for the spice paste in a blender or food processor,
and blend to produce a thick paste.
\u2022 Heat the oil in a large saucepan, add the paste and fry over a medium
heat for 8 minutes, stirring constantly, until the paste is cooked and
lightly golden.
\u2022 Strain the tamarind pulp through a sieve, discard the pulp and add the
strained tamarind liquid to the pan with the paprika, sugar and salt.
Cook the sambal sauce over a very heat, stirring occasionally, for about
10 minutes.
\u2022 Cut the squid tubes into 2.5cm/1in thick rings, and add them and the
tentacles to the pan.
\u2022 Increase the heat and cook the squid sambal, stirring constantly, for 5\u20136
minutes or until the squid is cooked and the sauce is thick. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: groundnut oil, tamarind pulp, paprika, granulated sugar, salt, squid, onions, garlic, shrimp paste, sambal oelek, lemon grass

fields.title: Fish fillets in wine sauce
fields.ingredients:
vegetable oil for deep-frying
900g/2lb sole fillets, cut into
5 x 2.5cm/2 x 1cm pieces
2 egg whites, lightly beaten
3 tablespoons cornflour
For the sauce
3 tablespoons vegetable oil
2 teaspoons caster sugar
125ml/4fl oz dry white wine
