50ml/2fl oz rice wine
1 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons cornflour
175ml/6fl oz fish stock
fields.instructions:
\u2022 In a small deep heavy skillet or frying pan, heat the oil for deep-frying
over a medium heat. When the oil is hot, dip each piece of fish in the
egg whites, then dredge through the cornflour to coat thoroughly.
\u2022 Deep-fry each piece of sole quickly to crisp the outside, about 1 minute
each. Remove from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen
paper. Continue until all the sole is fried.
\u2022 For the sauce, heat the oil in a wok over a medium heat. Add the sugar,
white wine, rice wine and salt, stirring all the time.
\u2022 Blend the cornflour and stock together, add to the wok and stir until the
sauce thickens. Carefully put the sole pieces in the wok, and turn them a
few times to coat. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, sole fillets, egg whites, cornflour, caster sugar, dry white wine, rice wine, salt, fish stock

fields.title: Fish loaf
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz butter, melted, plus extra
for greasing
900g/2lb cod fillets, minced
1 small onion, chopped
2 tablespoons fresh white
breadcrumbs
1 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
2 tablespoons sour cream
For the sauce
1 small onion, finely chopped
25g/1oz butter
1 tablespoon flour
300ml/10fl oz milk
1 teaspoon lemon juice
225g/8oz mushrooms, thinly sliced
1 tablespoon sour cream
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Grease a 1.2 litre/2pt
loaf tin with butter.
\u2022 Mix the cod, onion, breadcrumbs, salt, eggs, sour cream and melted
butter together in a large bowl. Scrape into the prepared loaf tin, and
press down firmly. Bake in the oven for 45 minutes.
\u2022 To make the sauce, sweat the onion in the butter until transparent. Add
the flour and cook for 1 minute. Add the milk, lemon juice and
mushrooms. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until the sauce thickens.
\u2022 Add the sour cream to the sauce just before serving. Serve the fish loaf
hot with the accompanying sauce.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, cod fillets, onion, breadcrumbs, salt, egg, sour cream, flour, milk, lemon juice, mushrooms, black pepper

fields.title: Pan-seared halibut
fields.ingredients:
1 teaspoon olive oil
4 skinless halibut steaks, about
175g/6oz each 1\u20442 teaspoon cornflour, mixed
with 2 teaspoons cold water to
form a paste
salt and freshly ground black pepper
For the relish
2 red onions, grated
6 shallots, grated
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed
lemon juice
2 teaspoons olive oil
2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
2 teaspoons caster sugar
150ml/5fl oz fish stock
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the relish, put the onions and shallots in a small bowl, and toss
in the lemon juice.
\u2022 Heat the oil for the relish in a frying pan over a medium heat. Tip in the
onions and shallots, and saut\u00e9 for 3\u20134 minutes until just softened. Add
the vinegar and sugar, and continue to cook for a further 2 minutes over
a high heat. Pour in the stock, and season well with salt and pepper.
Bring to the boil and simmer gently for 10 minutes until the sauce has
thickened and slightly reduced.
\u2022 Brush a frying pan with the oil, and heat over a medium-high heat until
hot. Press the fish into the pan to seal, reduce the heat and cook for
4 minutes. Turn the fish over and cook for 5 minutes until cooked
through. Drain on kitchen paper and keep warm.
\u2022 Stir the cornflour paste into the relish and heat through, stirring, until it
has thickened. Check and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Pile the
relish onto serving plates and top with the halibut.
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, halibut steak, cornflour, salt, red onions, shallots, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, caster sugar, fish stock

fields.title: Salmon with lemon mash
fields.ingredients:
4 salmon steaks, about
150g/5oz each
225g/8oz spinach leaves
For the lemon mash
450g/1lb potatoes, cubed
25g/1oz butter
2 tablespoons milk
finely grated zest of 1\u20442 lemon
For the sauce
25g/1oz butter
25g/1oz plain flour
200ml/7fl oz skimmed milk
finely grated zest of 1/2 lemon
4 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs
1 red pepper, finely chopped
1 egg, lightly beaten
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Cook the potatoes in boiling water for 15\u201320 minutes until tender.
\u2022 Meanwhile, make the sauce. Melt the butter in a saucepan, add the flour
and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and gradually stir
in the milk.
\u2022 Return to the heat and bring to the boil, stirring, until thickened and
smooth. Add the lemon zest, herbs, red pepper and egg. Season with
salt and pepper. Stir well.
\u2022 Heat a non-stick frying pan, and cook the salmon for 3\u20135 minutes on
each side until golden brown. Transfer to a flameproof dish.
\u2022 Spoon the sauce over the fish, and put under a hot grill until the sauce is
set and the salmon is just cooked through.
\u2022 Meanwhile, lightly steam the spinach for 8 minutes in a steamer set over
a pan of boiling water.
\u2022 Drain and mash the potatoes, then stir in the butter, milk and lemon zest.
Serve with the fish and spinach.
fields.ingredient_tags: salmon steaks, spinach, potatoes, butter, milk, lemon zest, plain flour, skimmed milk, fresh herbs, red pepper, egg, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Seafood balti
fields.ingredients:
For the seafood
225g/8oz cod fillet, skinned
and cubed
225g/8oz peeled and deveined
cooked prawns
6 crab sticks, halved lengthways
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed
lemon juice
1 teaspoon ground coriander
1 teaspoon chilli powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground cumin
40g cornflour
For the vegetables
300ml/10fl oz corn oil
2 onions, chopped
1\u20442 cauliflower, cut into florets
100g/4oz French beans, cut into
2.5cm/1in lengths
175g/6oz sweetcorn
1 teaspoon shredded fresh
root ginger
1 teaspoon chilli powder
1 teaspoon salt
4 fresh green chillies, sliced
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
coriander leaves
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the cod, prawns and crab sticks in a mixing bowl.
\u2022 In a separate bowl, mix together the lemon juice, ground coriander, chilli
powder, salt and cumin. Pour this over the seafood, and mix together
thoroughly using your hands.
\u2022 Sprinkle on the cornflour, and mix again until the seafood is well
coated. Set aside in the refrigerator for about 1 hour to allow the
flavours to develop.
\u2022 To make the vegetable mixture, heat half of the oil in a preheated wok.
Add the onions and stir-fry until lightly browned.
\u2022 Add the cauliflower, beans, sweetcorn, ginger, chilli powder, salt and
chillies. Stir-fry for 7\u201310 minutes over a medium heat.
\u2022 Spoon the fried vegetables around the edge of a shallow dish, leaving a
space in the middle for the seafood.
\u2022 Wash the pan, then heat the remaining oil to fry the seafood pieces. Fry
in two or three batches until the pieces are golden brown. Remove with
a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper.
\u2022 Arrange the seafood in the middle of the dish of vegetables, and
serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: cod fillet, prawns, crab sticks, lemon juice, ground coriander, chilli powder, salt, ground cumin, cornflour, corn oil, onions, cauliflower, beans, sweetcorn, ginger, green chillies, fresh coriander leaves

fields.title: Seafood kebabs
fields.ingredients:
700g/1.5lb salmon fillet, skinned
and cut into 2.5cm/1in chunks
12 queen scallops, halved if they
are large
12 raw king prawns, peeled and
deveined, but tail left intact
4 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lime juice
2 tablespoons olive oil
4 fresh basil leaves, shredded
12 fresh bay leaves
salt and freshly ground black pepper
For the sauce
1 teaspoon grated fresh root ginger
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed
lime juice
12 fresh basil leaves, chopped
100g/4oz butter, softened
75ml/3fl oz dry white wine
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Soak 12 bamboo skewers in water for at least 30 minutes to prevent
them burning.
\u2022 Put all the seafood in a bowl, and mix with the lime juice, oil and basil.
Season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Thread the salmon, prawns and scallops alternately onto the skewers,
adding a bay leaf to each skewer.
\u2022 To make the sauce, beat together the ginger, lime juice, basil and butter
with a little seasoning until well combined.
\u2022 Cook the kebabs under a medium grill or on a barbecue for
8\u201310 minutes, turning occasionally, until evenly cooked and lightly
browned on all sides.
\u2022 Meanwhile, boil the wine until it is reduced to 2 tablespoons. Remove
from the heat, and gradually whisk into the sauce. Serve the hot kebabs
with the sauce.
fields.ingredient_tags: salmon fillet, queen scallops, prawns, lime juice, olive oil, basil leaves, bay leaves, salt, ginger, butter, white wine

fields.title: Mediterranean plaice rolls
fields.ingredients:
75g/3oz butter, plus extra
for greasing
4 plaice fillets, about 225g/8oz
each, skinned
1 small onion, chopped
1 celery stick, finely chopped
100g/4oz fresh white breadcrumbs
3 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
2 tablespoons pine nuts, toasted
4 pieces sun-dried tomatoes in oil,
drained and chopped
50g/2oz canned anchovy fillets,
drained and chopped
freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Grease an ovenproof
dish with a little butter.
\u2022 Cut the plaice fillets in half lengthways to make 8 smaller fillets. Melt the
butter in a pan, and add the onion and celery. Cover and sweat for
15 minutes, until soft. Do not allow to brown.
\u2022 Combine the breadcrumbs, parsley, pine nuts, sun-dried tomatoes and
anchovies. Stir in the softened vegetables with the buttery juices and
season with pepper.
\u2022 Divide the stuffing into eight portions. Taking one portion at a time, form
the stuffing into balls, then roll up each one inside a plaice fillet. Secure
each roll with a cocktail stick.
\u2022 Put the rolled-up fillets in the ovenproof dish. Bake for about 20 minutes
until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove the cocktail
sticks, then serve the hot plaice rolls with a little of the cooking juices
drizzled over.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, plaice fillet, onion, celery, breadcrumb, parsley, pine nut, tomato, anchovy fillet, pepper

fields.title: Poached red emperor
fields.ingredients:
900ml/1.5pt coconut milk
2 teaspoons grated fresh root ginger
3 fresh red chillies, finely chopped
1 tablespoon chopped coriander
6 shallots, finely chopped
6 kaffir lime leaves
2 lemon grass stalks, white part
only and tough outer layer
removed, sliced
2 teaspoons grated lime zest
500ml/18fl oz fish stock
75ml/3fl oz Thai fish sauce
75ml/3fl oz freshly squeezed lime
juice, strained
4 red emperor fillets, about
250g/9oz each
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Bring the coconut milk to the boil in a saucepan, and boil for 3 minutes.
Add the ginger, chillies, coriander, shallots, lime leaves, lemon grass
and lime zest, and bring back to the boil. Add the stock and fish sauce,
and simmer for 15 minutes.
\u2022 Pass through a sieve, and add the lime juice.
\u2022 Heat the sauce in a wide frying pan and, when it comes to the boil, add
the fish, then reduce the heat and simmer gently for 10\u201315 minutes until
just cooked through.
\u2022 Transfer the fish to a serving platter and drizzle the sauce over the top.
Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: coconut milk, ginger, red chilli, coriander, shallot, kaffir lime leaf, lemon grass, lime zest, fish stock, thai fish sauce, lime juice, red emperor fillet

fields.title: Smoked haddock quiche
fields.ingredients:
225g/8oz ready-made shortcrust
pastry
25g/1oz butter
1 onion, sliced
15g/1\u20442oz plain flour
125ml/4fl oz milk
3 eggs, beaten
75g/3oz Cheddar cheese, grated
225g/8oz cooked smoked
haddock, flaked
3 tomatoes, chopped
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Roll out the pastry and
use to line a 23cm/9in flan dish.
\u2022 Melt the butter in a saucepan, and sweat the onion until soft. Stir in the
flour, then the milk, and bring to the boil, stirring continuously.
\u2022 Remove the sauce from the heat and add the eggs and half of the
cheese. Season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Arrange the flaked fish and tomatoes on the pastry, and pour the sauce
over the top. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
\u2022 Bake in the oven for 30\u201340 minutes until set and golden brown.
fields.ingredient_tags: shortcrust pastry, butter, onion, flour, milk, egg, cheddar, smoked haddock, tomato, salt, pepper

fields.title: Fish Wellington
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz butter
3 onions, thinly sliced
2 skinless monkfish fillets, about
300g/11oz each 1\u20442 teaspoon sweet smoked paprika
2 red peppers
1 large aubergine, cut into
1cm/1\u20442in slices
vegetable oil for brushing
375g/13oz block frozen puff pastry,
thawed
25g/1oz dried breadcrumbs
1 egg, lightly beaten
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Melt the butter in a saucepan, add the onion and stir to coat. Cover and
sweat gently over a low heat, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.
Uncover and cook, stirring, for another 15 minutes. Cool, then season
with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0C/ 425\u00b0F/Gas mark 7.
\u2022 Rub one side of each monkfish fillet with the paprika, and put one fillet
on top of the other.
\u2022 Cut the peppers into quarters, remove the seeds and cook, skin side up,
under a hot grill until the skin blackens. Let them cool, then peel off and
discard the skin and dice the flesh.
\u2022 Put the aubergine on a baking tray. Brush with oil and sprinkle with salt
and pepper. Grill until golden, then turn and brown the other side.
\u2022 Roll out the pastry on a floured work surface until large enough to
enclose the fish. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs lengthways along the centre
of the pastry, and put the fish on top of the breadcrumbs. Top with the
onion, then the red pepper, then the aubergine.
\u2022 Brush the pastry edges with the egg. Fold the pastry over, pressing firmly
together to seal. Brush with egg, then bake in the oven for 30 minutes.
Slice and serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, onion, monkfish fillet, paprika, red pepper, aubergine, vegetable oil, puff pastry, breadcrumb, egg, salt, pepper

fields.title: Mixed seafood chowder
fields.ingredients:
1 onion, finely chopped
1 green pepper, seeded and
finely chopped
2 celery sticks, finely sliced
1 carrot, finely chopped
3 garlic cloves, finely minced
3 tablespoons olive oil
450g/1lb canned chopped
plum tomatoes
250ml/9fl oz tomato pur\u00e9e
1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil
leaves
1 bay leaf
1 teaspoon salt
1\u20442 teaspoon freshly ground
black pepper
450g/1lb halibut steak
12 fresh mussels
375ml/13fl oz dry white wine
250g/9oz raw prawns, peeled
and deveined
250g/9oz scallops
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the onion, green pepper, celery, carrot, garlic and olive oil in a
heavy saucepan or casserole dish, and saut\u00e9 the vegetables on a
medium heat for 15\u201320 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes, tomato pur\u00e9e,
basil, bay leaf, salt and pepper.
\u2022 Increase the heat and bring to a rolling boil for 1\u20132 minutes, then reduce
the heat to low and simmer for 2 minutes.
\u2022 Meanwhile, skin and wash the halibut and cut into bite-size pieces.
Scrub the mussels thoroughly, removing the beards. Discard any that are
damaged or do not close when tapped on the work surface.
\u2022 Stir the white wine into the sauce, and remove and discard the bay leaf.
Add the halibut, prawns and scallops, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Arrange the mussels in a layer on top of the fish in the saucepan. Cover
tightly and steam for about 10 minutes or until the shells are fully opened
and the halibut flakes easily. Discard any mussels that do not open in
the cooking.
\u2022 Ladle into individual serving bowls and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: onion, green pepper, celery, carrot, garlic, olive oil, plum tomato, tomato, basil leaf, bay leaf, salt, pepper, halibut steak, mussel, white wine, prawn, scallop

fields.title: Prawn & paneer kebabs
fields.ingredients:
3 tablespoons Greek-style yogurt
450g/1lb large prawns, peeled
and deveined but tails left intact 1\u20442 red pepper, seeded and cut into
chunks 1
]\u20442 yellow pepper, seeded and cut
into chunks 1\u20442 red onion, cut into small chunks
100g/4oz paneer cheese, cubed
75ml/3fl oz vegetable oil
1 teaspoon mustard seeds
3 curry leaves
25g/1oz grated coconut
For the spice paste
5 fresh green chillies
3 fresh red chillies
2 garlic cloves
2.5cm/1in piece of fresh root
ginger, chopped
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lemon juice
2 tablespoons vinegar
1 tablespoon cumin seeds
1 tablespoon garam masala
pinch of ground turmeric
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the spice paste, put all the ingredients in a blender or food
processor and add 75ml/3fl oz water. Pur\u00e9e to a fine paste.
\u2022 Transfer the paste to a large bowl, add the yogurt and mix well. Stir in
the prawns, peppers and onion, and marinate in the refrigerator for
1 hour.
\u2022 Spear the prawns, vegetables and paneer alternately onto bamboo or
metal skewers.
\u2022 Heat 4 tablespoons of the oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat.
Put the kebabs in the pan and cook for 10 minutes, turning regularly to
brown evenly.
\u2022 In a separate frying pan, heat the remaining oil, then add the mustard
seeds and curry leaves. As the mustard seeds begin to pop, pour the
contents of the pan over the cooked kebabs.
\u2022 Transfer the kebabs to serving plates, garnish with the coconut and serve
immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: greekk yogurt, prawn, red pepper, yellow pepper, red onion, paneer cheese, vegetable oil, mustard seed, curry leaf, coconut, green chilli, garlic, ginger, lemon juice, vinegar, cumin seed, garam masala, turmeric

fields.title: Pan-fried crusted fish curry
fields.ingredients:
4 dried red chillies
100g/4oz shallots
3 garlic cloves, chopped
2 lemon grass stalks, white part only
and tough outer layer removed,
finely sliced
4 fresh coriander roots
2 teaspoons grated lime zest
1\u20442 teaspoon green peppercorns,
roughly chopped
125ml/4fl oz vegetable oil
4 skinless snapper fillets, about
200g/7oz each
125ml/4fl oz coconut milk
1 tablespoon Thai fish sauce
4 kaffir lime leaves, finely shredded
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lime juice
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Soak the chillies in a bowl of boiling water for 15 minutes. Drain and
chop roughly.
\u2022 Put the chillies, shallots, garlic, lemon grass, coriander, lime zest,
peppercorns and 1 tablespoon of the oil in a blender or food processor,
and pur\u00e9e until a smooth paste forms. Spread the paste over one side of
each snapper fillet.
\u2022 Heat the remaining oil in a large heavy pan. Cook the snapper fillets for
3 minutes on each side until just cooked.
\u2022 Stir together the coconut milk, fish sauce, lime leaves and lime juice in a
bowl or jug. Pour over the snapper fillets, and simmer for 3 minutes.
Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: dried red chilli, shallot, garlic clove, lemon grass stalk, coriander, lime zest, green peppercorn, vegetable oil, snapper fillet, coconut milk, thai fish sauce, kaffir lime leaf, lime juice.

fields.title: Salmon in aspic
fields.ingredients:
1.8kg/4lb whole fresh salmon
1 teaspoon aspic jelly crystals
2 tablespoons redcurrant jelly
For the sauce
150ml/5fl oz red wine vinegar
1 onion, sliced
3 bay leaves
12 black peppercorns
450ml/3\u20444pt water
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the sauce ingredients in a large pan, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Cool and drain through a sieve.
\u2022 Put the salmon in a large heavy roasting tin, and pour the sauce over it.
Cover the tin and poach very gently for 20\u201330 minutes. Leave to cool.
\u2022 When completely cold, gently lift the fish out of the roasting tin. Carefully
peel off the skin and scrape off any dark brown flesh.
\u2022 Strain the cooking liquid through muslin, pour into a large pan and boil
over a high heat until the liquid has reduced to 300ml/10fl oz. Add the
aspic and redcurrant jelly, and stir to dissolve. Leave to cool and chill
until nearly set.
\u2022 Arrange the salmon on a plate, and brush with the liquid aspic. Chill
before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: salmon, aspic jelly crystal, redcurrant jelly, red wine vinegar, onion, bay leaf, black peppercorn, water

fields.title: Tuna with pak choi
fields.ingredients:
4 tuna fillets, about 175g/6oz each
3 fresh red chillies, thinly sliced
2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced
225ml/8fl oz red wine
1 tablespoon olive oil
200g/7oz pak choi, coarsely
chopped
100g/4oz button mushrooms,
halved lengthways
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the pieces of tuna in a single layer in a glass or ceramic dish.
Sprinkle the chillies and garlic over the tuna, and pour the wine over the
top. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
\u2022 Lift the tuna out of the marinade, drain on kitchen paper and season with
a little salt.
\u2022 Pour the marinade into a small pan, season with salt and pepper, then
simmer for a few minutes until reduced by about half. Remove from the
heat, cover and keep warm.
\u2022 Heat a ridged cast-iron grill pan until very hot. Dip a wad of kitchen
paper in oil, and wipe it over the hot pan. Put the tuna in the pan, and
chargrill for 3\u20134 minutes.
\u2022 Heat the remaining oil in a wok or large deep frying pan until very hot.
Add the pak choi and mushrooms, and stir-fry over a high heat for about
3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 To serve, cut the tuna fillets in half, mound the vegetables on warmed
plates and top with the tuna and marinade. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: tuna fillet, red chilli, garlic, red wine, olive oil, pak choi, button mushroom, salt, pepper

fields.title: Creamy fish gratin
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz butter
175g/6oz leeks, roughly chopped
450ml/3\u20444pt fish stock
300ml/10fl oz vermouth
4 tablespoons Pernod
350g/12oz monkfish fillet, cut into
large pieces
350g/12oz salmon fillet, cut into
large pieces
225g/8oz raw prawns, peeled
and deveined
225g/8oz raw scallops, halved
175g/6oz onions, chopped
100g/4oz plain flour
150ml/5fl oz double cream
450ml/3\u20444pt milk
75g/3oz Parmesan cheese, grated
75g/3oz Gruy\u00e8re cheese, grated
1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
4 eggs, separated
15g/1\u20442oz coarse breadcrumbs
salt and ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0C/375\u00b0F/Gas mark 5.
\u2022 Melt 25g/1oz of the butter in a pan. Add the leeks and cook, stirring,
for 4\u20135 minutes until golden. Pour in the stock, vermouth and Pernod,
and bring to the boil. Add the monkfish and salmon, and simmer for
2\u20133 minutes, then add the prawns and scallops, and simmer for another
3 minutes. Remove the fish, reserve the liquor and wipe out the pan.
\u2022 Add 50g/2oz of the butter and the onions to the pan, and cook for
10 minutes or until soft and golden. Stir in 50g/2oz of the flour, and
cook for a further minute, stirring. Pour in the reserved poaching liquor
and the cream, whisking to prevent lumps forming. Bring to the boil and
bubble hard for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Put the fish
and leeks in a 2.4-litre/4pt ovenproof dish, then pour the hot sauce over
the top.
\u2022 Melt the remaining butter in a large pan, add the remaining flour and
cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Pour in the milk and, whisking continuously,
bring the mixture to the boil. Stir in 100g/4oz of the cheeses and the
mustard. Cool slightly, then stir in the egg yolks. Season well.
\u2022 Whisk the egg whites in a bowl until they form soft peaks, then fold them
into the sauce. Spoon the topping over the fish, and sprinkle with the
remaining cheeses and the breadcrumbs. Cook for 1 hour and serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, leek, fish stock, vermouth, monkfish fillet, salmon fillet, prawn, scallop, onion, flour, double cream, milk, parmesan, guyere, mustard, egg, breadcrumbs, salt, pepper

fields.title: Fried squid curry
fields.ingredients:
3 tablespoons vegetable oil
900g/2lb small squid, cleaned
and cut into 2.5cm/1in rings
1 teaspoon soft brown sugar
For the curry sauce
2 small onions, finely chopped
3 garlic cloves, crushed
8 curry leaves
7cm/3in piece of cinnamon stick,
broken in half
1 lemon grass stalk, tough outer
layer removed, bruised 1\u20442 teaspoon ground ginger
1 teaspoon ground turmeric
1 teaspoon chilli powder
1 tablespoon Sri Lankan curry
powder
3 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lime juice
600ml/1pt coconut milk
salt
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put all the ingredients for the curry sauce into a heavy saucepan and
bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer the sauce for about
45 minutes until it is very thick.
\u2022 Heat half of the the oil in a large frying pan, and add half of the squid.
Cook over a fairly high heat, stirring constantly, for 1\u20132 minutes until the
squid has turned white and is just cooked. Using a slotted spoon,
transfer the squid to the curry sauce, and repeat the process with the
remaining oil and squid.
\u2022 Stir the sugar into the squid curry, and simmer the curry gently for
5 minutes to heat through. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
Serve at once.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, squid, sugar, onion, garlic, curry leaf, cinnamon stick, lemon grass, ginger, turmeric, chilli powder, curry powder, lime juice, coconut milk, salt

fields.title: Prawn burgers
fields.ingredients:
12 large raw prawns, peeled and
deveined
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lemon juice
1 tablespoon sesame seeds
100g/4oz fresh white breadcrumbs
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
coriander leaves
1 egg, lightly beaten
2 teaspoons chilli sauce
plain flour for dusting
olive oil for frying
75g/3oz mayonnaise
1 spring onion, finely chopped
1 tablespoon tomato ketchup
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
4 hamburger buns, halved
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Flatten the prawns slightly to open out, and mix with the lemon juice.
\u2022 Combine the sesame seeds, breadcrumbs and coriander on a sheet of
baking parchment. Combine the egg and chilli sauce in a bowl. Dredge
the prawns in the flour and shake off the excess. Dip in the egg and
press firmly in the breadcrumbs. Put on a tray covered in baking
parchment, cover and chill for 10 minutes.
\u2022 Heat a little oil in a frying pan. Cook the prawns in batches over a
medium heat for 2\u20133 minutes on each side. Remove and drain on
kitchen paper.
\u2022 Combine the mayonnaise, spring onion, tomato and Worcestershire
sauces in a bowl.
\u2022 Put the prawns in the burger buns, and serve with the sauce.
fields.ingredient_tags: prawn, lemon juice, sesame seed, breadcrumbs, coriander leaf, egg, chilli sauce, flour, olive oil, mayonnaise, onion, tomato ketchup, worcestershire sauce, hamburger bun

fields.title: Salt & pepper squid
fields.ingredients:
900g/2lb squid hoods, halved
lengthways
250ml/9fl oz freshly squeezed
lemon juice
250g/9oz cornflour
1.5 tablespoons salt
1 tablespoon ground white pepper
2 teaspoons caster sugar
4 egg whites, lightly beaten
vegetable oil for deep-frying
lemon wedges, to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Open out the squid hoods, wash and pat dry with kitchen paper. Lay
on a chopping board with the insides facing upwards. Score a fine
diamond pattern in the squid, being careful not to cut all the way
through. Cut into pieces about 5 x 3cm/2 x 1.25in. Put in a flat glass or
ceramic dish, and pour the lemon juice over. Cover and refrigerate for
15 minutes. Drain and pat dry with kitchen paper.
\u2022 Combine the cornflour, salt, white pepper and sugar in a bowl. Dip
the squid in the egg white, and dredge in the flour mixture, shaking off
any excess.
\u2022 Fill a deep heavy pan one-third full with oil, and heat until a cube of
bread browns in 15 seconds. Deep-fry the squid, in batches, for
1\u20132 minutes until the squid turns white and curls. Drain on kitchen paper.
Serve immediately with lemon wedges.
fields.ingredient_tags: squid, lemon juice, cornflour, salt, white pepper, sugar, egg, vegetable oil, lemon wedges

fields.title: Seafood fajitas
fields.ingredients:
250g/9oz scallops
300g/11oz raw prawns
250g/9oz skinless hake fillets
3 tomatoes, finely chopped
1 red chilli, finely chopped
2 spring onions, finely sliced
Salt and pepper
75ml/3fl oz lime juice
1 garlic clove, crushed
1 avocado
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lemon juice
4 flour tortillas
1 onion, thinly sliced
1 green pepper, seeded and sliced
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Slice or pull off any vein, membrane or white muscle from the scallops,
leaving any roe attached. Peel and devein the prawns. Cut the hake into
bite-size pieces.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 160\u00b0C/325\u00b0F/Gas mark 3. Combine the tomato,
chilli and spring onion in a bowl, and season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Combine the scallops, prawns, hake, lime juice and garlic in another
bowl, cover and refrigerate while preparing the other ingredients.
\u2022 Slice the avocado and brush with the lemon juice to prevent browning.
\u2022 Wrap the tortillas in foil and heat in the oven for 10 minutes.
\u2022 Heat a lightly oiled cast-iron grill pan until very hot, add the onion and
pepper and cook, turning occasionally, until lightly brown. Push them all
to one side of the pan. Drain the seafood thoroughly, and cook briefly
until it is seared all over and cooked through.
\u2022 To serve, wrap the seafood, onion, green pepper, avocado and tomato
mixture in the tortillas. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: scallops, raw prawns, hake fillets, tomatoes, red chilli, onion, salt, pepper, lime juice, garlic, avocado, lemon juice, tortillas, green pepper

fields.title: Kettle-cooked sea bass
fields.ingredients:
1.8kg/4lb sea bass, gutted, with
head and tail left on
1 large bunch of spring onions,
shredded
2 celery sticks, cut into matchsticks
5cm/2in piece of fresh root ginger,
cut into matchsticks
vegetable oil for brushing
50ml/2fl oz light soy sauce
50ml/2fl oz dry sherry
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Wash the fish inside and out, then pat dry thoroughly. Using a sharp
knife, make several deep diagonal slashes on both sides of the fish.
\u2022 Pour water under the rack of a fish kettle, and put half of the spring
onion, celery and ginger on the rack. Brush the outside of the fish lightly
with oil, then place over the flavourings on the rack. Sprinkle the
remaining spring onion, celery and ginger over the fish, then the soy
sauce and sherry. Season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Cover the kettle with its lid, bring the water slowly to the boil, then
simmer for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: sea bass, onion, celery sticks, ginger, vegetable oil, soy sauce, dry sherry, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Alaskan salmon chowder
fields.ingredients:
200g/7oz canned Alaskan
pink salmon
100g/4oz onions, chopped
100g/4oz celery, chopped
1 garlic clove, minced
25g/1oz margarine
225g/8oz potatoes, diced
175g/6oz carrots, diced
450ml/3/4pt fish stock 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
100g/4oz broccoli, chopped
375ml/13fl oz evaporated milk
275g/10oz frozen sweetcorn
kernels, thawed
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Drain and flake the salmon, reserving the liquid.
\u2022 Saut\u00e9 the onions, celery and garlic in margarine in a large frying pan
until soft. Add the potatoes, carrots, reserved salmon liquid, fish stock,
thyme and pepper. Simmer, covered, for 20 minutes or until the
vegetables are nearly tender.
\u2022 Add the broccoli and cook for 5 minutes. Add the flaked salmon,
evaporated milk and sweetcorn, and heat thoroughly. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: canned alaskan pink salmon, onion, celery, garlic, margarine, potato, carrot, fish stock, dried thyme, black pepper, broccoli, milk, frozen sweetcorn kernels

fields.title: Dover sole with capers
fields.ingredients:
olive oil for drizzling
4 Dover sole, skinned
2 tablespoons capers, rinsed
and drained
2 tablespoons finely chopped
fresh marjoram
salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 lemons, cut into wedges, to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0C/425\u00b0F/Gas mark 7.
\u2022 Heat two flat baking trays, scatter them with salt and pepper, and
drizzle with olive oil.
\u2022 Lay the Dover sole on the trays. Scatter over the capers and marjoram,
season with salt and pepper, and drizzle with olive oil.
\u2022 Put the trays in the oven, and roast the fish for 10\u201315 minutes until the
flesh comes away easily from the bone when tested with a knife. Serve
hot with the lemon wedges for squeezing over.
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, dover sole, capers, marjoram, salt, black pepper, lemons

fields.title: Sole V\u00e9ronique
fields.ingredients:
12 sole fillets
250ml/9fl oz fish stock, made from
stock cubes
50ml/2fl oz white wine
1 shallot, finely sliced
1 bay leaf
6 black peppercorns
15g/1\u20442oz butter
3 teaspoons flour
125ml/4fl oz milk
50ml/2fl oz single cream
125g/4.5oz seedless white
grapes, peeled
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 Roll the fillets into coils with the skin on the inside. Secure with
toothpicksm and put in a well-greased ovenproof dish.
\u2022 Combine the stock, wine, shallot, bay leaf and peppercorns in a jug,
and pour over the fish. Cover with greased foil and bake for 15 minutes
or until the fish flakes when tested with a fork. Carefully lift the fish out
of the liquid with a slotted spoon, put in another dish, cover and
keep warm.
\u2022 Pour the cooking liquid into a saucepan, and boil for about 2 minutes
until reduced by half, then strain.
\u2022 In a clean pan, melt the butter, add the flour and stir for 1 minute, or
until pale and foaming. Remove from the heat and gradually stir in the
milk, cream and strained cooking liquid. Return to the heat, and stir until
the mixture boils and thickens.
\u2022 Add the grapes, then stir until heated through. Serve immediately, with
the sauce poured over the fish.
fields.ingredient_tags: sole fillets, fish stock, white wine, shallot, bay leaf, black peppercorns, butter, flour, milk, single cream, white grapes

fields.title: Seafood medley
fields.ingredients:
2 tablespoons white wine
1 egg white, lightly beaten
1\u20442 teaspoon five-spice powder
1 teaspoon cornflour
300g/11oz raw peeled prawns,
deveined
100g/4oz prepared squid, cut
into rings
100g/4oz cod fillets, cut into strips
vegetable oil for deep-frying
1 green pepper, seeded and cut
into strips
1 carrot, cut into thin strips
4 baby corn cobs, halved
lengthways
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Mix the wine, egg white, five-spice powder and cornflour in a large
bowl. Add the prawns, squid and cod, and stir to coat evenly. Remove
with a slotted spoon, reserving any leftover cornflour mixture.
\u2022 Heat the oil in a wok, and deep-fry the prawns, squid and cod for
2\u20133 minutes. Remove from the wok with a slotted spoon and set aside.
\u2022 Pour off all but 1 tablespoon of oil from the wok and return to the heat.
Add the pepper, carrot and corn cobs, and stir-fry for 4\u20135 minutes.
\u2022 Return the prawns, squid and cod to the wok with any remaining
cornflour mixture. Heat through, stirring, and serve hot with rice.
fields.ingredient_tags: white wine, egg, five-spice powder, cornflour, prawns, squid, cod fillets, vegetable oil, green pepper, carrot, baby corn cobs

fields.title: Ceviche
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb haddock fillets
1 teaspoon coriander seeds
1 teaspoon black peppercorns
juice of 6 limes
1 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 bunch of spring onions,
finely chopped
4 tomatoes, chopped
Tabasco sauce, to taste
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
coriander leaves
1 avocado
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To skin the haddock fillets, put them skin side down on a board, dip
your fingers in salt, then grip the tail end of the skin. Using a sharp
knife, flake off the flesh of the fish by working away from you with a
sawing action.
\u2022 Wash the fillets, then pat them dry with kitchen paper. Cut diagonally
into thin even strips, and put in a bowl.
\u2022 Crush the coriander seeds and peppercorns to a fine powder using a
mortar and pestle. Mix with the lime juice and salt, then pour over the
fish. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 24 hours, turning the fish
occasionally.
\u2022 The next day, heat the oil in a pan, add the spring onions and fry gently
for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and Tabasco sauce to taste, and toss
together briskly over the heat for 1\u20132 minutes. Remove from the heat and
leave to cool for 20\u201330 minutes.
\u2022 To serve, drain the fish from the marinade, discarding the marinade.
Combine the fish with the spring onion and tomato mixture and the
chopped coriander. Halve the avocado, peel and remove the stone.
Slice the flesh widthways. Arrange the slices around the edge of a
serving bowl, and pile the ceviche in the centre. Serve chilled.
fields.ingredient_tags: haddock fillets, coriander, black peppercorns, lime juice, salt, olive oil, onion, tomato, tabasco sauce, coriander leaves, avocado

fields.title: Fresh baked sardines
fields.ingredients:
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 large onions, sliced into rings
3 garlic cloves, chopped
2 large courgettes, cut into sticks
3 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves
8 sardine fillets
75g/3oz Parmesan cheese,
freshly grated
4 eggs, beaten
150ml/5fl oz milk
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a frying pan. Add the onions and garlic,
and saut\u00e9 for 2\u20133 minutes. Add the courgettes and cook for about
5 minutes until golden. Stir 2 tablespoons of the thyme into the mixture.
\u2022 Put half of the onions and half of the courgettes in the bottom of a large
ovenproof dish. Top with the sardine fillets and half of the Parmesan. Put
the remaining onions and courgettes on top, and sprinkle with the
remaining thyme.
\u2022 Mix the eggs and milk together in a bowl, and season with salt and
pepper. Pour the mixture over the vegetables and sardines in the dish.
Sprinkle the remaining Parmesan over the top.
\u2022 Bake in the oven for 20\u201325 minutes until golden and set. Serve
immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, onion, garlic, courgettes, thyme leaves, sardine fillets, parmesan, egg, milk, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Ocean pie
fields.ingredients:
500g/1lb 2oz cod fillet, skinned
225g/8oz salmon steak
450ml/3\u20444pt skimmed milk
1 bay leaf
900g/2lb potatoes, coarsely
chopped
50g/2oz peeled and deveined
prawns
50g/2oz margarine
25g/1oz plain flour
3 tablespoons white wine
1 teaspoon chopped fresh dill
2 tablespoons rinsed and
drained capers
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6.
\u2022 Put the cod and salmon into a saucepan with 300ml/10fl oz of the milk
and the bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil, cover
and simmer gently for 10\u201315 minutes until tender.
\u2022 Cook the potatoes in salted boiling water for about 15 minutes until
tender.
\u2022 Drain the fish, reserving the cooking liquid. Flake the fish, discarding
any bones, and put in a shallow ovenproof dish. Add the prawns.
\u2022 Melt half of the margarine in a saucepan, add the flour and cook,
stirring, for 1 minute. Gradually stir in the reserved cooking liquid and
the wine, and bring to the boil. Add the dill, capers and salt and pepper
to taste, and simmer until thickened. Pour over the fish and mix well.
\u2022 Drain the potatoes and mash them, adding the remaining margarine and
the remaining milk. Season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Spread the mashed potatoes over the fish, and cook in the oven for
about 25 minutes or until piping hot and browned. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: cod fillet, salmon steak, milk, bay leaf, potato, prawns, margarine, flour, white wine, dill, capers, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Skate with black butter
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz butter, chopped, plus a
little extra
900g/2lb small skate wings
600ml/1pt fish stock
75ml/3fl oz malt vinegar
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To clarify the butter, melt in a pan over a low heat without stirring.
Remove from the heat and cool slightly. Skim off the foamy mixture from
the surface. Pour off the clear yellow liquid and reserve. Discard the
milky sediment left in the pan.
\u2022 Pat the skate dry with kitchen paper. Cut fillets from either side of the
cartilage using a sharp knife, cutting close to the cartilage. Place skin
side down on a chopping board and, using a sawing motion, cut along
the length of the wing. Cut into similar-sized pieces.
\u2022 Put the stock and vinegar in a large heavy pan, and bring to the boil.
Add the skate and poach for 8 minutes. Drain well and pat dry with
kitchen paper.
\u2022 Melt a little butter in a frying pan, and cook the skate for 1\u20132 minutes on
each side until tender. Put on a serving dish and keep warm.
\u2022 Heat the clarified butter in a pan until brown and foaming. Pour over the
skate, and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, skate wings, fish stock, vinegar

fields.title: Smoked fish with white sauce
fields.ingredients:
900g/2lb haddock fillets, cut into
serving-sized pieces
225ml/8fl oz milk
225ml/8fl oz water
For the white sauce
600ml/1pt milk
1 onion, halved
1 bay leaf
pinch of ground white pepper
50g/2oz butter
40g/1.5oz plain flour
1\u20132 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 For the white sauce, combine the milk in a small pan with the onion, bay
leaf and white pepper. Heat slowly to a simmer, then remove from the
heat and allow to stand for 3 minutes before straining into a jug. Melt
the butter in a pan over a low heat, stir in the flour and cook for
1 minute or until pale and foaming.
\u2022 Remove from the heat and gradually stir in the milk.
\u2022 Return to the heat and stir constantly until the sauce boils and thickens.
Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and
season with salt and pepper. Stir in the parsley. Keep warm.
\u2022 Put the haddock pieces in a large frying pan. Combine the milk with
225ml/8fl oz water. Pour into the pan to cover the haddock. Bring to
the boil, reduce the heat to low and gently cook the fish until it flakes
easily at the thickest part when tested with a fork.
\u2022 Lift the haddock out of the pan using a slotted spoon. Drain on kitchen
paper, and place on serving plates. Top with the white sauce, and serve
immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: haddock fillet, milk, onion, bay leaf, white pepper, butter, flour, parsley, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Stuffed crabs
fields.ingredients:
6 cooked medium blue
swimmer crabs
50g/2oz butter
2 garlic cloves, finely chopped
1\u20442 red pepper, seeded and
finely chopped 1\u20442 green pepper, seeded and
finely chopped
1 small onion, finely chopped
1 celery stick, finely chopped
1\u20442 fresh red chilli, finely chopped
1\u20444 teaspoon celery salt
1\u20444 teaspoon dried thyme
175ml/6fl oz canned condensed
seafood bisque
75g/3oz fresh breadcrumbs
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6.
\u2022 Pull away the crab legs and claws, crack open and extract the meat
from the legs.
\u2022 Reserve 2 front claws on each crab. Lift the flap on the underside of the
crab and prise off the top shell. Remove the soft organs and pull off the
gills. Scrub the crab back shells and set aside. Shred the crab meat,
picking out the shell fragments.
\u2022 Melt the butter in a pan, and add the chopped garlic, peppers, onion,
celery and chilli. Cook, stirring, over a medium heat, for about 5
minutes. Add the celery salt, thyme and bisque, and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the crab meat with half the breadcrumbs. Stir until combined and
season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Spoon the mixture into the crab shells, smooth the tops and press the
remaining crumbs over the surface. Put the crabs on a baking tray, and
bake in the oven for about 15 minutes until heated through and golden,
adding the extra claws close to the end of cooking to warm through.
Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: crab, butter, garlic, red pepper, green pepper, onion, celery stick, red chilli, celery salt, dried thyme, canned seafood bisque, breadcrumbs, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Prawn & spinach lasagne
fields.ingredients:
225g/8oz fresh egg lasagne,
unrolled
1.5 teaspoons salt
For the filling
900g/2lb fresh spinach, stems
removed
50g/2oz butter
1 large onion, finely chopped
450g/1lb raw prawns, peeled
and deveined 1\u20442 teaspoon salt
125ml/4fl oz plain tomato sauce
600ml/1pt b\u00e9chamel sauce
50g/2oz Parmesan cheese, grated
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Roll the lasagne as thinly as possible. With a knife, cut into sheets of
8 x 11cm/31
\u20442 x 41
\u20442in and let them rest on dry tea towels for at least
15 minutes.
\u2022 Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil. Add the salt, and slip in the
pasta, two or three pieces at a time, leaving to cook for 1 minute.
Remove with a slotted spoon, and immerse immediately in cold water.
Lay the pasta on damp tea towels.
\u2022 To make the filling, put the spinach in a large deep pan with no water.
Cook, tossing occasionally, for 5\u201310 minutes. Remove from the heat,
chop finely and set aside.
\u2022 Warm the butter in a frying pan and add the onion. Saut\u00e9 over a
medium heat for 4 minutes. Add the prawns and saut\u00e9 quickly, stirring to
cook evenly. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the chopped
spinach and salt.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6.
\u2022 Combine the tomato and b\u00e9chamel sauces. Select a 25 x 35cm/
10 x 14in baking dish. Smear a very thin layer of sauce on the bottom
of the baking dish. Carefully place a layer of the pasta over the sauce,
to cover the entire area. Smear a thin layer of sauce over the pasta.
Spoon some of the spinach and prawn mixture over it, and sprinkle with
some Parmesan. Repeat the process of layering, ending with a layer of
pasta, topped with sauce and cheese.
\u2022 Bake for about 20 minutes or until the sauce forms a light golden crust.
Remove the dish from the oven and leave to stand for 10 minutes before
serving, cut into slices.
fields.ingredient_tags: egg lasagne, salt, spinach, butter, onion, prawns, salt, tomato sauce, bechamel, parmesan

fields.title: Baked stuffed lobster
fields.ingredients:
50ml/2fl oz vegetable oil
1 large onion, finely chopped
4 garlic cloves, finely chopped
250ml/9oz tomato pur\u00e9e
150ml/5fl oz red wine
225g/8oz cooked canned clams,
with their juice
450g/1lb dried white breadcrumbs
1.5 teaspoons dried oregano
1 teaspoon garlic salt
1 tablespoon freshly grated
Parmesan cheese
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
3 or 4 medium or large lobsters,
halved, intestines removed
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6.
\u2022 Heat the oil and saut\u00e9 the onion and garlic in a frying pan over a
medium heat for about 5 minutes until they are translucent. Add the
tomato pur\u00e9e and cook for 3 minutes, then add the wine and the clams
and their juice. Cook for 5 minutes.
\u2022 In a large mixing bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs, oregano, garlic
salt, Parmesan and parsley. Make a well in the middle, and pour in the
sauce. Stir and mix into a very soft dough. Cover and set aside.
\u2022 Put each lobster on a chopping board, and stuff carefully with the
prepared mixture, making sure that the holes are well filled. Push the
halves together to encase the stuffing. Repeat the exercise with the
remaining lobsters and stuffing.
\u2022 Lightly grease a baking tray, and place the lobsters on it. Bake in the
oven for 45\u201360 minutes, checking halfway through. Serve hot with a
crisp green salad.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, tomato puree, red wine, clams, breadcrumbs, oregano, garlic, salt, parmesan, parsley, lobster

fields.title: Prawn gumbo
fields.ingredients:
50ml/2fl oz vegetable oil, plus
2 tablespoons extra
6 rashers bacon, finely chopped
2.5 tablespoons plain flour
2 onions, finely chopped
1\u20442 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1 red pepper, seeded and chopped
1 green pepper, seeded
and chopped
16 okra, trimmed, halved lengthways
1 bay leaf
850g/1.75lb canned tomatoes
900g/2lb raw prawns, peeled and
deveined, but with tails left intact
1 teaspoon Tabasco sauce
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Heat the 50ml/2fl oz oil in a large saucepan, add the bacon and cook
over a medium heat for 5 minutes. Stir in the flour and cook, stirring,
until the flour turns nutty brown. Remove from the pan. This mixture,
known as a roux, will be used to thicken and flavour the gumbo.
\u2022 Heat the extra 2 tablespoons oil in the saucepan, add the onion,
cayenne and peppers, and cook, stirring, over a medium heat for
5 minutes or until the onion is golden brown.
\u2022 Add the okra, bay leaf and tomatoes to the saucepan, and bring to the
boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes. You may need to add
water if the mixture is too thick.
\u2022 Stir the prawns and the roux into the mixture, add the Tabasco and
season with salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes or until the prawns are
cooked. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, bacon, flour, onion, cayenne pepper, red pepper, green pepper, okra, bay leaf, canned tomato, prawns, tabasco sauce, salt, black pepper.

fields.title: Plum filo pockets
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz skimmed milk
soft cheese
1 tablespoon muscovado sugar
1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
8 large plums, halved and stoned
8 sheets filo pastry
sunflower oil for brushing
icing sugar, to dust
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0C/
425\u00b0F/Gas mark 7.
\u2022 In a small bowl, mix together the
cheese, sugar and cloves.
\u2022 Sandwich the plum halves back
together using a spoonful of the
cheese mixture.
\u2022 Spread out the pastry, and cut into
16 pieces, each about 23cm/9in
square. Brush one lightly with oil,
and place a second diagonally on
top. Repeat the process with the
remaining squares.
\u2022 Put a plum on each pastry square,
and pinch the corners together.
Place on a baking tray. Bake for
15\u201318 minutes until golden, then
dust with icing sugar. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: milk, cheese, sugar, clove, plum, sunflower oil

fields.title: Apple & blackcurrant pancakes
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz plain wholemeal flour
300ml/10fl oz skimmed milk
1 egg, beaten
1 tablespoon sunflower oil
For the filling
450g/1lb cooking apples
225g/8oz blackcurrants
2 tablespoons water
25g/1oz Demerara sugar
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the pancake batter, put the flour in a mixing bowl and make a
well in the centre.
\u2022 Add a little of the milk with the egg and the oil. Beat the flour into the
liquid, then gradually beat in the rest of the milk, keeping the batter
smooth and free from lumps. Cover the batter and chill while you
prepare the filling.
\u2022 Quarter, peel and core the apples. Slice them into a pan and add the
blackcurrants and 2 tablespoons water. Cook over a gentle heat for
10\u201315 minutes until the fruit is soft. Stir in the sugar.
\u2022 Lightly grease a pan with a little sunflower oil. Heat and pour in about
2 tablespoons of the batter, swirl it around and cook for about 1 minute.
Flip the pancake over with a spatula or palette knife, and cook the other
side. Put on a sheet of kitchen paper, and keep hot while cooking the
remaining pancakes.
\u2022 To serve, fill the pancakes with the apple and blackcurrant mixture, and
roll them up. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: flour, milk, egg, sunflower oil, apple, blackcurrant, sugar

fields.title: Exotic fruit pancakes
fields.ingredients:
For the batter
100g/4oz plain flour
pinch of salt
1 egg plus 1 egg yolk
300ml/10fl oz coconut milk
4 teaspoons sunflower oil, plus
extra for frying. For the filling
1 banana
1 papaya
juice of 1 lime
2 passion fruit
1 mango
4 lychees
2 tablespoons honey
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the batter, sift the flour and salt into a bowl. Make a well in the
centre, and add the egg, egg yolk and a little of the coconut milk.
Gradually draw the flour into the egg mixture, beating well and slowly
adding the remaining coconut milk to make a smooth batter. Stir in the
4 teaspoons sunflower oil. Cover and chill for 30 minutes
\u2022 To make the fruit filling, peel and slice the banana, and peel and slice
the papaya, discarding the seeds. Put the banana and papaya in a
bowl, add the lime juice and mix well.
\u2022 Cut the passion fruit in half, and scoop out the pulp and seeds into the
fruit bowl. Peel, stone and dice the mango, and add to the other fruit.
Peel, stone and halve the lychees, and also add to the fruit. Toss through
gently, then stir in the honey.
\u2022 Heat a little oil in a 15cm/6in frying pan. Pour in just enough of the
pancake batter to cover the bottom of the pan, and tilt the pan so that
the batter spreads thinly and evenly.
\u2022 Cook until the pancake is just set and the underside is lightly browned,
then turn and cook on the other side. Remove from the pan and keep
warm. Repeat with the remaining batter to make a total of 8 pancakes.
\u2022 Put a little fruit filling in the centre of each pancake, then roll into a cone.
Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: flour, salt, egg, coconut milk, sunflower oil, banana, papaya, lime, passion fruit, mango, lyche, honey

fields.title: Fried bananas
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz plain flour
1/2 teaspoon bicarbonate of soda
pinch of salt
2 tablespoons sugar
1 egg
2 tablespoons desiccated or
shredded coconut
4 firm bananas
vegetable oil for deep-frying
2 tablespoons clear honey
vanilla ice cream, to serve (optional)
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Sift the flour, bicarbonate of soda and a pinch of salt into a bowl. Stir in
the sugar. Whisk in the egg and just enough water (you will need about
6 tablespoons, added a tablespoon at a time) to make a thin batter.
Whisk in the coconut.
\u2022 Heat enough oil for deep-frying in a preheated wok.
\u2022 Peel the bananas. Carefully cut each one in half lengthways, then cut in
half widthways. Dip in the batter, then gently drop a few pieces at a
time into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown.
\u2022 Remove the bananas from the oil using a slotted spoon, and drain on
kitchen paper. Serve immediately with honey drizzled over and some
vanilla ice cream, if you like.
fields.ingredient_tags: flour, soda, salt, sugar, egg, coconut, banana, vegetable oil, honey, vanilla ice cream

fields.title: Spotted dick
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz plain flour
1 teaspoons baking powder
100g/4oz sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons ground ginger
150g/5oz fresh breadcrumbs
50g/2oz sultanas
100g/4oz currants
100g/4oz suet, grated
2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest
2 eggs, lightly beaten
175ml/6fl oz milk
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Sift the flour, baking powder, sugar and ginger into a large bowl. Add
the breadcrumbs, sultanas, currants, suet and lemon zest. Mix with a
wooden spoon.
\u2022 Combine the egg and milk, add to the dry ingredients and mix well.
Add a little more milk if necessary, then set aside for 5 minutes.
\u2022 Lay a sheet of baking paper on a work surface, and form the mixture
into a roll shape about 20cm/8in long. Roll up the pudding in the paper
and fold up the ends \u2013 but do not wrap too tightly. Wrap in a tea towel,
put it in the top of a steamer, cover and steam for 1 1/2 hours. Do not let
the pudding boil dry \u2013 replenish with boiling water if necessary as the
pudding cooks.
\u2022 Serve with hot custard or fresh cream.
fields.ingredient_tags: flour, baking powder, sugar, ground ginger, breadcrumbs, sultanas, currants, suet, lemon, egg, milk

fields.title: Boozy banana souffl\u00e9
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz low-fat spread
1 teaspoon artificial
sweetener granules
2 eggs, separated
150ml/5fl oz white rum
4 bananas
4 tablespoons reduced-fat
cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche, to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0C/375\u00b0F/Gas mark 5. Lightly grease a
20cm/8in souffl\u00e9 dish with low-fat spread.
\u2022 Pur\u00e9e the low-fat spread, sweetener, egg yolks, rum and bananas in a
blender or food processor. Whisk the egg whites until stiff, and fold into
the mixture with a metal spoon.
\u2022 Turn into the prepared dish, and bake in the oven for about 35 minutes
until risen, golden and just set. Serve hot with the cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche.
fields.ingredient_tags: spread, sweetener granules, egg, white rum, banana, cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche

fields.title: Baked apples in honey & lemon
fields.ingredients:
4 cooking apples
1 tablespoon clear honey
grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
25g/1oz low-fat spread
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 Remove the cores from the apples, leaving them whole. With a sharp
knife, cut lines through the skin of the apples at intervals, and put them
in an ovenproof dish.
\u2022 Mix together the honey, lemon zest and juice, and low-fat spread.
\u2022 Spoon the mixture into the apples, and cover the dish with foil or a lid.
Bake for 40\u201345 minutes until the apples are tender. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: apple, honey, zest, lemon, spread

fields.title: Hot chocolate custard
fields.ingredients:
25g/1oz cornflour
25g/1oz cocoa powder
600ml/1pt skimmed milk
artificial sweetener granules or
a little sugar
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Blend the cornflour and cocoa with
a little of the milk in a saucepan.
Stir in the remaining milk. Bring to
the boil and cook for 3 minutes,
stirring until smooth and thick.
\u2022 Sweeten with artificial sweetener or
sugar to taste. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: cornflour, cocoa powder, milk, sugar, sweetener granules

fields.title: Souffl\u00e9ed rice pudding
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz short-grain rice
3 tablespoons clear honey
750ml/1 1/4 pt skimmed milk
1/2 teaspoon vanilla essence
2 egg whites
1 teaspoon freshly
grated nutmeg
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the rice, honey and milk in a
heavy or non-stick saucepan, and
bring to the boil.
\u2022 Reduce the heat, and put the lid on
the pan. Leave to simmer gently for
1\u201311
\u20444 hours, stirring occasionally to
prevent sticking, until most of the
liquid has been absorbed. Add the
vanilla essence.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0C/
425\u00b0F/Gas mark 7.
\u2022 Put the egg whites in a bowl, and
whisk until they hold soft peaks.
Using a large metal spoon,
carefully fold the egg whites evenly
into the rice mixture, and tip into a
1-litre/13
\u20444pt ovenproof dish.
\u2022 Sprinkle with grated nutmeg and
bake for 15\u201320 minutes until the
pudding is well risen and golden
brown. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: rice, honey, milk, vanilla essence, egg, nutmeg

fields.title: Apple Charlotte
fields.ingredients:
900g/2lb cooking apples
100g/4oz caster sugar
150g/5oz butter
juice of 1 lemon
3 tablespoons sieved apricot jam
8 slices white bread
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 Peel, core and slice the apples, and put them in a pan with the caster
sugar and 25g/1oz of the butter. Add 3 tablespoons water, cover the
pan and poach gently over a low heat for 10 minutes. Remove the lid,
stir and turn up the heat, continuing to cook until you have a thick pur\u00e9e.
Stir in the lemon juice and apricot jam, and reserve.
\u2022 Melt the remaining butter and cut the crusts off the slices of white bread.
Cut the bread into fingers, brush with the butter and use them to line a
20cm/8in mould or souffl\u00e9 dish. Pour in the apple pur\u00e9e, and cover the
top with more butter-soaked bread.
\u2022 Place the dish on a baking sheet, and bake in the oven for 35 minutes
until the top is crisp and golden brown. Allow to cool for 10 minutes
before sliding a palette knife round the edge and turning out onto a
serving dish. Cut into wedges and serve with cream or ice cream.
fields.ingredient_tags: apple, sugar, butter, lemon, apricot jam, bread

fields.title: Caramelized apple tarts
fields.ingredients:
1 pastry sheet from a 375g/13oz
pack puff pastry
100g/4oz white marzipan, chilled
and coarsely grated
4 Braeburn apples, quartered, cored
and sliced
50g/2oz butter
juice of 1 large lemon
25g/1oz Demerara sugar
1/2 teaspoon mixed spice
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6. Grease the bottoms of
six 7.5cm/3in individual tartlet tins.
\u2022 Roll out the pastry sheet more thinly. Stamp out six 12.5cm/5in rounds
of pastry using a pastry cutter. Use to line the tins, and prick the bases
twice with a fork. Chill for 10 minutes.
\u2022 Line the pastry with foil and baking beans. Bake blind for 10 minutes.
Remove the foil and beans, sprinkle in the marzipan and cook for a
further 5 minutes.
\u2022 Quarter, core and slice the apples. Heat the butter in a large non-stick
frying pan. Add the apples, lemon juice, sugar and mixed spice, and
cook over a high heat for 5 minutes, turning as needed, until most of the
lemon juice has evaporated and the apples are just tender.
\u2022 Pile the apple mixture into the warm pastry cases, then put back in the
oven for 2\u20133 minutes. Serve the tartlets warm with cr\u00e8me fra\u00eeche.
fields.ingredient_tags: pastry sheet, marzipan, apple, butter, lemon, sugar, mixed spice

fields.title: Perfumed pineapple salad
fields.ingredients:
1 small pineapple
1 tablespoon icing sugar
1 tablespoon orange-flower
water
100g/4oz fresh dates, stoned
and quartered
225g/8oz strawberries, sliced
fresh mint sprigs, to decorate
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Cut the skin from the pineapple
and, using the tip of a vegetable
peeler, remove as many brown
\u2018eyes\u2019 as possible. Quarter the
pineapple lengthways, remove the
core from each wedge, then slice.
\u2022 Lay the pineapple slices in a
shallow serving bowl. Sprinkle with
icing sugar, and drizzle the
orange-flower water over.
\u2022 Add the dates and strawberries to
the pineapple, cover and chill for
at least 2 hours, stirring once or
twice. Serve chilled, decorated
with a few mint sprigs.
fields.ingredient_tags: pineapple, sugar, date, strawberry, mint

fields.title: Frozen citrus souffl\u00e9
fields.ingredients:
1 tablespoon powdered gelatine
100ml/3 1/2 fl oz very hot water
(not boiling)
3 eggs, separated
100g/4oz caster sugar
grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
grated zest and juice of 1/2 lime
grated zest and juice of 1/2 orange
150ml/5fl oz double or whipping
cream
100g/4oz fromage frais
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Tie a greaseproof paper callar around a 15cm/6in souffl\u00e9 dish.
\u2022 Sprinkle the gelatine into the hot water, stirring well to dissolve. Leave to
stand for 2\u20133 minutes, stirring occasionally, to give a completely clear
liquid. Leave to cool for 10\u201315 minutes.
\u2022 Meanwhile, whisk the egg yolks and sugar together until very pale and
light in texture. Add the zest and juice from the fruits, mixing well. Stir in
the cooled gelatine liquid, making sure that it is thoroughly mixed in.
\u2022 Put the cream in a large chilled bowl, and whip until it holds its shape.
Stir the fromage frais into the cream, mixing it in gently. Fold the cream
mixture into the citrus mixture using a large metal spoon.
\u2022 Using a clean whisk, beat the egg whites in a clean bowl until stiff, then
gently fold into the citrus mixture using a metal spoon. Pour the mixture
into the prepared dish. Transfer to the freezer, and freeze for at least
2 hours until firm. Remove from the freezer 10 minutes before serving
fields.ingredient_tags: gelatine, egg, sugar, lemon, lime, orange, whipping cream, fromage frais

fields.title: Hazelnut pavlova
fields.ingredients:
4 egg whites
225g/8oz caster sugar
1 teaspoon distilled malt vinegar
300ml/10fl oz double cream
50g/2oz toasted hazelnuts,
chopped
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 130\u00b0C/250\u00b0F/Gas mark 1
\u20442.
\u2022 Mix together the egg whites, sugar and vinegar in a clean grease-free
heatproof bowl, and put over a pan of gently simmering water. Beat
with an electric whisk for 10 minutes or until very stiff and shiny.
\u2022 Line a baking sheet with non-stick baking parchment, and spread the
meringue mixture into a rectangle using a metal spatula or palette knife.
Bake for 40 minutes, turn off the oven and leave the meringue inside to
cool completely.
\u2022 Whip the cream until it just holds its shape, and spread over the cold
pavlova. Sprinkle with the nuts, and chill for 2\u20133 hours or overnight. Cut
into thick slices to serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: egg, sugar, vinegar, cream, hazelnut

fields.title: Orange ice cream
fields.ingredients:
8 oranges
1 lemon
200g/7oz caster sugar
500ml/18fl oz double cream
4 tablespoons Grand Marnier
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Finely grate the zest of the oranges and the lemon, and put in a bowl.
Add the juice of 2 oranges, and leave to steep while preparing the
other ingredients.
\u2022 Squeeze the juice of the remaining oranges, combine with the sugar and
cook to reduce to a thick syrup.
\u2022 Whip the cream to soft peaks. Stir the steeped juice and zest into the
syrup. Add the juice of the lemon, then stir the syrup into the cream,
which will immediately thicken. Add the Grand Marnier.
\u2022 Freeze in a shallow container, stirring every 30 minutes for 4 hours, then
leave overnight to freeze before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: orange, lemon, sugar, cream, liqueur

fields.title: Coeurs \u00e0 la cr\u00e8me
fields.ingredients:
225g/8oz cottage cheese
25g/1oz caster sugar
300ml/10fl oz double cream
1 teaspoon lemon juice
2 egg whites, stiffly whisked
150ml/5fl oz single cream
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Press the cottage cheese through a nylon sieve into a bowl. Add sugar
and mix well.
\u2022 Whip the cream until stiff, then add the lemon juice. Mix into the cheese
and sugar mixture. Fold in the stiffly whisked egg whites.
\u2022 Spoon the mixture into four or six individual moulds. Refrigerate
overnight. Serve with the single cream and/or fresh fruit.
fields.ingredient_tags: cottage cheese, sugar, double cream, lemon, egg, cream

fields.title: Blueberry trifle
fields.ingredients:
350g/12oz Madeira cake, cut
into cubes
175ml/6fl oz white wine
125ml/4fl oz elderflower cordial
3 tablespoons blueberry
conserve
500g/1lb 2oz custard
250ml/9fl oz double cream
100g/4oz blueberries
1 tablespoon pistachio nuts,
finely chopped
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the cake into a 2.4-litre/4pt
glass serving bowl. Mix the wine
with 2 tablespoons of the cordial,
and pour over the cake.
\u2022 Dot the blueberry conserve over
the cake, then pour the custard on
top. Whip the cream into soft
peaks, then fold in the remaining
cordial and half of the blueberries.
Add to the trifle.
\u2022 Cover and chill overnight. Scatter
with the nuts and remaining
blueberries before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: madeira cake, wine, elderflower cordial, blueberry, custard, double cream, pistachio

fields.title: Chocolate charlotte
fields.ingredients:
22 boudoir biscuits
4 tablespoons orange-flavoured
liqueur such as Cointreau
250g/9oz dark chocolate (at least
70% cocoa solids), melted
150ml/5fl oz double cream
4 eggs, separated
150g/5oz caster sugar
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Line the bottom of a charlotte mould or a deep 18cm/7in round cake tin
with a piece of baking parchment.
\u2022 Put the boudoir biscuits on a non-reactive tray, and sprinkle with half of
the orange-flavoured liqueur. Use to line the sides of the mould or tin,
trimming if necessary to make a tight fit.
\u2022 Mix the chocolate with the double cream in a bowl, and beat in the egg
yolks. Whisk the egg whites in a large bowl until standing in stiff peaks,
then gradually add the caster sugar, whisking until stiff and glossy.
\u2022 Carefully fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture in two batches,
taking care not to knock out the air. Pour into the centre of the mould,
and trim the biscuits so they are level with the chocolate mixture. Chill
for at least 5 hours before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: biscuit, liqueur, chocolate, double cream, egg, sugar

fields.title: Raspberry mousse
fields.ingredients:
3 teaspoons powdered gelatine
225g/8oz vanilla yogurt
400g/14oz fromage frais
4 egg whites
300g/11oz fresh raspberries,
mashed
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put 1 tablespoon hot water in a
small heatproof bowl, sprinkle the
gelatine over the top and leave
until spongy. Bring a small pan of
water to the boil, remove from the
heat and put the bowl into the pan.
The water should come halfway
up the side of the bowl. Stir the
gelatine until dissolved.
\u2022 In a large bowl, stir the vanilla
yogurt and fromage frais together
to combine, then add the cooled
gelatine and mix well.
\u2022 Using an electric beater, beat the
egg whites until stiff peaks form,
then fold through the yogurt
mixture until just combined.
\u2022 Gently fold the raspberries through
the mixture. Chill for several hours
before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: gelatine, yogurt, fromage frais, egg, raspberry

fields.title: Cr\u00e8me caramel
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz granulated sugar
750ml/1 1/4pt milk
75g/3oz caster sugar
4 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla essence
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 160\u00b0C/325\u00b0F/Gas mark 3. Brush eight
125ml/4fl oz ramekins or moulds with melted butter.
\u2022 Put the granulated sugar and 50ml/2fl oz water in a pan. Stir over a
low heat until the sugar has dissolved. Bring to the boil, reduce the heat
and simmer until the mixture turns golden and starts to caramelize.
Remove from the heat immediately, and pour enough hot caramel into
each ramekin to cover the bottom.
\u2022 To make the custard, heat the milk in a pan over a low heat until almost
boiling. Remove from the heat. Whisk together the caster sugar, eggs
and vanilla essence for 2 minutes, then stir in the warm milk. Strain the
mixture into a jug, and carefully pour into the ramekins.
\u2022 Put the ramekins in a baking dish, and pour in enough boiling water to
come halfway up the sides of the ramekins. Bake for 30 minutes or until
the custard is set. Allow to cool, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours
before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: sugar, milk, egg, vanilla essence

fields.title: Marshmallow ice cream
fields.ingredients:
75g/3oz dark chocolate, broken
into pieces
175g/6oz white marshmallows
150ml/5fl oz milk
300ml/10fl oz double cream
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the chocolate and marshmallows into a pan and pour in the milk.
Warm over a very low heat until the chocolate and marshmallows have
melted. Remove from the heat and leave the mixture to cool completely.
\u2022 Whisk the cream until thick, then fold it into the cold chocolate mixture
with a metal spoon. Pour into a 450g/1lb loaf tin and freeze for at least
2 hours.
fields.ingredient_tags: chocolate, marshmallow, milk, double cream

fields.title: Grilled pink grapefruit
fields.ingredients:
2 pink grapefruit
1 teaspoon granulated sugar
4 scoops vanilla ice cream
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Halve the grapefruit and cut round
the edge of each, between the pith
and the flesh. Separate the
segments. Sprinkle each grapefruit
with sugar.
\u2022 Put in ramekins to keep them
flesh side up, and put on a grill
pan. Grill for 2\u20133 minutes until
starting to lightly brown. Put a
scoop of vanilla ice cream on top
of each, and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: grapefruit, sugar, ice cream

fields.title: Fruit fondue
fields.ingredients:
50g/2oz soft cheese
150ml/5fl oz hazelnut yogurt
1 teaspoon vanilla essence
1 teaspoon caster sugar
selection of fresh fruits for
dipping, such as strawberries,
satsumas, kiwi fruit, grapes,
all cut into bite-size pieces
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Beat the soft cheese with the
yogurt, vanilla essence and sugar
in a bowl.
\u2022 Spoon the mixture into a glass
serving dish set on a platter.
Arrange the prepared fruits around
the dip, and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: cheese, yogurt, vanilla essence, sugar, strawberry, kiwi, grape

fields.title: Persian melon cups
fields.ingredients:
2 small cantaloupe melons
225g/8oz strawberries, hulled
and sliced
3 peaches, peeled and cubed
225g/8oz seedless white grapes
25g/1oz caster sugar
1 tablespoon rose water
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed
lemon juice
crushed ice, to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Carefully cut the melons in half and
remove the seeds. Scoop out the
flesh with a melon baller, taking
care not to damage the skin.
Reserve the melon shells.
\u2022 Put the strawberries in a large
mixing bowl with the melon balls,
peaches, grapes, sugar, rose water
and lemon juice.
\u2022 Pile the fruit into the melon shells,
and chill in the refrigerator for
2 hours.
\u2022 To serve, sprinkle with the crushed
ice, and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: melon, strawberry, peach, grape, sugar, lemon, ice

fields.title: Strawberries in grape jelly
fields.ingredients:
500ml/18fl oz red grape juice
1 cinnamon stick
pared zest and juice of 1 small
orange
1 tablespoon powdered gelatine
225g/8oz strawberries, hulled
and chopped
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Pour the grape juice into a pan, and add the cinnamon stick and orange
zest. Cook over a very low heat for 10 minutes, then strain the juice and
discard the flavourings.
\u2022 Sprinkle the powdered gelatine over the orange juice in a small bowl.
When the mixture is spongy, stir into the grape juice until it has
completely dissolved.
\u2022 Allow the jelly to cool in the bowl until just beginning to set. Stir in the
strawberries, and pour into a 900ml/11
\u20442pt mould. Chill until set.
fields.ingredient_tags: juice, cinnamon, orange, gelatine, strawberry

fields.title: Sweet-stewed dried fruit
fields.ingredients:
500g/1lb 2oz mixed dried
fruit salad
450ml/3
\u2044pt apple juice
2 tablespoons clear honey
2 tablespoons brandy
grated zest and juice of
1 lemon
grated zest and juice of
1 orange
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the fruit salad, apple juice,
honey, brandy, lemon and orange
zests and juices in a small
saucepan. Bring to the boil, and
simmer for about 1 minute.
\u2022 Remove the pan from the heat, and
allow the mixture to cool
completely. Transfer to a large
bowl, cover with cling film and
chill in the refrigerator overnight.
\u2022 To serve, spoon the stewed fruit
into four shallow dishes.
fields.ingredient_tags: fruit salad, juice, honey, liqueur, lemon, orange

fields.title: Melon & orange cups
fields.ingredients:
2 small honeydew melons
1 grapefruit, peeled and
segmented
2 oranges, peeled and
segmented
50g/2oz roasted, unsalted
peanuts
25g/1oz light muscovado sugar
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Halve the melons, scoop out the
seeds and discard, then remove
and chop the flesh. Reserve the
melon shells.
\u2022 In a bowl, mix together the melon
and citrus fruits. Pile the fruits back
into the melon shells.
\u2022 Chop the peanuts and mix with the
sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle over
the fruit and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: melon, grapefruit, orange, peanut, sugar, cinnamon

fields.title: Pineapple flamb\u00e9
fields.ingredients:
1 large ripe pineapple, about
600g/1 1/4lb
25g/1oz butter
50g/2oz soft brown sugar
50ml/2fl oz freshly squeezed
orange juice
25ml/1fl oz vodka
1 tablespoon slivered almonds,
toasted
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Cut away the top and base of the
pineapple, then cut down the
sides, removing all the dark \u2018eyes\u2019.
Cut the pineapple into thin slices.
Using an apple corer, remove the
hard, central core from each slice.
\u2022 Melt the butter in a frying pan with
the sugar. Add the orange juice
and stir until hot. Add as many
pineapple slices as the pan will
hold, and cook for 1\u20132 minutes,
turning once. As each pineapple
slice browns, remove to a plate.
\u2022 Return all the pineapple slices to
the pan, heat briefly, then pour
over the vodka and carefully light
with a long match. Let the flames
die down, then sprinkle with the
almonds and serve at once.
fields.ingredient_tags: pineapple, butter, sugar, juice, vodka, almond

fields.title: Muscat grape frapp\u00e9
fields.ingredients:
1/2 bottle Muscat wine
450g/1lb Muscat grapes
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Pour the wine into a stainless-steel
baking tray, add 150ml/5fl oz
water and freeze for 3 hours or
until completely solid.
\u2022 Scrape the frozen wine with a
tablespoon to make a fine ice.
Combine the grapes with the ice,
and spoon into four shallow
glasses. Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: wine, grape

fields.title: Californian baked pears
fields.ingredients:
25g/1oz butter
1 teaspoon granulated sugar
grated zest of 1/2 lemon
4 dessert pears
300g/11oz canned fruit cocktail
in syrup
1/2 teaspoon mixed spice
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0C/
375\u00b0F/Gas mark 5.
\u2022 Melt the butter in a flameproof
casserole dish. Add the sugar and
lemon zest. Peel the pears, and
turn in this mixture. Cover and
bake for 30 minutes.
\u2022 Add the fruit cocktail and its syrup,
and sprinkle with the mixed spice.
Return to the oven for 10 minutes.
\u2022 Lift the pears out onto warmed
plates. Stir the fruit cocktail well
into the pan juices. Spoon around
the pears, and serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, sugar, lemon, pear, syrup, mixed spice

fields.title: Mango & melon ginger salad
fields.ingredients:
2 avocados, peeled, stoned and
flesh cut into slices
1 mango, peeled and cut into
slices
1 cantaloupe melon, peeled and
cut into slices
Grated zest and juice of 2 limes
100g/4oz Stilton cheese,
crumbled
2 tablespoons finely chopped
stem ginger
2 passion fruit, halved
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Arrange the slices of avocado,
mango and melon decoratively on
a serving plate.
\u2022 Sprinkle the fruit with the lime zest
and juice, Stilton and ginger.
Spoon the passion fruit over the
salad and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: avocado, mango, melon, lime, cheese, ginger, passion fruit

fields.title: Mandarins in syrup
fields.ingredients:
10 mandarin oranges
15g/ 1/2 oz icing sugar
2 teaspoons orange-flower water
15g/1/2 oz chopped pistachio nuts
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Thinly pare a little of the zest from 1 mandarin, and cut into fine shreds
for decoration. Squeeze the juice from 2 mandarins and set aside.
\u2022 Peel the remaining mandarins, removing as much of the white pith as
possible. Arrange the peeled fruit whole in a large glass dish.
\u2022 Mix the reserved mandarin juice, sugar and orange-flower water, and
pour it over the fruit. Cover the dish and chill for at least an hour.
\u2022 Blanch the shreds of mandarin zest in boiling water for 30 seconds.
Drain and leave to cool.
\u2022 To serve, sprinkle the shreds of zest and pistachio nuts over the
mandarins, and serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: orange, sugar, pistachio

fields.title: Coconut cake
fields.ingredients:
2 x packets 450g/1lb chocolate
cake mix
225g/8oz desiccated coconut
2 eggs
125ml/4fl oz sour cream
125ml/4fl oz milk
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/
350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Lightly grease
a loaf tin.
\u2022 Beat together the cake mix,
coconut, eggs, sour cream and
milk for 3\u20134 minutes or until
smooth. Pour the mixture into the
loaf tin.
\u2022 Bake for 45\u201350 minutes until the
top is springy to the touch and a
skewer inserted in the centre comes
out clean. Turn onto a wire rack to
cool, and serve cut in slices.
fields.ingredient_tags: chocolate, coconut, eggs, sour cream, milk

fields.title: Cherry turnover
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb shortcrust pastry
