450g/1lb pitted sour cherries
double cream, to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 Roll out the pastry, and use to line a greased 20cm/8in pie dish,
allowing the sides of the pastry to hang over the edge. Fill the lined dish
with the cherries. Fold the edges of the dough over the filling, sealing
them where they meet in the centre. Prick the pastry top with a fork.
\u2022 Bake in the oven for 30 minutes or until the pastry is lightly browned.
Serve with cream.
fields.ingredient_tags: pastry, sour cherry, double cream

fields.title: Chocolate \u00e9clairs
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz butter
100g/4oz plain flour, sifted
4 eggs, lightly beaten
300ml/10fl oz double cream,
whipped
150g/5oz dark chocolate
(at least 70% cocoa solids),
broken into pieces
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 210\u00b0C/425\u00b0F/Gas mark 7, and grease two
baking trays.
\u2022 Combine the butter and 225ml/8fl oz water in a large heavy saucepan.
Stir over a medium heat until the butter melts. Increase the heat, bring to
the boil, then remove the pan from the heat.
\u2022 Add the flour to the saucepan all at once, and quickly beat into the
buttery water using a wooden spoon. Return to the heat and continue
beating until the mixture leaves the sides of the pan and forms a ball.
Transfer to a large bowl and cool slightly.
\u2022 Beat the mixture to release any remaining heat. Gradually add the egg,
about 3 teaspoonfuls at a time. Beat well after each addition until all the
egg has been added and the mixture is glossy. Spoon the mixture into a
piping bag fitted with a 1.5cm/ 5/8 in plain nozzle.
\u2022 Sprinkle the baking trays lightly with water. Pipe 15cm/6in lengths onto
the trays, leaving room for them to expand. Bake for 10\u201315 minutes.
Reduce the oven temperature to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4, and bake
for a further 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
\u2022 Split each cooled \u00e9clair and remove any uncooked dough. Fill the centre
with cream.
\u2022 Melt the chocolate in a bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water.
Spread the melted chocolate over to the top of each \u00e9clair, in a line
along the top. Allow to set, then serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, flour, egg, double cream, chocolate

fields.title: Sticky plum tart
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz plain flour
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
pinch of salt
75g/3oz butter
1 egg yolk
1 tablespoon chilled water
450g/1lb plums, halved, stoned
and diced
25g/1oz caster sugar
3 tablespoons apricot jam
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Sift the flour into a blender or food processor, add the ground cinnamon,
salt, butter and egg yolk. Process for 30 seconds or until evenly
combined. Add the chilled water and process for a further 30 seconds.
Knead together lightly, and roll out to a circle about 25.5cm/10in in
diameter. Put on a baking tray and chill for 10\u201315 minutes.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6.
\u2022 Prick the pastry all over with a fork. Bake for 20\u201325 minutes or until
golden brown.
\u2022 Arrange the plums over the cooked pastry, and sprinkle with the sugar.
Put back in the oven for 40\u201345 minutes until the plums are tender.
\u2022 To finish, melt the jam in a small saucepan with 2 tablespoons water,
bring to the boil and bubble for 1 minute. Brush or spoon over the
warm tart to glaze.
fields.ingredient_tags: flour, cinnamon, salt, butter, egg, plum, sugar, jam

fields.title: Fruit salad cake
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz dried fruit salad,
roughly chopped
250ml/9fl oz hot tea
225g/8oz wholemeal
self-raising flour
1 teaspoon grated nutmeg
50g/2oz muscovado sugar
3 tablespoons sunflower oil
75ml/3fl oz skimmed milk
Demerara sugar, to sprinkle
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Soak the dried fruits in the tea for several hours or overnight. Drain and
reserve the liquid.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Grease an 18cm/7in
round cake tin and line the bottom with non-stick greaseproof paper.
\u2022 Sift the flour into a bowl with the nutmeg. Stir in the muscovado sugar,
fruit salad mixture and tea. Add the oil and milk and mix well.
\u2022 Spoon the mixture into the prepared tin. Sprinkle with Demerara sugar.
Bake for 50\u201355 minutes until firm. Turn out and cool on a wire rack.
fields.ingredient_tags: fruit salad, tea, flour, nutmeg, sugar, sunflower oil, milk

fields.title: Dundee cake
fields.ingredients:
175g/6oz butter
175g/6oz caster sugar
4 eggs
50g/2oz ground almonds
300g/11oz self-raising flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
100g/4oz currants
100g/4oz sultanas
100g/4oz raisins
50g/2oz mixed peel, chopped
25g/1oz whole almonds,
blanched and split
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 240\u00b0C/475\u00b0F/Gas mark 9. Line a 20cm/8in cake
tin with greaseproof paper.
\u2022 Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy, then beat in the eggs,
one at a time, along with the ground almonds.
\u2022 Sift the flour with the salt and baking powder, and gradually add to the
creamed mixture along with the fruit and peel. Put the mixture in the
prepared cake tin, smooth over and lightly arrange the almonds on top.
\u2022 Put the cake in the centre of the oven. Immediately reduce the
temperature to 170\u00b0C/325\u00b0F/Gas mark 3, and bake for 11
\u20442 hours until
the cake is firm and springs back at the touch. Allow to cool in the tin.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, sugar, egg, almond, flour, salt, baking powder, currant, sultanas, raisin, almond,  mixed peel

fields.title: Banana cake
fields.ingredients:
475g/1lb 1oz plain flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
50ml/2fl oz vegetable oil
2 eggs
125ml/4fl oz milk
1 teaspoon vanilla essence
225g/8oz bananas, mashed
2 tablespoons caster sugar
225g/8oz vanilla yogurt
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Grease 2 x 20cm/8in
round cake tins.
\u2022 Sift together the dry ingredients into a large mixing bowl.
\u2022 Blend the oil, eggs, milk and vanilla essence until smooth in a separate
bowl, then stir in the bananas. Add to the dry ingredients and stir well.
\u2022 Pour equal amounts into the prepared tins. Bake for 20 minutes, then
cool completely on a wire rack. Sprinkle with the caster sugar. Turn one
of the cooled cakes upside down, and spread the yogurt on its bottom
side. Put the other cake on top, right side up, to make a sandwich.
fields.ingredient_tags: flour,  baking powder, salt, oil, egg, milk, vanilla essence, banana, sugar, yogurt

fields.title: Brandied chocolate cake
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz dark chocolate (at least
70% cocoa solids, broken into
small pieces
2 tablespoons strong black coffee
4 eggs
100g/4oz caster sugar
100g/4oz plain flour, sifted
4 tablespoons brandy
whipped cream or ice cream,
to serve
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Grease a 20cm/8in
round springform cake tin.
\u2022 Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering
water. Stir in the coffee and put aside until cooled.
\u2022 Beat the eggs, gradually beat in the sugar and continue beating until soft
and creamy. Fold in the flour alternately with the cooled chocolate mixture.
\u2022 Pour the mixture into the prepared tin, and bake in the oven for
30\u201335 minutes. Leave in the tin to cool for 10 minutes before turning out
onto a wire rack. While the cake is still warm, sprinkle the brandy over,
then chill overnight. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.
fields.ingredient_tags: chocolate, coffee, egg, sugar, flour, whipped cream, ice cream

fields.title: Butterfly cakes
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz butter, softened
150g/5oz caster sugar
175g/6oz self-raising flour, sifted
125ml/4fl oz milk
2 teaspoons vanilla essence
2 eggs
125ml/4fl oz double cream,
whipped to soft peaks
100g/4oz strawberry jam
icing sugar, to dust
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Line a 12-hole shallow
muffin tin with paper cases.
\u2022 Put the butter, sugar, flour, milk, vanilla essence and eggs in a bowl, and
beat with an electric mixer on a low speed for 2 minutes or until well
mixed. Increase the speed and beat for another 2 minutes or until
smooth and pale.
\u2022 Divide the mixture evenly among the cases, and bake for 20 minutes or
until cooked and golden. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
\u2022 Using a small sharp knife, cut shallow round \u2018lids\u2019 from the top of each
cake. Cut these in half, keeping in pairs. Spoon about 1
\u20442 tablespoon
cream into the hole in the top of each cake, then top with a teaspoon of
jam. Position two halves of the cake tops in the jam to resemble butterfly
wings. Dust the cakes with icing sugar before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, sugar, flour, milk, vanilla essence , egg, double cream, jam

fields.title: Chocolate cake
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz butter, softened
100g/4oz caster sugar
50g/2oz icing sugar
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1 teaspoon vanilla essence
75g/3oz blackberry jam
150g/5oz self-raising flour, sifted
50g/2oz cocoa powder
1 teaspoon bicarbonate of soda
225ml/8fl oz milk
For the chocolate butter cream
50g/2oz dark chocolate (at least
70% cocoa solids), broken into
small pieces
25g/1oz butter
3 teaspoons double cream
3 teaspoons icing sugar, sifted
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4. Lightly grease a
20cm/8in square cake tin, and line with greaseproof paper.
\u2022 Cream the butter and sugars in a small bowl with an electric beater until
light and fluffy. Add the eggs gradually, beating thoroughly after each
addition. Beat in the vanilla and jam. Transfer to a large bowl.
\u2022 Sift together the flour, cocoa and bicarbonate of soda. Using a wooden
spoon, fold the flour mixture into the butter alternately with the milk. Stir
until the mixture is just combined and almost smooth.
\u2022 Pour into the prepared tin, and smooth the surface. Bake for 45 minutes
until a skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and leave in the tin for 15 minutes before turning
onto a wire rack to cool completely.
\u2022 To make the butter cream, stir the ingredients in a small pan over a low
heat until smooth and glossy. Spread over the top of the cooled cake
using a flat-bladed knife. Allow to set.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla essence, jam, flour, cocoa, soda, milk, cream, chocolate, double cream

fields.title: Classic BLT Sandwich
fields.ingredients:
2 slices of toasted bread
3 slices of bacon
2 lettuce leaves
2 tomato slices
Mayonnaise
fields.instructions:
1. Cook the bacon until crisp.
2. Spread mayo on one side of each toasted bread slice.
3. Layer bacon, lettuce, and tomato.
4. Top with the other slice of bread
fields.ingredient_tags: bread, bacon, lettuce, tomato, mayonnaise

fields.title: Margherita Flatbread Pizza
fields.ingredients:
- 1 flatbread
- 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese
- 5 cherry tomatoes, halved
- Fresh basil leaves
- Olive oil
- Salt to taste
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C).
2. Place flatbread on a baking sheet.
3. Drizzle with olive oil.
4. Sprinkle with mozzarella and tomatoes.
5. Bake until cheese is melted, 7-10 minutes.
6. Top with fresh basil and a pinch of salt.
fields.ingredient_tags: flatbread, mozzarella, cherry tomatoe, basil leaves, olive oil, salt

fields.title: Chicken Caesar Wrap
fields.ingredients:
- 1 tortilla wrap
- 1/2 cup cooked chicken strips
- 2 tbsp Caesar dressing
- Romaine lettuce
- Shredded parmesan
fields.instructions:
1. Lay tortilla flat.
2. Layer lettuce, chicken, parmesan, and dressing.
3. Roll up and serve
fields.ingredient_tags: tortilla wrap, chicken strip, caesar dressing, romaine lettuce, parmesan

fields.title: Classic Grilled Cheese
fields.ingredients:
- 2 slices of bread
- 2 slices of cheese
- Butter
fields.instructions:
1. Butter one side of each bread slice.
2. Place cheese between non-buttered sides.
3. Cook on a skillet over medium heat until golden on both sides and cheese is melted.
fields.ingredient_tags: bread, cheese, butter

fields.title: Spicy Guacamole
fields.ingredients:
- 1 ripe avocado
- 1 small tomato, diced
- 1/4 onion, minced
- 1 jalape\u00f1o, minced
- Lime juice, salt, and cilantro
fields.instructions:
1. Mash avocado in a bowl.
2. Mix in tomato, onion, jalape\u00f1o, lime juice, salt, and cilantro.
fields.ingredient_tags: avocado, tomato, onion, jalapeno, lime juice, salt, cilantro

fields.title: Mozzarella Sticks
fields.ingredients:
- Mozzarella string cheese sticks
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1/2 cup bread crumbs
fields.instructions:
1. Dip cheese in egg then coat with breadcrumbs.
2. Fry until golden.
fields.ingredient_tags: mozzarella, egg, bread crumbs

fields.title: Nacho Platter
fields.ingredients:
- Torilla chips
- Shredded cheese
- 1/2 cup bread crumbs
fields.instructions:
1. Spread chips on a tray.
2. Sprinkle cheese and microwave until melted.
3. Top with salsa, sour cream, and jalape\u00f1os.
fields.ingredient_tags: tortilla chips, bread crumbs

fields.title: Classic Beef Burger
fields.ingredients:
- 1/2 lb ground beef
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 tsp garlic powder
- 4 hamburger buns
- Lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles
- Cheese slices (optional)
- Condiments: ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise
fields.instructions:
1. Combine ground beef, salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
2. Shape into 4 patties.
3. Grill or fry until desired doneness.
4. Place on bun, add toppings and condiments of choice.
fields.ingredient_tags: ground beef, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, hamburger buns, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, cheese slice, ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise

fields.title: Spicy Chicken Burger
fields.ingredients:
- 1/2 lb ground chicken
- 1 jalape\u00f1o, finely chopped
- 1/2 tsp paprika
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 4 hamburger buns
- Lettuce, tomato
- Spicy mayo (mix of mayo and sriracha or hot sauce)
fields.instructions:
1. Mix ground chicken, jalape\u00f1o, paprika, salt, and pepper.
2. Form into 4 patties.
3. Grill or fry until fully cooked.
4. Place on bun, add lettuce, tomato, and spicy mayo.
fields.ingredient_tags: chicken, jalapeno, paprika, salt, pepper, hamburger buns, lettuce, tomato, spicy mayo

fields.title: Vegetarian Black Bean Burger
fields.ingredients:
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp cumin
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 4 hamburger buns
- Avocado, lettuce, tomato, onion
fields.instructions:
1. Mash black beans in a bowl.
2. Add onion, bread crumbs, egg, cumin, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
3. Shape into 4 patties.
4. Fry in a pan until golden on both sides.
5. Serve on buns with avocado, lettuce, tomato, and onion.
fields.ingredient_tags: black beans, onion, bread crumbs, egg, cumin, salt, pepper, hamburger buns, avocado, lettuce, tomato, onion

fields.title: Salmon Burger with Dill Sauce
fields.ingredients:
- 1/2 lb fresh salmon, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1 tbsp fresh dill, chopped
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 4 hamburger buns
- *Dill Sauce:* 1/2 cup mayo, 2 tbsp fresh dill, 1 tsp lemon juice, salt and pepper
fields.instructions:
1. Mix salmon, bread crumbs, egg, dill, salt, and pepper.
2. Form into 4 patties.
3. Grill or fry until cooked through.
4. For the dill sauce, mix all ingredients together.
5. Serve burgers on buns with dill sauce.
fields.ingredient_tags: salmon, bread crumbs, egg, salt, pepper, hamburger buns, dill sauce, mayo, dill, lemon juice, salt, pepper

fields.title: Portobello Mushroom Burger
fields.ingredients:
- 4 large portobello mushrooms, stems removed
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Salt and pepper
- 4 hamburger buns
- Lettuce, tomato, onion
- Pesto or mayo for spread
fields.instructions:
1. Brush portobello mushrooms with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
2. Grill or fry until tender.
3. Serve on buns with lettuce, tomato, onion, and a spread of your choice.
fields.ingredient_tags: portobello mushrooms, olive oil, salt, pepper, hamburger buns, lettuce, tomato, onion, pesto, mayo

fields.title: Margherita Pizza
fields.ingredients:
- Pizza dough (store-bought or homemade)
- Olive oil
- Fresh mozzarella, sliced
- Fresh basil leaves
- Tomato slices
- Salt and freshly ground black pepper
- Tomato sauce (store-bought or homemade)
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven as per pizza dough instructions.
2. Roll out the dough on a pizza stone or baking sheet.
3. Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce.
4. Arrange tomato slices and mozzarella evenly.
5. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
6. Bake until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly and slightly browned.
7. Remove from oven, garnish with fresh basil leaves.
fields.ingredient_tags: pizza dough, olive oil, mozzarella, basil leaves, tomato slices, salt, black pepper, tomato sauce

fields.title: BBQ Chicken Pizza
fields.ingredients:
- Pizza dough (store-bought or homemade)
- BBQ sauce
- Cooked chicken, shredded
- Red onion, thinly sliced
- Cilantro, chopped
- Mozzarella cheese, shredded
- Cheddar cheese, shredded
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven.
2. Spread BBQ sauce over the rolled-out dough.
3. Scatter shredded chicken, red onion slices, and both cheeses.
4. Bake until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
5. Garnish with chopped cilantro.
fields.ingredient_tags: pizza dough, bbq sauce, chicken, red onion, cilantro, mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese

fields.title: Veggie Delight Pizza
fields.ingredients:
Pizza dough
- Tomato sauce
- Bell peppers, sliced
- Red onion, sliced
- Mushrooms, sliced
- Black olives, sliced
- Mozzarella cheese, shredded
- Feta cheese, crumbled
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven.
2. Spread tomato sauce on dough.
3. Top with bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, olives, mozzarella, and feta.
4. Bake until crust is crispy and cheese is melted
fields.ingredient_tags: pizza dough, tomato sauce, bell peppers, red onion, mushrooms, black olives, mozzarella cheese, feta cheese

fields.title: Meat Lover's Pizza
fields.ingredients:
Pizza dough
- Tomato sauce
- Pepperoni slices
- Cooked sausage
- Cooked bacon, crumbled
- Ham, diced
- Mozzarella cheese, shredded
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven.
2. Spread sauce on dough.
3. Add all the meat toppings and cover with mozzarella cheese.
4. Bake until golden and bubbly.
fields.ingredient_tags: pizza dough, tomato sauce, pepperoni slices, sausage, bacon, ham, mozzarella cheese

fields.title: White Pizza with Spinach and Ricotta
fields.ingredients:
Pizza dough
- Olive oil
- Fresh garlic, minced
- Ricotta cheese
- Fresh spinach, roughly chopped
- Mozzarella cheese, Shredded
- Parmesan cheese, grated
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven.
2. Brush dough with olive oil and sprinkle with minced garlic.
3. Dot with ricotta cheese and spread spinach evenly.
4. Top with mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses.
5. Bake until golden and cheese is melted.
fields.ingredient_tags: pizza dough, olive oil, garlic, ricotta cheese, spinach, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese

fields.title: Hawaiian Pizza
fields.ingredients:
Pizza dough
- Tomato sauce
- Ham, diced
- Pineapple chunks
- Mozzarella cheese, shredded
- Red chili flakes (optional)
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven.
2. Spread sauce on dough.
3. Add ham and pineapple.
4. Cover with mozzarella.
5. Bake until crust is golden and cheese is melted.
6. Sprinkle with red chili flakes for a little heat if desired.
fields.ingredient_tags: pizza dough, tomato sauce, ham, pineapple chunks, mozzarella cheese, red chili flakes

fields.title: Pesto and Sun-dried Tomato Pizza
fields.ingredients:
Pizza dough
- Pesto sauce
- Sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
- Goat cheese, crumbled
- Arugula
- Olive oil
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven.
2. Spread pesto on the dough.
3. Add sun-dried tomatoes and goat cheese.
4. Bake until crust is golden.
5. Once out of the oven, top with fresh arugula and a drizzle of olive oil.
fields.ingredient_tags: pizza dough, pesto sauce, sun-dried tomato, goat cheese, arugula, olive oil

fields.title: Classic American Hot Dog
fields.ingredients:
- Hot dog buns
- Beef or pork Hot dogs
- Yellow mustard
- Ketchup
- chopped onions
- Relish
- sliced pickles
fields.instructions:
1. Cook the hot dogs according to the package instructions (grilled, boiled, or pan-fried).
2. Place each hot dog in a bun.
3. Top with mustard, ketchup, onions, relish, and pickles.
4. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: hot dog buns, hot dogs, mustard, ketchup, onions, relish, pickles

fields.title: Chili Cheese Dog
fields.ingredients:
- Hot dog buns
- Beef or pork hot dogs
- Canned chili (or homemade chili)
- Grated cheddar cheese
- Diced onions
- Sliced jalape\u00f1os (optional)
fields.instructions:
1. Cook the hot dogs according to the package instructions.
2. Warm the chili in a pot or microwave until hot.
3. Place each hot dog in a bun.
4. Top with hot chili, grated cheese, onions, and jalape\u00f1os if desired.
5. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: hot dog buns, hot dogs, chili, cheddar cheese, onions, jalape\u00f1os

fields.title: New York Street Dog
fields.ingredients:
- Hot dog buns
- Beef or pork hot dogs
- Yellow mustard
- Sauerkraut
- Onions in tomato sauce (store-bought or homemade onion sauce)
fields.instructions:
1. Cook the hot dogs according to the package instructions.
2. Warm the sauerkraut in a pot or microwave.
3. Place each hot dog in a bun.
4. Top with mustard, warm sauerkraut, and onions in tomato sauce.
5. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: hot dog buns, hot dogs, mustard, sauerkraut, onions

fields.title: Mexican Street Corn Hot Dog
fields.ingredients:
- Hot dog buns
- Beef or pork hot dogs
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup grated Cotija cheese
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- Chopped cilantro
- Lime wedges
- Cooked corn kernels
fields.instructions:
1. Cook the hot dogs according to the package instructions.
2. Spread a layer of mayonnaise on the inside of each bun.
3. Place each hot dog in a bun.
4. Top with corn kernels, a sprinkle of Cotija cheese, chili powder, and chopped cilantro.
5. Squeeze a wedge of lime over each hot dog before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: hot dog buns, hot dogs, mayonnaise, cotija cheese, chili powder, cilantro, lime wedges, corn kernels

fields.title: Chicken Shawarma
fields.ingredients:
- 500g boneless chicken thighs
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 tsp ground cumin
- 2 tsp paprika
- 1 tsp turmeric
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 3 tbsp yogurt
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Pita bread, for serving
- Sliced cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, and tahini or garlic sauce, for serving
fields.instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix garlic, cumin, paprika, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, pepper, lemon juice, yogurt, and olive oil.
2. Add chicken thighs to the mixture and marinate for at least 3 hours, preferably overnight.
3. Grill or pan-fry the marinated chicken until fully cooked.
4. Slice the cooked chicken into thin strips.
5. Serve in pita bread with vegetables and your choice of sauce.
fields.ingredient_tags: chicken , garlic cloves, cumin, paprika, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, pepper, lemon juice, yogurt, olive oil, pita bread, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, tahini, garlic sauce

fields.title: Beef Shawarma
fields.ingredients:
- 500g beef sirloin or flank steak, thinly sliced
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 tsp ground coriander
- 2 tsp ground allspice
- 1 tsp ground cardamom
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 3 tbsp vinegar
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Pita bread, for serving
- Tahini sauce, tomatoes, and pickles, for serving
fields.instructions:
1. In a bowl, combine garlic, spices, salt, pepper, vinegar, and olive oil.
2. Add the beef slices and marinate for at least 3 hours.
3. Grill or pan-fry the marinated beef.
4. Serve in pita bread with tahini sauce, tomatoes, and pickles.
fields.ingredient_tags: beef , garlic , coriander, allspice, cardamom, salt, pepper, vinegar, olive oil, pita bread, tahini sauce, tomatoes, pickles

fields.title: Lamb Shawarma
fields.ingredients:
- 500g boneless lamb leg or shoulder, thinly sliced
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 tsp ground cumin
- 2 tsp ground coriander
- 1 tsp paprika
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 3 tbsp yogurt
- 2 tbsp pomegranate molasses or lemon juice
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Pita or flatbread, for serving
- Hummus, mint yogurt sauce, and sliced red onions, for serving
fields.instructions:
1. Mix all the marinade ingredients in a bowl.
2. Add lamb and marinate for at least 3 hours or overnight.
3. Grill or pan-fry the lamb slices.
4. Serve in bread with hummus, mint yogurt sauce, and red onions.
fields.ingredient_tags: lamb, garlic , cumin, coriander, paprika, salt, pepper, yogurt, pomegranate molasses, lemon juice, olive oil, pita, flatbread, hummus, mint yogurt sauce, red onions

fields.title: Vegan Tofu Shawarma
fields.ingredients:
- 1 block firm tofu, pressed and sliced
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 tsp smoked paprika
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp ground coriander
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 3 tbsp olive oil
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- Pita bread, for serving
- Tahini sauce, pickles, lettuce, and tomatoes, for serving
fields.instructions:
1. In a bowl, combine garlic, spices, salt, pepper, olive oil, and lemon juice.
2. Add tofu slices and marinate for at least 1 hour.
3. Pan-fry the tofu slices until golden and crispy on both sides.
4. Serve in pita with tahini sauce, pickles, lettuce, and tomatoes.
fields.ingredient_tags: tofu, garlic , smoked paprika, cumin, coriander, salt, pepper, olive oil, lemon juice, pita bread, tahini sauce, pickles, lettuce, tomatoes

fields.title: Classic Beef Tacos
fields.ingredients:
- 500g ground beef
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 packet taco seasoning or homemade mix
- Taco shells
- Grated cheddar cheese
- Lettuce, shredded
- Tomatoes, diced
- Salsa
- Sour cream
fields.instructions:
1. In a skillet, saut\u00e9 onions until translucent. Add garlic and cook for a minute.
2. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Drain excess fat.
3. Sprinkle taco seasoning and stir well. Add a bit of water if needed.
4. Warm taco shells as per package instructions.
5. Fill each taco shell with beef, cheese, lettuce, and tomatoes.
6. Top with salsa and sour cream.
fields.ingredient_tags: beef, onion, garlic cloves, taco seasoning, taco shells, cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, salsa, sour cream

fields.title: Grilled Chicken Tacos
fields.ingredients:
- 500g chicken breast, sliced into thin strips
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 tsp chili powder
- 1 tsp cumin
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Taco shells
- Avocado slices
- Red cabbage, shredded
- Lime wedges
- Fresh cilantro, chopped
- Salsa verde
fields.instructions:
1. Marinate chicken strips in olive oil, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper for at least an hour.
2. Grill chicken until cooked through.
3. Warm taco shells.
4. Fill each shell with grilled chicken, avocado slices, and red cabbage.
5. Garnish with cilantro and squeeze lime over the top. Serve with salsa verde.
fields.ingredient_tags: chicken breast, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, salt, pepper, taco shells, avocado slices, red cabbage, lime wedges, cilantro, salsa verde

fields.title: Vegetarian Black Bean Tacos
fields.ingredients:
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tsp smoked paprika
- 1 tsp cumin
- Salt to taste
- Taco shells
- Grated cheese (optional)
- Lettuce, shredded
- Pico de gallo
fields.instructions:
1. Saut\u00e9 onions and bell pepper until softened.
2. Add garlic, paprika, and cumin. Cook for another minute.
3. Add black beans and cook until heated through.
4. Fill taco shells with the bean mixture, cheese, lettuce, and pico de gallo.
fields.ingredient_tags: black beans, onion, bell pepper, garlic cloves, smoked paprika, cumin, salt, taco shells, cheese, lettuce, pico de gallo

fields.title: Beef goulash
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb stewing beef, cubed
1 onion, chopped
2 teaspoons sunflower oil
175ml/6fl oz beer
175ml/6fl oz water
50ml/2fl oz tomato pur\u00e9e
1 tablespoon paprika
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon caraway seeds
450g/1lb potatoes
225g/8oz canned sauerkraut
2 tablespoons snipped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
fields.instructions:
1.In a frying pan, cook the beef and onion in the oil until the beef is
brown. Add the beer, water, tomato pur\u00e9e, paprika, salt and caraway
seeds. Cover and simmer for 1 1\u20444\u201311
\u20442 hours.
2. Add the potatoes, undrained sauerkraut and parsley to the pan. Cook,
covered, for about 20 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Remove
the lid from the pan and cook, uncovered, for a further 10 minutes or
until the mixture is thickened and most of the liquid has evaporated.
3. Serve hot with rice.
fields.ingredient_tags: beef, onion, sunflower oil, beer, water, tomato pur\u00e9e, paprika, salt, caraway seeds, potatoes, sauerkraut, flat-leaf parsley

fields.title: Beef fajitas
fields.ingredients:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 onion, cut into strips
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 tablespoon Mexican chilli powder
450g/1lb minced beef
75g/3oz ready-prepared salsa
1 red pepper, seeded and chopped
1 green pepper, seeded and
chopped
1 courgette, thinly sliced
4 x 25cm/10in flour tortillas
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
2. In a non-stick frying pan, heat the oil over a medium-high heat. Cook the
onion, garlic, chilli powder and seasoning, stirring, for 5 minutes or until
the onion is softened.
3. Add the beef and salsa, and cook, breaking up the beef with the back
of a spoon, for about 3 minutes until the beef is no longer pink. Add the
peppers and courgette, and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until the
liquid has evaporated.
4. Meanwhile, wrap the tortillas in foil and heat in the oven for 5 minutes
or until warmed through.
5. Divide the beef mixture among the tortillas, and roll up. Serve the fajitas
immediately while still piping hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, onion, garlic cloves, mexican chilli powder, minced beef, ready-prepared salsa, red pepper, green pepper, courgette, flour tortillas, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Orange beef with green peppers
fields.ingredients:
700g/1 1/2lb flank steak
175ml/6fl oz orange juice
3 tablespoons light soy sauce
2 tablespoons smooth peanut butter
11/2 tablespoons orange zest
2 garlic cloves (crushed)
11/2 teaspoons curry powder 1/2 teaspoon red wine vinegar
1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
2 green peppers, cut into 1cm/1/2 in
wide strips
fields.instructions:
1. Diagonally cut the beef, against the grain, into slices 1cm/1
\u20442in thick.
2. In a bowl, combine the orange juice, soy sauce, peanut butter, orange
zest, garlic, curry, vinegar and red pepper flakes. Stir to blend. Add the
beef and toss to coat evenly. Cover and set aside to marinate for
2 hours at room temperature.
3. Heat the oil in a heavy frying pan or wok over a high heat. Add the
marinated beef mixture. Stir-fry for 2 minutes. Remove the beef with a
slotted spoon and set aside on a plate.
4. Add the green peppers to the pan, then stir-fry for about 5 minutes until
the peppers are browned around the edges.
5. Return the beef to the pan, and stir-fry for a further 1 minute to heat
through. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: flank steak, orange juice, light soy sauce, smooth peanut butter, orange zest, garlic cloves, curry powder, red wine vinegar, red pepper flakes, vegetable oil, green peppers

fields.title: Spiced beef & onions
fields.ingredients:
50ml/2fl oz olive oil
700g/ 1 1/2lbbaby onions
900g/2lb chuck steak, trimmed and
cut into bite-size cubes
3 garlic cloves, halved lengthways
125ml/4fl oz red wine
1 cinnamon stick
4 cloves
1 bay leaf
1 tablespoon red wine vinegar
2 tablespoons tomato pur\u00e9e
375ml/13fl oz water
2 tablespoons currants
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
1. Heat the oil over a medium heat in a large heavy saucepan. Add the
onions and saut\u00e9, stirring, for 5 minutes or until golden. Remove from the
pan and drain on kitchen paper.
2. Add the meat to the pan, and stir over a high heat for 10 minutes or
until the meat is well browned and almost all the liquid has evaporated.
3. Add the garlic, wine, spices, bay leaf, vinegar and tomato pur\u00e9e.
Season with salt and pepper. Pour 375ml/13fl oz water into the pan,
and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 1 hour,
stirring occasionally.
4. Return the onions to the saucepan, add the currants and stir gently.
Simmer, covered, for 15 minutes. Discard the cinnamon before serving.
fields.ingredient_tags: olive oil, baby onions, chuck steak, garlic cloves, red wine, cinnamon stick, cloves, bay leaf, red wine vinegar, tomato pur\u00e9e, water, currants, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Thai beef curry
fields.ingredients:
1 tablespoon tamarind pulp
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
700g/1 1/2lb stewing beef (cubed)
500ml/18fl oz coconut milk
4 cardamom pods, bruised
500ml/18fl oz coconut cream
2 tablespoons curry paste
2 tablespoons Thai fish sauce
8 pickling onions
8 baby potatoes
2 tablespoons granulated sugar
75g/3oz unsalted peanuts, roasted
and ground
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the tamarind pulp and 125ml/4fl oz boiling water in a bowl, and
set aside to cool. Mash the pulp with your fingertips to dissolve it, then
strain and reserve the liquid, discarding the pulp.
\u2022 Heat a non-stick wok over a high heat, add the oil and swirl to coat.
Add the beef in batches, and stir-fry over a high heat for 5 minutes for
each batch or until browned all over. Reduce the heat, add the coconut
milk and cardamom pods, and simmer for 1 hour or until the beef is
tender. Remove the beef from the wok, then strain the cooking liquid into
a bowl and keep to one side.
\u2022 Heat the coconut cream in the wok, and stir in the curry paste. Cook for
10 minutes or until the oil starts to separate from the cream. Add the fish
sauce, onions, potatoes, beef mixture, sugar, peanuts, tamarind water
and the reserved cooking liquid. Simmer for 25\u201330 minutes until the
meat is tender. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: tamarind pulp, vegetable oil, stewing beef, coconut milk, cardamom pods, coconut cream, curry paste, thai fish sauce, pickling onions, baby potatoes, granulated sugar, unsalted peanuts

fields.title: Fillet of beef with porcini & sweet peppers
fields.ingredients:
1.4kg/3lb trimmed beef fillet
25g/1oz dried porcini mushrooms,
soaked and drained
250g/9oz jar sliced red and
yellow peppers in oil, drained
375g/13oz pancetta slices
2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
2 teaspoons plain flour
150ml/5fl oz Italian red wine
300ml/10fl oz beef stock
2 tablespoons Marsala
2 teaspoons dried mixed herbs
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0C/375\u00b0F/Gas mark 5.
2. Cut a slit along the side of the fillet, keeping both ends attached. Open it
out with your fingers a little, to make a pocket.
3. Roughly chop the porcini, reserving half for the sauce. Mix the
remainder with half of the peppers, and use to fill the pocket in the beef.
Grind black pepper over the meat, then wrap the pancetta around the
fillet to enclose it completely. Tie with string at regular intervals.
4. Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan, add the meat and sear on all
sides. Lift the fillet out of the oil, draining over the pan. Reserve the
juices in the pan for the sauce.
5. Transfer the fillet to a roasting tin, and roast in the oven for 45 minutes.
Remove from the oven, cover with foil and leave to rest in a warm place
for 10\u201315 minutes.
6. Meanwhile, reheat the reserved juices in the frying pan, sprinkle in the
flour and cook, stirring, over a medium heat for 2\u20133 minutes. Gradually
stir in the red wine and the stock, then bring to the boil, stirring. Reduce
the heat and add the Marsala and mixed herbs. Season with salt and
pepper, and simmer until thickened, stirring constantly.
7. Add the remaining peppers and porcini, and heat through.
8. Remove the string from the beef fillet and carve the meat into neat slices.
Using a slotted spoon, remove the peppers and onions from the sauce
and use to garnish the meat. Serve immediately, drizzled with the sauce.
fields.ingredient_tags: beef fillet, dried porcini mushrooms, sliced red and yellow peppers in oil, pancetta slices, extra virgin olive oil, plain flour, italian red wine, beef stock, marsala, dried mixed herbs, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Beef Wellington
fields.ingredients:
1.6kg/3 1/2lb beef fillet, larded and
tied with string
350g/12oz mushrooms, finely
chopped
50g/2oz butter
225g/8oz p\u00e2t\u00e9 de foie gras
450g/1lb puff pastry
1 egg white, whisked lightly
1 large egg yolk, beaten with
1 teaspoon water
125ml/4fl oz Madeira
2 teaspoons arrowroot, dissolved in
1 tablespoon cold water
125ml/4fl oz beef stock
2 tablespoons finely chopped
black truffles
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6. In a roasting tin, roast the
beef in the middle of the oven for 25\u201330 minutes. Turn off the oven and
allow the beef to cool completely, then discard the larding fat and strings.
Skim the fat from the pan juices; reserve the juices.
2. In a heavy frying pan, cook the mushrooms in butter over a medium-low
heat, stirring, until all liquid has evaporated and the mixture is dry. Season
with salt and pepper and allow to cool completely.
3. Spread the beef evenly with the foie gras, covering the top and sides, and
spread the mushrooms evenly over the foie gras.
\u20224. On a floured work surface, roll the puff pastry into a rectangle of about
50cm/20in x 30.5cm/12in or large enough to enclose the beef
completely. Invert the beef in the middle of the pastry, and fold up the long
sides to enclose it, brushing the edges of the pastry with some egg white to
seal. Fold the ends of the pastry over the beef; seal with the egg white.
5. Transfer the beef, seam side down, to a baking tin, and brush the pastry
with the egg yolk wash. Chill for at least 1 hour.
6. Preheat the oven 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6. Bake the fillet in the middle
of the oven for 30 minutes. Reduce the heat to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4,
and bake for a further 5\u201310 minutes until the pastry is cooked through.
Leave to stand for 15 minutes.
7. In a saucepan, boil the reserved pan juices and the Madeira until the
mixture is reduced by a quarter. Add the arrowroot mixture, stock and
truffles. Season with salt and pepper. Cook the sauce over a medium heat,
stirring, for 5 minutes or until thickened, being careful not to let it boil.
Serve the beef cut into thick slices, accompanied by the sauce.
fields.ingredient_tags: beef fillet, mushrooms, butter, p\u00e2t\u00e9 de foie gras, puff pastry, egg white, egg yolk, madeira, arrowroot, beef stock, black truffles, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Crispy shredded beef
fields.ingredients:
2 eggs
1/4  teaspoon salt
4 tablespoons plain flour
350g/12oz beef rump steak, cut
into thin strips
vegetable oil for deep-frying
2 carrots, finely shredded
2 spring onions, thinly shredded
1 garlic clove, finely chopped
3 small fresh red chillies, seeded
and thinly sliced
4 tablespoons granulated sugar
3 tablespoons rice vinegar
1 tablespoon light soy sauce
2 tablespoons beef stock
1 teaspoon cornflour
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Beat the eggs in a bowl with the salt and flour, adding a little water if
necessary to make a batter.
\u2022 Add the beef to the batter, and mix well until coated.
\u2022 Heat a wok over a high heat, then add the oil and heat until smoking.
Add the beef and deep-fry for 5 minutes, stirring to separate the strips.
Remove with a slotted spoon, and drain on kitchen paper.
\u2022 Add the carrots to the wok, and deep-fry to about 1\u201311
\u20442 minutes, then
remove with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper.
\u2022 Pour off the excess oil, leaving about 1 tablespoon in the wok. Add the
spring onions, garlic, chillies and deep-fried carrots, and stir-fry for
1 minute. Add the sugar, vinegar, soy sauce and stock to the wok, and
bring to the boil. Stir in the cornflour, and simmer for a few minutes to
thicken the sauce.
\u2022 Return the beef to the wok, and stir until well coated with the sauce.
Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: eggs, salt, plain flour, beef rump steak, vegetable oil, carrots, spring onions, garlic clove, fresh red chillies, granulated sugar, rice vinegar, light soy sauce, beef stock, cornflour

fields.title: Beef stroganoff
fields.ingredients:
15g/1/2oz dried porcini mushrooms
2 tablespoons olive oil
100g/4oz shallots, sliced
175g/6oz chestnut mushrooms
350g/12oz beef fillet, cut into
5mm/ 1/4in slices) 1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard
75ml/3fl oz double cream
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the porcini mushrooms in a bowl, cover with hot water and leave to
soak for 20 minutes. Drain, reserving the soaking liquid, and chop the
porcini. Sieve the soaking liquid through a fine-mesh sieve and reserve.
\u2022 Heat half the oil in a large frying pan. Add the shallots, and cook over a
low heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add the
porcini, reserved soaking water and chestnut mushrooms. Cook, stirring
frequently, for 10 minutes or until almost all of the liquid has evaporated,
then transfer the mixture to a plate.
\u2022 Heat the remaining oil in the frying pan, add the beef (in batches if
necessary to avoid crowding the pan) and cook, stirring frequently, for
4 minutes or until browned. Return the mushroom mixture to the frying
pan, and season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Put the mustard and cream in a small bowl and stir to mix, then fold into
the mixture. Heat through and serve.
fields.ingredient_tags: dried porcini mushrooms, olive oil, shallots, chestnut mushrooms, beef fillet, dijon mustard, double cream, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Chilli beef in tortillas
fields.ingredients:
For the tortillas
850g/13 1/4lb plain flour
4 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
4 tablespoons vegetable oil
For the filling
3 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 large onion, finely chopped
2 teaspoons dried oregano
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1 teaspoon chilli powder
1 teaspoon paprika
850g/13 1/4lb minced beef
1 green pepper, seeded and finely
chopped
2 garlic cloves, crushed
50g/2oz tomato pur\u00e9e
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To make the tortillas, mix the flour and baking powder with the salt. Mix
in the oil using a fork, then add enough lukewarm water to enable you
to gather the dough into a ball with your hands. Knead lightly to smooth,
then leave covered in the bowl for at least 20 minutes.
\u2022 Divide the dough into 24 balls, and roll out each one on a lightly floured
surface into a thin pancake, or tortilla.
\u2022 Heat a non-stick frying pan without any oil, and cook each tortilla until
the top surface bubbles up. Puncture the blisters and turn to cook the
other side. Wrap the tortillas in a clean cloth to keep warm.
\u2022 Meanwhile, to make the filling, heat the oil and sweat the onion gently
with the oregano, cumin, chilli powder and paprika until the onion is just
soft. Add the beef, green pepper and garlic, and stir gently using a
wooden spoon until the meat changes colour and breaks into granules.
\u2022 Put the tomato pur\u00e9e into a bowl, and mix with its own volume of cold
water. Stir into the meat and cook, covered, for about 10 minutes. Serve
hot with the warm tortillas.
fields.ingredient_tags: plain flour, baking powder, salt, vegetable oil, onion, dried oregano, ground cumin, chilli powder, paprika, minced beef, green pepper, garlic cloves, tomato pur\u00e9e

fields.title: Beef & pumpkin curry
fields.ingredients:
3 tablespoons sesame oil
2 teaspoons dried chilli flakes
1 teaspoon ground turmeric
600g/ 1 1/2 lb sirloin steak, cut into
2.5cm/1in cubes
300ml/10fl oz beef stock
1 teaspoon soft brown sugar
450g/1lb pumpkin, peeled, seeded
and cut into 2.5cm/1in cubes 1
\u20442 teaspoon salt
For the spice paste
2 large onions, chopped
4 garlic cloves, chopped
2 stalks lemon grass, tough outer
layer removed, chopped
2.5cm/1in piece of fresh root ginger,
chopped
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put all the ingredients for the spice paste in a blender or food processor,
and work into a coarse paste.
\u2022 Heat the oil in a large flameproof casserole dish, add the spice paste
and fry over a gentle heat, stirring for about 5 minutes until softened
and aromatic. Add the chilli flakes and turmeric, and fry for a further
2 minutes.
\u2022 Add the steak to the pan, stir well to coat in the spice mixture and fry,
stirring frequently, for 5 minutes. Add the stock and sugar to the curry,
and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat, cover the pan and cook, stirring
occasionally, for 35 minutes or until the steak is tender.
\u2022 Add the pumpkin and salt to the pan, and stir gently to mix. Cover and
cook for a further 10 minutes or until the pumpkin is tender. Adjust the
seasoning to taste. Serve hot
fields.ingredient_tags: vegetable oil, dried chilli flakes, ground turmeric, sirloin steak, beef stock, soft brown sugar, pumpkin, salt, onion, garlic cloves, lemon grass, fresh root ginger

fields.title: Asparagus & bean beef
fields.ingredients:
225g/8oz beef, cut across the grain
into thin slices 1/4 teaspoon baking powder,
dissolved in 2 teaspoons water
1 tablespoon groundnut oil
1/2 teaspoon salt
450g/1lb asparagus
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 tablespoon Chinese fermented
black beans, minced with
4 garlic cloves
1 tablespoon rice wine
2 teaspoons light soy sauce
For the marinade
1 teaspoon cornflour
1 teaspoon light soy sauce
1/2 teaspoon rice wine
1/2 teaspoon granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the beef in a bowl or glass dish. Stir the baking powder solution into
the beef to help tenderize it. Stir together the marinade ingredients, and
marinate the beef for 1 hour in the refrigerator.
\u2022 In a heavy pan, heat the groundnut oil over a high heat. Add the salt,
asparagus and 50ml/2fl oz water. Cover the pan for 2 minutes and
cook. When done, transfer the asparagus to a platter.
\u2022 Place the pan over a high heat, and add the vegetable oil. Stir-fry the
black bean and garlic mixture for a few seconds.
\u2022 Add the beef and stir-fry quickly until barely cooked. Add the rice wine
and soy sauce, and heat until sizzling. Stir in the asparagus and toss
quickly to heat through. Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: beef, baking powder, groundnut oil, salt, asparagus, vegetable oil, chinese fermented black beans, rice wine, light soy sauce, cornflour

fields.title: Steak, kidney & mushroom pie
fields.ingredients:
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
100g/4oz bacon, chopped
1 onion, chopped
500g/1lb 2oz chuck steak, diced
2 tablespoons plain flour
100g/4oz lamb\u2019s kidneys
1 bouquet garni
400ml/14fl oz beef stock
100g/4oz button mushrooms
225g/8oz ready-made puff pastry
beaten egg, to glaze
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 170\u00b0C/325\u00b0F/Gas mark 3.
\u2022 Heat the oil in a heavy pan, add the bacon and onion, and saut\u00e9,
stirring, until lightly browned. Toss the steak in the flour, add to the pan
in batches and saut\u00e9, stirring, until browned.
\u2022 Toss the kidneys in the flour, and add to the pan with the bouquet garni.
Saut\u00e9 until browned.
\u2022 Transfer the mixture to a casserole dish, then pour in the stock, cover
and cook in the oven for 2 hours.
\u2022 Remove from the oven, stir in the mushrooms and season with salt and
pepper. Leave to cool.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 220\u00b0C/425\u00b0F/Gas mark 7. Roll out the pastry to
2cm/1in larger than the top of a 1.2 litre/2pt pie dish. Cut off a strip
and fit around the dampened rim of the dish to make a collar. Brush the
pastry with water.
\u2022 Tip the meat mixture into the dish. Lay the pastry round over the dish and
press the edges together to seal. Knock up the edges with the back of a
knife. Make a small slit in the pastry, brush with the beaten egg and
bake in the oven for 20 minutes.
\u2022 Reduce the oven temperature to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas 4, and bake for a
further 20 minutes. Serve hot
fields.ingredient_tags: porcini mushrooms, olive oil, shallots, chestnut mushrooms, beef fillet, dijon mustard, double cream, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Beef daube
fields.ingredients:
25g/1oz butter
1 large onion, cut into wedges
2 celery sticks, chopped
1 green pepper, seeded and
chopped
450g/1lb sirloin steak, trimmed and
cut into strips
1kg/2 1/2 lb lean braising steak, cubed
50g/2oz plain flour, seasoned with
salt and black pepper
600ml/1pt beef stock
2 garlic cloves, crushed
150ml/5fl oz red wine
2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
2 tablespoons tomato pur\u00e9e
1/2 teaspoon Tabasco sauce
1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme
2 bay leaves
1/2 teaspoon Cajun spice mix
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Heat the butter in a large heavy casserole dish. Add the onion wedges
and saut\u00e9 until browned on all sides. Remove with a slotted spoon and
set aside.
\u2022 Add the celery and pepper to the dish, and cook until softened. Remove
the vegetables with a slotted spoon and set aside.
\u2022 Coat the meat in the seasoned flour, add to the pan and saut\u00e9 until
browned on all sides. Add the stock, garlic, wine, vinegar, tomato
pur\u00e9e, Tabasco and thyme, and heat gently.
\u2022 Return the onions, celery and pepper to the pan. Tuck in the bay leaves
and sprinkle with the Cajun seasoning.
\u2022 Bring to the boil, transfer to the oven and cook for 3 hours or until the
meat and vegetables are tender. Serve with French bread.
fields.ingredient_tags:
beef joint, red wine, reduced beef stock, salt, black pepper.
for the yorkshire pudding: plain flour, salt, cold milk, eggs, beef dripping

fields.title: Beef & pork rag\u00f9
fields.ingredients:
15g/ 1/2 oz dried porcini mushrooms
225g/8oz boneless beef chuck,
trimmed of all fat
225g/8oz lean boneless pork,
trimmed of all fat
50g/2oz butter
3 shallots, chopped
1 celery stick, finely chopped
1 carrot, finely chopped
2 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
1 tablespoon flour
175ml/6fl oz beef stock
150ml/5fl oz dry white wine
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Soak the porcini mushrooms in 250ml/9fl oz warm water for
30 minutes. Drain the porcini, reserving the liquid and squeezing excess
water out of the porcini and into the bowl. Chop the porcini. Strain the
soaking liquid and reserve.
\u2022 Cut the beef and pork into 1cm/1
\u20442in dice.
\u2022 Melt the butter in a large pan over a medium-low heat. Add the shallots,
celery, carrot and porcini mushrooms. Increase the heat to medium and
saut\u00e9 for about 5 minutes until lightly coloured. Stir in the parsley.
\u2022 Reduce the heat and add the meat. Brown lightly on all sides. Stir in the
flour, pour in the reserved porcini liquid, beef stock and wine, and
season with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Stir, cover and simmer very gently for 21
\u20442\u20133 hours, stirring occasionally,
until the meat begins to disintegrate and the sauce thickens. Serve hot
with freshly cooked pasta.
fields.ingredient_tags:
butter, minced beef, onion, garlic cloves, bulgur wheat, parmesan cheese, celery stick, horseradish sauce, tomato pur\u00e9e, instant oatmeal, chopped fresh thyme.
for the relish: horseradish sauce, sour cream

fields.title: Roast beef & Yorkshire pudding
fields.ingredients:
1.8kg/4lb joint of beef
splash of red wine
300ml/10fl oz reduced beef stock
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
For the Yorkshire pudding
175g/6oz plain flour
1 teaspoon salt
300ml/10fl oz cold milk
3 eggs, beaten
60g/ 2 1/2oz beef dripping
fields.instructions:
\u2022 To prepare the Yorkshire pudding batter, sift the flour into a mixing
bowl with the salt. In another large bowl, mix together the milk and
150ml/10fl oz water, and whisk with the beaten eggs. Add this to the
flour in a thin stream, whisking to a smooth batter. Leave to stand for
60 minutes at room temperature.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 240\u00b0C/475\u00b0F/Gas mark 9.
\u2022 Season the joint of beef heavily with salt and pepper, rubbing it in all
over. Sit the joint on a rack in a roasting tin, and roast in the oven for
25 minutes, then reduce the temperature to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6
and continue roasting for a further 25 minutes. It is important not to
open the oven door for more than a few seconds at any time from start
to finish.
\u2022 Remove the meat from the oven and allow to rest on its rack for about
30 minutes in a warm place, covered with foil. Increase the oven
temperature to 230\u00b0C/450\u00b0F/Gas mark 8.
\u2022 While the meat is resting, cook the Yorkshire pudding. Put the beef
dripping into a metal pan at least 6.5cm/21
\u20442in deep, and put in the
oven until smoking hot. Give the prepared batter a final whisk, and pour
into the fat. Bake for 25\u201330 minutes, when the pudding will be well
risen with a crisp, golden crust.
\u2022 Make a gravy by pouring off the fat from the roasting tin. Place the pan
over a high heat, and deglaze it with a splash of red wine. Add the
stock and boil fiercely, scraping the stuck-on sediment with a wooden
spoon. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
\u2022 Serve the roast beef cut in slices, accompanied by the gravy, Yorkshire
pudding and roasted vegetables.
fields.ingredient_tags: beef olives, fresh flat-leaf parsley, garlic cloves, smoked streaky bacon, orange zest, olive oil, dry red wine, bay leaf, granulated sugar, pitted black olives, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Meatloaf
fields.ingredients:
25g/1oz butter
450g/1lb minced beef
1 onion, chopped
2 garlic cloves, crushed
50g/2oz bulgur wheat, soaked
25g/1oz Parmesan cheese
1 celery stick trimmed and sliced
2 tablespoons horseradish sauce
2 tablespoons tomato pur\u00e9e
2 tablespoons instant oatmeal
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
thyme leaves
salt and freshly ground
black pepper
For the relish
2 tablespoons horseradish sauce
150ml/5fl oz sour cream
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Grease and line the bottom of a 700g/11
\u20442lb loaf tin. Preheat the oven to
180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 Melt the butter in a large pan, and add the minced beef, onion and
garlic. Saut\u00e9, stirring, for 7 minutes until the meat is brown and sealed.
\u2022 Transfer the mixture to a bowl, and add the remaining ingredients. Mix
well, season and spoon into the prepared tin. Cover with foil.
\u2022 Stand the loaf tin in a roasting tin, and add 2.5cm/1in of water.
Carefully place in the oven and cook for 11
\u20442 hours.
\u2022 Mix together the relish ingredients in a bowl. Turn out the meatloaf and
garnish with the fresh thyme. Serve with fresh vegetables and the relish
as a condiment.
fields.ingredient_tags: rump or sirloin steak, cherry tomatoes, green olives, olive oil, sherry vinegar, garlic clove, salt, black pepper, plum tomatoes, olive oil, red onion, garlic clove, fresh flat-leaf parsley, lemon juice

fields.title: Beef olives in gravy
fields.ingredients:
8 ready-prepared beef olives
4 tablespoons chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
4 garlic cloves, finely chopped
4 rashers smoked streaky bacon,
finely chopped
grated zest of 1/2 small orange
2 tablespoons olive oil
300ml/10fl oz dry red wine
1 bay leaf
1 teaspoon granulated sugar
50g/2oz pitted black olives,
drained
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Flatten out the beef olives as thinly as possible, using a meat tenderizer
or mallet.
\u2022 Mix together the parsley, garlic, bacon and orange zest. Season with
salt and pepper. Spread this mixture evenly over each beef olive. Roll up
each beef olive tightly, then secure with a cocktail stick or toothpick.
\u2022 Heat the oil in a frying pan, and saut\u00e9 the beef olives on all sides for
10 minutes until browned.
\u2022 Drain the beef olives, reserving the pan juices, and keep warm. Pour the
wine into the juices, add the bay leaf and sugar. Season with salt and
pepper. Bring to the boil, and boil rapidly for 5 minutes to reduce
slightly, stirring.
\u2022 Return the cooked beef olives to the pan along with the black olives, and
heat through for a further 2 minutes. Discard the bay leaf and carefully
pull out the cocktail sticks or toothpicks.
\u2022 Transfer the beef olives and gravy to a serving dish. Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: porcini mushrooms, boneless beef chuck, lean boneless pork, butter, shallots, celery stick, carrot, chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, flour, beef stock, dry white wine, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Beef, tomato & olive kebabs
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb rump or sirloin steak
16 cherry tomatoes
16 large green olives, pitted
For the baste
4 tablespoons olive oil
1 tablespoon sherry vinegar
1 garlic clove, crushed
salt and freshly ground black pepper
For the relish
6 plum tomatoes
1 tablespoon olive oil
1
1/2 red onion, finely chopped
1 garlic clove, chopped
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
1 tablespoon freshly squeezed
lemon juice
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Soak 8 bamboo skewers in cold water for at least 30 minutes to prevent
them burning.
\u2022 Using a sharp knife, trim any fat from the steak, and cut the meat into
roughly 24 evenly sized pieces.
\u2022 Thread the pieces of steak onto the skewers, alternating the beef with the
cherry tomatoes and the green olives.
\u2022 To make the baste, combine all the baste ingredients in a bowl.
\u2022 To make the relish, plunge the tomatoes in a bowl of boiling water, then
drain and transfer to a bowl of cold water. Peel off and discard the skin,
and chop the flesh.
\u2022 Heat the oil in a small pan, and saut\u00e9 the onion and garlic for
3\u20134 minutes until softened. Add the tomatoes and cook for a further
2\u20133 minutes. Stir in the parsley and lemon juice, and season with salt
and pepper. Set aside and keep warm.
\u2022 Barbecue the kebabs over hot coals for 5\u201310 minutes, basting and
turning frequently. Serve with the relish.
fields.ingredient_tags:
beef joint, red wine, reduced beef stock, salt, black pepper.
for the yorkshire pudding: plain flour, salt, cold milk, eggs, beef dripping

fields.title: Beef & mushroom burgers
fields.ingredients:
1 small onion, chopped
150g/5oz small cup mushrooms
450g/1lb lean minced beef
50g/2oz fresh wholemeal
breadcrumbs
1 teaspoon dried mixed herbs
1 tablespoon tomato pur\u00e9e
flour for shaping
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the onion and mushrooms in a blender or food processor, and whiz
until finely chopped. Add the beef, breadcrumbs, herbs and tomato
pur\u00e9e, and season with salt and pepper. Blend for a few seconds until
the mixture binds together but still has some texture.
\u2022 Divide the mixture into 8 to 10 pieces, then press into burger shapes
using lightly floured hands.
\u2022 Cook the burgers in a non-stick frying pan or under a hot grill for
12\u201315 minutes, turning once, until evenly cooked. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: margarine or butter, loin veal chops, onion, mushroom caps, white onions, plain flour, tomato pur\u00e9e, chicken stock, dry white wine, chopped fresh chives, chopped fresh tarragon, chopped fresh basil, bay leaf, chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley

fields.title: Veal Marsala
fields.ingredients:
2 veal escalopes
flour for dredging
1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, crumbled
8 field mushrooms, stalks removed
and caps thinly sliced
about 25g/1oz butter
2 tablespoons olive or sunflower oil
150ml/5fl oz Marsala
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 If necessary, put the veal escalopes between two sheets of greaseproof
paper or cling film, and gently pound with a meat mallet or wooden
rolling pin to flatten. Trim any rough edges if necessary.
\u2022 Put enough flour for dredging in a shallow bowl or plate. Season with
salt and pepper, and the oregano. Dredge the escalopes in the
seasoned flour, gently shaking off any excess. (If you like, you can omit
this step, and simply season the veal without dredging in the flour.)
\u2022 Put the oil and a knob of butter in a heavy frying pan over a medium
heat. When the butter has melted and is starting to foam (do not allow
to burn), add the escalopes and fry for 2 minutes on each side. Remove
to a plate, cover with foil and keep warm.
\u2022 Pour the Marsala into the pan and boil it down, deglazing the pan by
scraping up any bits stuck to the pan using a wooden spoon. Add the
cooked mushrooms and toss through.
\u2022 Put an escalope on each of two serving plates, pour over the mushroom
sauce and serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: pork loin, strong espresso coffee, single cream, port, granulated sugar, cornflour

fields.title: Veal chops & mushrooms
fields.ingredients:
25g/1oz margarine or butter
4 lean loin veal chops
1 onion, chopped
450g/1lb mushroom caps
225g/8oz white onions
1 tablespoon plain flour
1 tablespoon tomato pur\u00e9e
175ml/6fl oz chicken stock
150ml/5fl oz dry white wine
50g/2oz chopped fresh chives
1 teaspoon chopped fresh tarragon
1 teaspoon chopped fresh basil
1 small bay leaf
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 170\u00b0C/325\u00b0F/Gas mark 3.
\u2022 Melt the margarine or butter in a large heavy frying pan. Add the veal
chops and brown over a high heat. Transfer to a shallow casserole dish.
\u2022 In the same frying pan, saut\u00e9 the onions. Add the remaining ingredients
except the parsley. Cover the pan and cook for 5 minutes.
\u2022 Pour the mixture over the chops. Cover the casserole dish and bake in
the oven for 1 hour. Sprinkle with the parsley before serving hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: unsmoked gammon on the bone, shallots, cloves, bay leaves, celery sticks, english mustard, fresh root ginger, dark muscovado sugar, clear honey, brandy

fields.title: Pork with port & coffee sauce
fields.ingredients:
1.8kg/4lb pork loin, boned
225ml/8fl oz strong espresso coffee
125ml/4fl oz single cream
75ml/3fl oz port
2 teaspoons granulated sugar
2 teaspoons cornflour
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat oven to 180\u00b0C/350\u00b0F/Gas mark 4.
\u2022 Remove the rind from the pork and trim the fat to make a 1cm/1
\u20442in layer.
Roll and tie the meat with string. Put the meat in a roasting tin, and roast
in the oven for 30 minutes.
\u2022 Combine the coffee, half the cream, half the port and the sugar, and
pour over the pork. Continue roasting the pork for 11
\u20442 hours, basting it
every 15 minutes with the coffee mixture.
\u2022 Remove the pork from the oven when cooked. Keep covered in a warm
place while making the sauce. Skim off the fat from the pan juices, and
transfer the juices to a small saucepan. Add 50ml/2fl oz water, the
remaining cream and port, and the cornflour. Cook until thickened, then
strain. Slice the pork thinly and drizzle with sauce. Serve immediately.
fields.ingredient_tags: pork tenderloin, cider, light muscovado sugar, dijon mustard, garlic cloves, rosemary sprigs, olive oil, lemon zest and juice, golden sultanas, dessert apples, salt, black pepper

fields.title:
Ginger &
honey-glazed gammon
fields.ingredients:
4.5\u20136.8kg/10\u201315lb unsmoked
gammon on the bone
2 shallots, peeled and halved
6 cloves
3 bay leaves
2 celery sticks, cut into 5cm/2in
lengths
2 tablespoons English mustard
5cm/2in piece of fresh root ginger,
thinly sliced
For the glaze
225g/8oz dark muscovado sugar
2 tablespoons clear honey
125ml/4fl oz brandy
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Put the gammon in a heavy pan with the shallots, cloves, bay leaves,
celery and enough cold water to cover. Bring to the boil, cover and
simmer gently for about 5 hours. Skim off any scum using a slotted
spoon. Lift the ham out of the pan, discard the vegetables and herbs,
and allow the gammon cool.
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 200\u00b0C/400\u00b0F/Gas mark 6.
\u2022 Using a sharp knife, carefully cut away the gammon\u2019s thick skin to leave
an even layer of fat. Score a diamond pattern in the fat. Put the gammon
in a roasting tin, smother evenly with the mustard and tuck the ginger
into the scored fat.
\u2022 To make the glaze, put the sugar, honey and brandy in a pan, and heat
until the sugar has dissolved. Brush over the gammon.
\u2022 Cook the gammon in the oven for 30\u201340 minutes, basting every
10 minutes. Serve either hot or cold, cut into slices.
fields.ingredient_tags: pork tenderloin, lemon pepper, butter, freshly squeezed lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, chopped fresh parsley

fields.title: Chargrilled pork fillet with apple sauce
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb pork fillet, trimmed
150ml/5fl oz cider
1 tablespoon light muscovado sugar
1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
2 garlic cloves, crushed
2 sprigs of fresh rosemary sprigs,
bruised
2 tablespoons olive oil
finely grated zest and juice of
2 lemons
2 tablespoons golden sultanas
1 teaspoon chopped fresh
thyme leaves
2 dessert apples
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Trim the pork fillets of any fat, and cut into 1cm/1
\u20442in thick rounds before
placing in a bowl. Mix together half of the the cider with the sugar,
mustard, garlic, rosemary sprigs, oil, half of the lemon zest and
1 tablespoon of the lemon juice. Pour over the pork, and rub all over the
meat. Cover and chill until needed.
\u2022 To make the sauce, put the remaining lemon zest in a small mixing bowl
with 2 tablespoons lemon juice, the remaining cider, the sultanas and
thyme leaves. Peel, core and finely dice the apples, one at a time,
mixing them in as you go. Season with salt and pepper, and set aside.
\u2022 Preheat the grill until hot. Remove the meat from its marinade, and
season with salt and pepper. Cook the meat under the grill for 3 minutes
per side, removing as soon as it is just cooked through, so that it retains
its tenderness. Serve with the apple sauce.
fields.ingredient_tags: aubergines, minced pork, prawns, shallots, vegetable oil, garlic cloves, malt vinegar, thai fish sauce, canned cooked soya beans, granulated sugar, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Pork tenderloin Diane
fields.ingredients:
450g/1lb pork tenderloin, cut
crossways into 8 pieces
2 teaspoons lemon pepper
25g/1oz butter
2 tablespoons freshly squeezed
lemon juice
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Press each tenderloin piece into a 2.5cm/1in thick medallion, and
sprinkle the surfaces with lemon pepper.
\u2022 Melt the butter in large heavy- frying pan over a medium heat. Add the
medallions and cook for 3\u20134 minutes on each side. Remove from the
pan and place on a serving platter. Cover to keep warm.
\u2022 Stir the lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and mustard into the juices in
the pan. Cook, stirring, until heated through. Pour the sauce over the
medallions, and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: pork, onion powder, cranberry sauce, sugar, ginger, nutmeg, carrot, cornflour, parsley

fields.title: Aubergine with pork & prawns
fields.ingredients:
4 large aubergines
150g/5oz minced pork
200g/7oz prawns, peeled and
deveined
3 shallots, chopped
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
4 garlic cloves, crushed
1 tablespoon malt vinegar
1 tablespoon Thai fish sauce
2 tablespoons canned cooked soya
beans, rinsed
1 teaspoon granulated sugar
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 230\u00b0C/450\u00b0F/Gas mark 8. Cook the aubergines
whole in the oven or barbecue them directly over a strong heat until the
skins are burnt. Toss the aubergines into cold water, then peel and cut
the flesh into large pieces. Put the pieces in a serving dish.
\u2022 Mix the pork and prawns together. Season with salt and pepper, and
set aside.
\u2022 Saut\u00e9 the shallots in the oil until browned. Remove the shallots and drain
on kitchen papper. Use the oil remaining in the pan to saut\u00e9 the garlic.
When the garlic is soft and golden, add the pork and prawn mixture
and saut\u00e9 for a few minutes over a medium heat.
\u2022 Add the vinegar, fish sauce, soya beans and sugar, and mix in well.
Cover and cook for a few minutes. Top the aubergine pieces with the
pork and prawn mixture, and sprinkle with the sugar. Serve hot.
fields.ingredient_tags: boneless pork steaks, flour, butter, white wine vinegar, red wine, stilton cheese, salt, black pepper

fields.title: Baked cranberry pork chops
fields.ingredients:
4 pork chops
1 teaspoon onion powder
300ml/10fl oz cranberry sauce
2 tablespoons soft brown sugar
1 teaspoon ground ginger
pinch of ground nutmeg
250g/9oz carrots, cut into strips
1 teaspoon cornflour
1 tablespoon chopped fresh
flat-leaf parsley
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Preheat the oven to 190\u00b0C/375\u00b0F/Gas mark 5.
\u2022 Sprinkle the chops with the onion powder on both sides, and set aside.
\u2022 In a medium saucepan, heat the cranberry sauce, brown sugar, ginger,
nutmeg and 2 tablespoons water for about 2 minutes until the cranberry
sauce is melted.
\u2022 Put the carrots in a large casserole dish, and arrange the pork chops
over the carrots. Spoon the cranberry sauce mixture evenly over the pork
chops. Cover and bake the oven for about 45 minutes until the pork is
thoroughly cooked.
\u2022 Remove the chops to a serving plate and scatter the carrots over them.
\u2022 Pour the sauce remaining in the casserole into a medium saucepan.
\u2022 Combine the cornflour with 1 tablespoon water to make a paste. Stir into
the saucepan and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring, until sauce is clear
and thickened.
\u2022 Spoon over the pork chops and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: brown bean sauce, hoisin sauce, chicken stock, sugar, groundnut oil, garlic, onion, minced pork, noodles

fields.title: White pork with pak choi
fields.ingredients:
100g/4oz boneless pork shoulder
1 tablespoon cornflour
450g/1lb pak choi
3 tablespoons groundnut oil
1/2 teaspoon minced garlic
1/2 teaspoon minced fresh root ginger
1/4teaspoon salt
50ml/2fl oz chicken stock
1/2 teaspoon granulated sugar
1 teaspoon dry sherry
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Slice the pork against the grain into thin strips about 5cm/2in x
1cm/1
\u20442in. Combine the cornflour with 11
\u20442 tablespoons water to make
a paste.
\u2022 Separate the outer fleshy stalks from the centre stalk of the pak choi and
discard the centre stalk. Wash the outer stalks and diagonally slice into
8cm/3in pieces.
\u2022 Swirl the oil around in a very hot wok. When the oil begins to smoke,
add the pork and stir-fry for about 1 minute until the meat is seared. Add
the pak choi, garlic and ginger. Stir-fry until the green leaves are bright
and shrivelled, stirring constantly.
\u2022 Add the salt, stock, sugar and sherry. When the liquid begins to boil,
cover the wok and steam for 30 seconds or less on high heat, until the
stalks are tender but still crisp.
\u2022 Remove the meat and vegetables using a slotted spoon and set aside.
Stir the cornflour paste into the remaining cooking liquid to make a light
sauce. Serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: sesame oil, chilli flakes, turmeric, steak, beef stock, sugar, pumpkin, salt, onion, garlic, lemon grass, ginger

fields.title: Pork with Stilton
fields.ingredients:
350g/12oz boneless pork steaks,
cut into 1cm 1/2 in cubes
plain flour for coating
25g/1oz butter
1 tablespoon white wine vinegar
75ml/3fl oz red wine
75g/3oz Stilton cheese, crumbled
salt and freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
\u2022 Season the flour with salt and pepper. Dredge the pork thoroughly in the
seasoned flour. Heat the butter in a frying pan, and gently fry the pork
until lightly browned and cooked through. Remove from the pan using a
slotted spoon, and keep warm.
\u2022 Drain the fat from the pan and pour in the vinegar and wine. Stir,
scraping up all the meat residues, and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat
to very low, and stir in the Stilton until it has melted. Taste and season
with salt and pepper.
\u2022 Spoon the sauce over the pork, then serve immediately
fields.ingredient_tags: beef, baking powder, groundnut oil, salt, asparagus, vegetable oil, beans, soy sauce, cornflour, soy sauce, rice wine, sugar, salt

fields.title: Pork & brown bean sauce
fields.ingredients:
50ml/2fl oz brown bean sauce
2 tablespoons hoisin sauce
175ml/6fl oz chicken stock
1 1/2teaspoon granulated sugar
2 tablespoons groundnut oil
3 garlic cloves, finely chopped
6 spring onions, sliced, white and
green parts separated
650g/1lb 6oz minced pork
500g/1lb 2oz fresh noodles
fields.instructions:
\u2022 In a small bowl, combine the bean and hoisin sauces, stock and sugar,
and mix until smooth.
\u2022 Heat a wok over a high heat, add the oil and swirl. Add the garlic and
white part of the spring onions, and stir-fry for 15 seconds. Add the pork
and stir-fry over a high heat for 3 minutes or until the meat has browned.
Add the bean mixture, reduce the heat and simmer for 7\u20138 minutes.
\u2022 Meanwhile, cook the noodles in a large saucepan of boiling water for
4\u20135 minutes until tender. Drain and rinse, then serve with the pork.
fields.ingredient_tags: butter, minced beef, onion, flour, lamb\u2019s kidneys, bouquet garni, beef stock, button mushrooms, puff pastry, egg, salt, black pepper
